She has many plans for the future, such as installing a small shop in her home or in the zone marketplace because the area she has set aside in her home is a bit small.

This will be her third loan through MFP and she promises to make all of her payments on time because she does not want to be in a bad light with the people who provided the money to make it possible for her to continue advancing her business.

Dionicia will use the money from this loan to buy beauty products in quantity.  She wants to offer a larger variety to her customers.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Rosario Verónica

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Rosario, ella tiene 35 años de edad, esta casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 11 y 6 años, y  están estudiando  el mayor en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
 
Es una muy buena ama de casa que además de estar atenta en el cuidado de su hogar también se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño bazar en el cual además de ropa, zapatos y bisutería, también vende productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 18h00. Sus mercadería se la envían desde Guayaquil y Quito dos veces por mes. 

Este crédito es para comprar más productos como ropa,  bisutería, zapatos y  productos Yanbal. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 12 años y le gusta por las charlas educativas. Su sueño es tener un gran bazar.
texts.en:
The María Monserrate community bank meets every fortnight in Montecristi canton which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts which are well known both nationally and internationally.  It is the home of the famous Panama hat.

Here we meet 35 year-old Rosario.  She is married and has two children aged 11 and 6 who are both in school.  Her husband is a driver.

María is a very good housewife who, in addition to looking after her home, is also a saleswoman.  She has a small store where she sells clothes, shoes, jewelry and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works every day from 8.30am to 6.00pm.  Her merchandise is sent from Guayaquil and Quito twice a month.

This loan will be used to buy more products such as clothes, jewelry, shoes and Yanbal products.   María has been a member of her community bank for 12 years and she likes the educational talks which they provide.  Her dream is to have a bigger store.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes and Yanbal products

loans.name: Jose Abelardo

texts.es: El Señor Abelardo es un hombre muy dedicado a su hogar y su familia, el es pensionado desde hace varios años, tiene 55 años, pero siempre esta al pendiente de las necesidades de su casa, El y su esposa solicitan este credito para reparar la puerta trasera de su vivienda, ya que es corrediza y por causa de las lluvias y de los años, la puerta esta muy oxidada y deteriorada.
texts.en: Abelardo is a man who is very dedicated to his home and his family.  He has been on pension for several years and is 55 years.  However, he is always attentive to the household needs.  He and his wife are requesting this loan to repair the back door to their house since it is a sliding door and is very rusty and damaged due to the rain and its age.

loans.use: To repair the back door of the house

loans.name: Mercedes Eodosia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por 

La señora Mercedes  es socia fundadora  del Banco Comunal y está muy contenta  ya que gracias a los créditos recibidos de parte de la Fundación Espoir ha logrado sacar su negocio adelante,  además le gusta  la unión del grupo. Tiene 65 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y fruto de esta relación tiene 8 hijos todos mayores pero dos de ellos son solteros y aun viven con ella. Su marido trabaja en una fábrica en Montecristi.

Se dedica a la fabricación y venta de productos de paja toquilla, en especial le gusta elaborar canastas, también compra los sombreros de paja toquilla ha artesanos de la zona para luego ella venderlos a mejor precio a los turistas y comerciantes que los llevan a otras ciudades, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 15h00, dice que son muchos años que se dedica a esta actividad y que esto lo aprendió de sus padres.

Este crédito es para comprar paja toquilla para fabricar las canastas y sombreros  para la venta. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The 'María Monserrate' community bank meets every fortnight in Montecristo canton, an area which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture.

Mercedes is a founding member of her community bank and she is very happy since, thanks to the loans she has received from Fundación Espoir, she has managed to get ahead in her business.  She also likes the solidarity of her group.  Mercedes is 65 years old and lives with her partner.  From this relationship she has eight grown-up children of whom two are single and still live with her.  Her husband works in a factory in Montecristi.

Mercedes makes products from 'toquilla' straw and sells them.  In particular, she likes making baskets.  She also buys Panama hats (which are made from 'toquilla' straw) from craftspeople in the area and then sells them for a higher price to tourists and salespeople who take them to other cities.  She works every day from 8.00am to 3.00pm.  She says that she has been in this business for many years and she learned it from her parents.

This loan will be used to buy 'toquilla' straw to make baskets and hats to sell.  Mercedes' dreams are to continue working and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: To buy 'toquilla' straw and hats

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria De los Ángeles se dedica a venta de abarrotería y venta de comida. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita un crédito pues ha sido de mucho provecho. Inicio este negocio hace más de 5 años ella tenía la necesidad de generar ingresos a su hogar, que son muy indispensable desde muy joven le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse la vida de una manera muy humilde la mayoría de sus clientes son amigos, familiares, vecinos y público en general. El motivo del  financiamiento es para granos básicos, pan, detergentes, golosinas y refrescos.
texts.en: Maria De los Ángeles works selling groceries and food. This is not her first loan request, this service has been a great help to her. She began her business 5 years ago, when she needed to make money for household expenses. She has enjoyed working since she was young, earning a simple living. The majority of her customers are friends, neighbors, relatives and the general public. This funding will be used for basic grains, bread, detergents, sweets and soft drinks.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Margarita Del Rocio

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Margarita, ella tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos dos mayores y dos de 17 y 8 años, uno está en colegio y el menor en escuela y ellos viven con ella, los mayores ya son independientes.  Su esposo es albañil.

Es una ama de casa que también se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, también vende productos de la marca Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería, y accesorios para damas) ventas que realiza al mismo tiempo que hace la venta de ropa. Trabaja 4 días a la semana, deja a crédito y cobra los fines de semana. Su mercadería la compra en Picoaza.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa,  cremas, perfumes y bisutería. Este  es el quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le ha gustado el banco por la rapidez para conseguir los créditos. Su sueño es tener un bazar en su casa.
texts.en:
The Maria Monserrate Communal Bank meets every 15 days at Canton Montecristi, well-known nationally and internationally for its rich, pre-colonial history and its crafts, home of the famous Panama hats. 

Here we meet Ms. Margarita. She is 40 years old, married, with 4 children--2 older and 2 ages 17 and 8. One is in college and the other is in grade school, and they live with her. The older children are independent. Her husband works in construction.

She is a homemaker who also works. She sells clothes door-to-door. She also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women) at the same time. She works 4 days a week, selling on credit and collecting her payments on weekends. She purchases her merchandise in Picoaza.

This loan is for the purchase of clothes, creams, perfumes and costume jewelry. This is her fifth cycle in the Communal Bank, and she has enjoyed the bank because of the speed at which she receives loans. Her dream is to have a store in her home.

loans.use: Purchase clothes, creams, perfumes and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Ulda Maria

texts.es: Ulda Maria tiene 38 años, su actividad es la venta de abarrotería en general. Hace más de 9 años que tiene este negocio. Inicio vendiendo golosinas y así con el paso del tiempo fue aprendiendo y con el paso del tiempo fue que decidió establecer este medio de vida, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo ella es madre responsable pues siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar la atención con sus clientes. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos pues ella tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de pollo, leche, pan, jugos, golosinas y granos básicos.
texts.en:
Ulda María, 38, is a general grocer.  She has had this business for over 9 years.  She started out selling snacks and as time went by and she learned more about the business she decided to set up this means of support.  She has two minor children in her care.  She is a responsible mother that is always looking for a way to improve customer service.

This isn’t her first loan request; she has been a Fundación client for a long time.  The purpose of this loan is to buy chicken, milk, bread, juices, snacks and basic grains.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Wilmer Alberto

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Huaca Partida del distrito de Pítipo, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ferreñafe, a más de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores relacionadas con la agricultura desde hace más de diez años, por un lado el cuenta con un terreno agrícola de una hectárea en el cual suele sembrar cebollas y adicionalmente cuenta con chivos los cuales cría y comercializa entre los negociantes de la zona. Wilmer tiene bastante experiencia en el rubro y durante los últimos cinco años ha podido obtener el conocimiento necesario sobre el cultivo de cebolla ya que sólo se ha dedicado a esa actividad, actualmente ha instalado una hectárea de este cultivo y se encuentra trabajando arduamente para conseguir una buena producción.

Wilmer desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de cebolla, específicamente planea adquirir algunos fertilizantes y brindar mantenimiento a un motor con el cual extrae agua de un pozo para regar su cultivo. Para realizar estas acciones se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Wilmer, 34, is in a common law relationship and lives with his family in Huaca Partida, Pítipo district, a farming area located in Ferreñafe province, over forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been a farmer for over 10 years.  He has a one hectare field where he tends to plant onions.  He also has goats that he raises and sells among merchants in the area.

Wilmer has quite a bit of experience in this line of work and during the last five years has been able to learn everything necessary about onion growing since he has dedicated himself solely to this activity.  He currently has a hectare planted with onions and is working hard to obtain a good harvest.

Wilmer wants to provide proper maintenance to his onion fields, specifically he plans to acquire fertilizers and service the motor of a pump he uses to extract water for his crops.  To do all this he needs to request a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: For onion crop maintenance costs.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel es un padre de familia de 39 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío Quemazón, una zona agrícola que está habitada principalmente por personas humildes y bastante trabajadoras, pertenece al distrito de Mórrope y se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a comercializar carbón vegetal entre sus vecinos. Este producto tiene  bastante uso entre los pobladores de la localidad, ya que la mayoría de familias se vale de él para cocinar sus alimentos porque no tienen acceso al gas propano. El mismo se encarga de talar los árboles de algarrobo, un árbol oriundo del norte del país y que abunda mucho por la zona, los cuales compra a los propietarios del terreno en donde se están ubicados para luego quemar la madera y convertirla en carbón.

José Manuel desea contar con un capital propio para poder comprar más árboles y ampliar su negocio, por ello ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de  800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.
texts.en:
José Manuel, 39, is a father living with his wife and children in Quemazón, a farming area inhabited for the most part by humble, quite hard working people.  It belongs to Mórrope district and is located in Lambayeque province over an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

He sells plant-based charcoal among his neighbors.  This is a product that is quite widely used by area residents because most families use it to cook their meals because they don’t have access to propane gas.  He himself fells the carob trees, a tree native to the north of the country that is quite abundant in the area, that he buys from the property owners where the trees are located to later burn the wood and turn it into charcoal.

José Manuel wants to have capital of his own to be able to buy more trees and expand his business.  He, therefore, decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for an 800 new sol loan that will help him reach his goal.

loans.use: To buy wood to make charcoal.

loans.name: María Fausta

texts.es:
María Fausta tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío El Romero, una zona rural poblada principalmente por gente humilde y bastante trabajadora, pertenece al distrito de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega en su domicilio, allí ofrece a sus vecinos y clientes diversos productos de uso diario, entre abarrotes y alimentos. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la calidad de productos y al buen trato que suele brindar. Esta actividad es muy importante para su familia ya que con los ingresos que ella percibe se encarga de ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico familiar.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos y de esa manera satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta, asimismo desea implementar su negocio con la compra de productos navideños, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Fausta, 25, is married and lives with her husband and children in El Romero, a rural area populated mostly by humble, hard working people.  It belongs to Lambayeque district and is located in Lambayeque province over an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small grocery store in her home.  She offers her neighbors and customers a variety of daily use items among groceries and food items.  The store is well received due to the quality of products and the good customer service she tends to provide.  This activity is very important for her family because income from it allows her to help her husband support the family.

María wants to expand the business buying more products to meet current demand.  She also wants to stock the store with Christmas products.  She, therefore, has deemed it wise to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to help her reach her goal.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Nancy Dora

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo dependiente, reside en el sector Los Angeles, un barrio urbano marginal del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona comercial que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Nancy se dedica desde hace diez años a la crianza y venta de aves de corral, ella cría estos animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio y los ofrece en venta al público en general una vez que estas ya se hayan desarrollado completamente. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad son utilizados para sacar adelante a su menor hijo.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más aves y alimento balanceado ya que durante estas temporadas del año la demanda aumenta, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Nancy, 31, is single and has a dependent son.  She lives in the Los Ángeles sector, a marginal urban neighborhood in Lambayeque district, a commercial area located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Nancy has raised barnyard fowl for 10 years.  She raises them in her back yard and sells them to the general public once they have developed completely.  Income from the sales is used to support her minor son.

She wants to expand the business acquiring more birds and nutritionally balanced feed for them because during this time of year demand increases. To reach her goal she needs to request a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy barnyard fown and nutritionally balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Casinaldo

texts.es:
Casinaldo tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el Caserío Santa Isabel del distrito agrícola de Olmos, el lugar se encuentra ubicado a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Casinaldo se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, específicamente de ovejas. El ya tiene más de tres años dedicándose a esta actividad. El cría a sus ovejas en un corral situado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde vive. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades son utilizados para sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Casinaldo desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo alimento balanceado para lograr que sus ovejas se desarrollen de mejor modo y sean vendidas a un mejor precio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Casinaldo, 42, is married and lives with his family in Santa Isabel in the farming district of Olmos, a place located over two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Casinaldo raises small farm animals, specifically sheep.  He has been in this occupation for over three years now.  He raises the sheep in a corral in the rear of his house.  When they have reached a good level of development he sells them to merchants who come by the area where he lives.  Income from the sales is used to support the family.

Casinaldo wants to expand the business acquiring nutritionally balanced feed so that the sheep will develop better and be sold at a better price.  To do so he has requested a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ana es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito agrícola de Oyotún, una zona que se encuentra situada a más de hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ana se dedica desde hace diez años a la crianza y venta de animales menores y aves de corral, ella cría estos animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio y los ofrece en venta al público en general una vez que estos ya se hayan desarrollado completamente, eventualmente los vende en una feria que toma lugar una vez cada semana en el vecino distrito de Cayaltí. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad son utilizados para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más animales y alimento balanceado ya que durante estas temporadas del año la demanda aumenta, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Ana, 37, is a mother living with her husband and children in the agricultural zone, Oyotún, which is located over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

For ten years Ana has raised small farm animals and barnyard fowl.  She raises these animals in the back yard of her home and sells to the general public once they reach ideal development.  Occasionally she sells them at a livestock fair that takes place once a week in the neighboring Cayaltí district.  Income from these sales is used to help her husband support the family.

She wants to enlarge the business buying more animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them because during this time of year demand increases.  
To reach this goal she needs to request a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy small farm animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Lilia V. es socia del banco comunal Poloma, vive en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es de clima frió y se encuentra al suroeste de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene como atractivos turísticos el sector conocido como el Verde cerro que fue sagrado para los Cañaris y de donde se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente mantiene sus tradiciones y cultura.

Nuestra socia tiene 41 años,  es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 22, 20, 17, 15 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan económicamente en su hogar, su segunda hija pasa en casa ayudando en los quehaceres y su ultima hija trabaja. Su esposo es maestro albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Lilia se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa en donde se dedica a la cría de credos. Trabaja como empleada domestica algunos días de la semana o cuando la llaman.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 10 años, tiempo en el cual se ha beneficiado en la compra de animales y también en su hogar, con su nuevo crédito va a comprar cuyes y pollos para iniciar con este negocio. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lilia V. is a member of the Paloma communal bank.  She lives in El Valle parish which is a cold climate parish located in southwest Cuenca.  One of its tourist attractions is an area known as El Verde, a hill that was sacred to the Cañaris (ancient inhabitants of the territory of the modern provinces of Azuay and Cañar), from which one can overlook most of the city of Cuenca.  Its residents maintain their traditions and culture.

Lilia is 41 years old, married and has four children who are 22, 20, 17 and 15 years of age.  Her two oldest children work and contribute economically to the home.  Her second daughter stays home helping with household chores and her youngest daughter works.  Her husband is a master builder.  They do not own their house, they rent.

Lilia is a housewife but also raises pigs.  She works as a domestic employee a few days a week or whenever she’s called to do so.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 10 years.  During this time she has benefitted by being able to buy animals and also in her home. She will use the new loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens to start this business.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Yrma Francisca

texts.es:
Yrma es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito agrícola de Oyotún, una zona que se encuentra situada a más de hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos desde hace diez años, ella prepara sus alimentos en su domicilio para luego ofrecerlos en venta al público en general. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus comida. Yrma se vale de los ingresos que recibe de esta actividad para ayudar a su esposo a solventar la economía de su familia.

Yrma desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de insumos de modo que pueda ampliar su producción y aumentar sus ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Yrma, 40, is a mother living with her husband and two children in the farming area of Oyotún, an area located over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She has prepared food for sale for the last ten years.  She prepares the meals at home and then offers them for sale to the general public.  The business is very well received by her customers because of the tasty way she prepares the meals.  Yrma uses income from her sales to help her husband support the family.

Yrma wants to expand the business buying ingredients to increase production and increase sales.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to reach this goal.

loans.use: To buy food preparation ingredients.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José Luis tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una zona agrícola de movimiento comercial considerable que se encuentra situada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar labores de transporte) el brinda el servicio en su distrito y en los anexos que lo conforman. La actividad tiene mucha acogida debido a la velocidad y bajo precio que los caracteriza. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar los gastos económicos de su familia.

José Luis ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de  2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el mantemiento y reparación de su unidad móvil, ya que el continuo uso otorgado y el mal estado de la mayor parte de caminos del lugar han hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunos daños que requieren de urgente reparación.
texts.en:
José Luis is 40 years old, married and lives with his wife and children in the Cayaltí district, an agricultural area with considerable commercial activity located an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

He provides cargo and passenger transport in a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with a cabin attached to provide transport). He works in his district and the surrounding areas and the business is very good because of the speed and low price. He uses the money he earns from his work to cover the family financial expenses.

José Luis has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa which he plans to invest in the care and repair of his vehicle because its continuous use and the poor conditions of the majority of the area roads have caused some damages that require immediate repair.

loans.use: Expenses to repair and care for his mototaxi

loans.name: María Trancito

texts.es:
La Señora. María G. es socia del banco comunal Poloma, vive en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es de clima frió y se encuentra al suroeste de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene como atractivos turísticos el sector conocido como el Verde cerro que fue sagrado para los Cañaris y de donde se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente mantiene sus tradiciones y cultura.

La Señora. María tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 15, 12, 11, 8, 4 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar, sus tres hijos siguientes  estudian en la escuela y los dos últimos están en una guardería. Su esposo es maestro en la construcción y labora como albañil, tienen casa propia la misma que ha sido construida con el trabajo conyugal. 

Doña María se dedica a  realizar artesanías como son los sombreros de paja toquilla, actividad que la realiza hace 16 años, aprendiendo el oficio que sus padres le han enseñado. También se dedica a la cría y venta de animales como son cerdos, cuyes y pollos los que son también para el consumo de su hogar.

Se encuentra en el cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para así ir incrementando más animales. Su meta es hacer algunos arreglos a su casa ya que lo necesita.
texts.en:
Mrs. María G. is a member of the Poloma communal bank located in Valle parish.  This is a cold climate parish in southwest Cuenca.  As a tourist attraction it has a sector known as El Verde which was a hill sacred to the Cañari people (ancient inhabitants of the territory of the modern provinces of Azuay and Cañar) from which one can observe a great deal of Cuenca.  Its people maintain its traditions and culture.

María is 35 years old, married and has six children who are 15, 12, 11, 8, 4 and 2 years of age.  Her oldest son works and helps with family expenses.  Her next three children are in school and the last two are in day care.  Her husband is a master builder and works as a bricklayer.  They own their house which they have built through their work as a couple.

María has been a craftswoman for 16 years making Panama hats.  She learned this skill from her parents.  She also raises pigs, guinea pigs and chickens to sell and for home consumption.

She is in her 4th loan with the communal bank.  She will use the new loan to buy a cow to add to her herd.  Her goal is to do some needed home repairs.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Francisco Plácido

texts.es:
Francisco es un padre de familia de 43 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, situado en la región Piura, esta región se encuentra ubicada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El cuenta con un terreno heredado en donde suele sembrar mango y limón, como ya cuenta con varios años de experiencia en este negocio actualmente conoce bastante sobre el manejo de estos cultivos. Generalmente cosecha el limón durante todo el año y el mango una vez por año, las frutas las suele ofrecer en venta a las plantas procesadoras que se encuentran ubicadas en la carretera de acceso a su localidad. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.

Francisco desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de algunos fertilizantes de modo que pueda asegurarse una buena producción, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Francisco is a 43-year-old father who lives with his wife and children in the rural part of the farming district of Tambogrande, located in the region of Piura. This region is more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo which is the capital of the region of Lambayeque.

He has a piece of inherited land where he tends to plant mango and lemon. Since he already has several years of experience in the business, he currently knows a great deal about caring for these crops. He generally harvests lemon during the entire year and mango once per year. He usually sells the fruits to the processing plants located on the highway leading to his area. He uses the money he earns from this business to help his family get ahead.

Francisco wants to expand his business with the purchase of fertilizers so that he can be sure of a good production. This is why he thought it would be good to request a loan for 500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Expenses for maintaining his mango and lemon plants

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, situado en la región Piura, esta región se encuentra ubicada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos por catálogo. Trabaja en base a pedidos y sus clientes son sus vecinos y conocidos, siempre está a la búsqueda de nuevos clientes ya que mientras más pedidos coloque, más ganancias obtiene por parte de la compañía que le abastece de productos. Los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia con el sustento diario.

Raquel desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda contar con un inventario estable que le permita satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes cuando ellos lo necesiten sin tener que esperar a fin de mes, que es cuando llega el pedido, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Raquel is 26 years old, single and lives with her family in the rural part of the farming district of Tambogrande, located in the region of Piura. This region is more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo which is the capital of the region of Lambayeque.

She sells cosmetics from a catalog and works by request. Her customers are her neighbors and acquaintances but she is always in search of new clients since the more orders she has, the more she earns from the company that provides her with the products. She uses the money she earns from this business to cover her personal expenses and to help her family with the daily sustenance.

Raquel wants to expand her business with the purchase of more products so that she can have a stable inventory to meet the demand of her customers instead of having to wait until the end of the month when the order arrives. This is why she thought it would be good to request a loan for 500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa.

She is a calm and responsible woman. Her biggest dream is to continue growing as a businesswoman to be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics to expand her sales business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Mrs. Gemma B. is from the Barangay of Malaubang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental.  She is 37 years old, married to Reneboy B. and blessed with 2 school aged children.  To make a living, she is presently doing work as a junk bottle cleaner and washer.  Her husband is engaged in scrap buying of metals, plastics and bottles.  She’s been engaged in this kind of labor for 5 years already.  She’s earning an average amount of not less than PHP 1,200 a month from this kind of work. 

In September 13, 2007, Gemma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma as an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities.  She has successfully repaid a loan amount of PHP 5,000.  

She is now requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 as her 5th loan which will be used as additional capital for her husband’s scrap buying business.  The future income of this business will be used to meet their basic needs, loan repayments and her children’s education.  She also joined PAGLAUM MPC because of the savings and insurance program offered by PAGLAUM MPC to its members. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao.  It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her husband's scrap buying business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Mrs. Lolita B. is from the Barangay of Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years-old and married to Elmer B..  They are blessed with three children who are all school age. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari store. Her husband is a farmer, billiard table watcher and her partner in business. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for tenyears already. She’s earning an average amount of not less than P6,000.00 a month from this business. 

In the year 2005, Lolita joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita, as an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities, has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php40,000.00. She is now requesting a loan of Php10,000.00 as her 11th loan which will be used to provide additional capital for the sari-sari store. The future income of this business will be used to meet their basic needs, make loan repayments and for the children’s education. She also joined PAGLAUM MPC because of the savings and insurance program offered by PAGLAUM MPC to its members. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Mrs. Juliet F. is from the Barangay of Mayor’s Village,Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years-old and married to Cristituto F..  They are blessed with eight children who are all school age. To make a living, she is presently engaged in selling snacks particularly “puto and salad” business. Her husband is a construction worker. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for one year already. She’s earns an average amount of not less than P3,000.00 a month from this business. 

In the year 2006, Juliet joined Kiva parter PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet, as an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities, has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php6,500.00. She is now requesting a loan of Php6,500.00 as her fourth loan which will be used to provide additional capital for her snack vending “puto and salad” business. The future income of this business will be used to meet their basic needs, to make loan repayments and pay for the children’s education. She also joined PAGLAUM MPC because of the savings and insurance program offered by PAGLAUM MPC to its members. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her snack selling business.

location.town: Mayor Village Lapasan, Clarin Mis Occ

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Mr. Leang L. (pictured above) and his wife, Mrs. Sophors Sok, were married in 2006 and have one child. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Leang is a motor taxi driver and a fisherman. His wife is a garment factory worker, who in the past used to sell flowers. In addition, the couple also grows rice. 

Leang is requesting a loan of $600 to buy a water pumping machine and to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase machinery and materials for his rice farm

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz C. is from the village of Cabunga-an Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years-old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Paz owns and operates a “sari-sari’ store business in the retail sector running a general store which sells a variety of products to local community. She has been engaged in this business for six months and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, she joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Paz is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products for her retail store. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Paz from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her retail store.

loans.name: Analiza Ano-Os' Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Analiza A. is from the Barangay of Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Analiza is the group leader of a two member group loan offered by Kiva partner PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Analiza A.’ Group. 

Analiza A. is 40 years-old and married to Concordio A..  They are blessed with four who are all school age. To make a living, she is presently engaged in a firewood buying and selling business. Her husband is also giving her regular support from his income as a motor cab driver. She’s been engaged in this business for four years already. She earns an average amount of not less than P3,500.00 a month from this business. 

In the year 2009, Analiza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza, as an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities, has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php5,000.00. She is now requesting a loan of Php7,500.00 as her third loan which will be used for  additional capital for her firewood buy and sell business. The future income of this business will be used to meet their basic needs, to make loan repayments and pay for the children’s education. She also joined PAGLAUM MPC because of the Savings and insurance program offered by PAGLAUM MPC to its members. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Mrs. Adelina V. is from the Barangay of Pulot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years-old and married to Alejandro V..  They are blessed with four children some are adults and others still school age. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari store and a coconut, charcoal and firewood buying and selling business. Her husband is her assistant in this business. They’re been engaged in these businesses for 20 years already. They earn an average amount of not less than P5,000.00 a month from these businesses. 

On November 25, 2009 Adelina joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelina, as an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities, has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php7,000.00. She is now requesting a loan of Php6,000.00 as her third loan availment which will be used to provide  additional capital for her businesses.  The additional future income will be used to meet their basic needs, to make loan repayments and to pay for the children’s education. She also joined PAGLAUM MPC because of the savings and insurance program offered by PAGLAUM MPC to its members. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her businesses.

loans.name: Judith Bation's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Judith B. is from the Barangay of Catadman, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental.  Judith is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Judith B.’s Group. 

Judith is 45 years old, married to Felmore B. and blessed with 2 children all of whom are now school age.  To make a living, she is presently engaged in AVON Products dealing, guso culture and production, hog fattening, motorcab operation and internet café business.  Her husband is an automotive body builder.  She’s been engaged in this kind of business for 10 years already.  She’s earning an average amount of not less than PHP 10,000 a month from these business. 

In January 17, 2006, Judith joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Judith, as an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that has reached out to rural communities, has successfully repaid a loan amount of PHP 14,500.  

She is now requesting a loan of PHP 14,900 as her 9th loan which will be used for  motorcycle maintenance and repairs.  The future income of this business will be used to meet their basic needs, loan repayments and her children’s education.  She also joined PAGLAUM MPC because of the savings and insurance program offered by PAGLAUM MPC to its members. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Motorcycle maintenance and repairs.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Mrs. Rowena D. is from the Barangay of Pulot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old, married to Roberto D. and blessed with two children who go to school. To make a living, she sells snacks and runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She also receives regular support from her husband who earns an average of 300 PHP per day as a driver. She has been engaged in her snack vending business for the past five years. She earns an average amount of more than 3,000 PHP a month from her businesses. 

On December 16, 2009, Rowena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rowena is an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,500 PHP. She is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP as her third loan, which she will use as  additional capital for her snack vending and sari-sari store businesses. The future income from these businesses will be used to meet the family's basic needs, to repay loans, and to educate her children. She also joined Paglaum MPC because of the savings and insurance programs offered to its members. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Mrs. Nelfa A. is from the Barangay of Catadman, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old, married to Rosito A. and blessed with two adult children. To make a living, Nelfa sells delicacies and works as a cook. She also receives regular support from her husband, who earns 375 PHP each week as a gardener. She has been engaged in her business of cooking and selling delicacies for the past ten years. She earns an average of more than 3000 PHP a month from her business.  

On January 12, 2006, Nelfa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nelfa is an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP. She is now requesting her tenth loan: 14,000 PHP, which she will use to pay her grandson's tuition fees. She also joined Paglaum MPC because of the savings and insurance program offered to its members. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Tuition fees

loans.name: Shiela Alona

texts.en:
Mrs. Shiela Alona R. is from the Barangay of P8 Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old and married; although, she is currently separated from her husband. They have been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. To make a living, Shiela sells fish. She has been engaged in this kind of business for the past five years. She currently earns an average of more than 15,000 PHP per month.  

In 2009, Shiela Alona joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Shiela Alona is an active member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program and has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP. She is now requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be her third loan. She will use the loan as additional capital for her existing business selling fish. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family (meeting their basic needs), to save for the future, to make loan payments, to educate her children, and possibly to expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital

location.town: P8 Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental,

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Mrs. Saren C. (pictured here) is 26 years old and her husband, Mr. Borey Sang is 27 years old.  They live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2003 and have two young children (one son and one daughter).  

Saren is a weaver. Her husband is a security guard. She is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and purchase a new motorbike for her husband to replace his old one.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and a replacement motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Mrs. Teresita L. is from the Barangay of P12 Northern Catadman, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old and married to Jesus L.. The couple is blessed with three children who are all now adults. To make a living, Teresita and her husband are presently engaged in a cakes and pastries-making and a ready-to-wear clothing business. They’ve been engaged in their businesses for five years already. They are currently earning no less than 6000 PHP per month. 

In 2008, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As an active member of PMPC under the Regular Loan Program, Teresita has successfully repaid a loan amount of 35,000 PHP.  She is now requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP as her seventh loan which will be used for the additional capital for their existing cakes and pastries-making and ready-to-wear clothing businesses. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, making loan repayments and investing in possible business expansions.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To obtain additional capital for their existing cakes and pastriesmaking and RTW dealing business

location.town: P12 Northern Catadman, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en:
Mr. Loeng P. (in the photo) is 38 years old and his wife, Mrs. Phearoth Nub, is 39 years old, have been married since 1994 and have two children -one son and one daughter. The family lives in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Loeng has been a security guard in Phnom Penh for 6 months. His wife has been a garment worker for ten years. He is applying for a loan of $1,000 to put additional work into his house and buy a motorcycle to get to work.

loans.use: To put additional work into his house and buy a motorcycle to get to work.

loans.name: Norma Catalina

texts.es:
La Señora Norma L. es socia del banco comunal El Ahorro, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica de su centro histórico, su cultura y tradiciones, siendo su gente calida y amable. 

La Señora Norma tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 19, 7 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar, su segundo hijo estudia en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es maestro en la construcción, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.

Doña Norma es comerciante hace 15 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada americana, labora de 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde pero solo 3 días a la semana, los demás días se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por una amiga que es socia del banco comunal. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa para surtir su negocio. Su sueño sería no tener más deudas.
texts.en:
Señora Norma L. is a member of the El Ahorro ("The Savings") communal bank. She lives in greater Cuenca, a city which is reknowned for the architectural beauty of its historic centre, its culture and traditions, and for the warmth of its people.

Señora Norma is 38 years old, and is married with 3 children, age 19, 7 and 1. Her eldest son works, and helps with the household expenses. Her second son is at school in the city. Her husband is a master builder. They do not have their own house, but live in the house of a relative.  

Señora Norma has been a businesswoman for 15 years. She sells used clothing, working from 7am until 6pm, but only 3 days per week. The other days she dedicates to looking after her children. 

This is her first loan with the communal bank, after she was invited to join by a friend who was already a member. She is going to invest her loan in buying more clothing to stock her business. Her dream is to have no more worries.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. Pov K. (in the photo), and his wife, Mrs. Sokhun Mann, have been married since 1996 and have four children - two sons and two daughters. Three of them are in school and another is still too young. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Pov K. and his wife are farmers. They grow lotus and rice on their farmland in the village where they live. Pov is requesting a loan in of US$500 to continue his farming business by purchasing seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: Toch

texts.en: Toch M. is 50 years old and married.  She resides with her husband and six children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat temple. M. produces traditional baskets to sell, earning an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of about USD 1 per day. Mao has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 45 on other necessary expenses every month. M. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional savings to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Sakum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sakum R. (in the photo), 50 years old, and her husband, Mr. Chan Leab, 48 years old, have been married since 1985 and have four children -three sons and one daughter. One of them is a security guard, another one is a soldier, and two are in school. They live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sakum sells porridge, rice and food in her village. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Lonh

texts.en:
Lonh R. is a 35 year old married mother who currently lives in the province of Battambang. She is a local chef, and is always hired by neighbors to cook meals for their wedding parties and other ceremonies. Her husband works as a soldier as well as a motor taxi driver in his community. The family includes three devoted children, all of them single.

Lonh R. said that she wishes to build a new house for her family, but she lacks the funds. To solve this problem, Lonh R. would like a loan of $1100 in order to purchase some pieces of wood to build her new house. Lonh R. was not available the day of the photo, so her husband is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To purchase some pieces of wood for building her new house.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora. María Pérez es socia del banco comunal El Ahorro, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica de su centro histórico, su cultura y tradiciones, siendo su gente calida y amable.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de fantasías como son aretes, lasos, diademas, etc., actividad que desempeña hace 20 años, trabaja desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y de domingo a domingo, trabaja en la calle ya que el municipio aun no les entrega puestos para que puedan trabajar más cómodamente.

Doña María tiene 42 años, es casada  y tiene 4 hijos de 20, 18, 16, 14 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive  independiente, su segundo hijo también es casado pero aun vive en su casa compartiendo gastos y sus dos últimas hijas están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como comerciante ambulante,  vende artefactos eléctricos como son planchas, licuadoras y también sus repuestos. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Este es el  cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y se siente muy contenta ya que cuenta con grandes amigas con quienes conversa y sale de su rutina diaria de trabajo.  El dinero de su crédito es para incrementar más mercadería para la temporada navideña. Su meta es crecer mucho más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora María Pérez is a member of the El Ahorro ("The Savings") communal bank. She lives in greater Cuenca, a city which is reknowned for the architectural beauty of its historic centre, its culture and traditions, and for the warmth of its people.

Señora María dedicates her time to the sale of costume jewellery, such as earrings, bows, hairbands, etc. - an activity she began some 20 years ago. She works from 9am to 6pm, 7 days a week. She sells her wares in the street, because the town council refuse to put up stalls where she could work more comfortably. 

Señora María is 42 years old, and is married with 4 children, aged 20, 18, 16 and 14. Her eldest son is married and living independently; her second son is also married but still lives in her house and shares the costs. Her two younger daughters are studying at a secondary school in the city. Her husband works as a travelling salesman, selling electrical goods such as irons, blenders, and spare parts.They do not have their own home, but live in rented accommodation. 

This is her 4th loan with the communal bank, and she is very happy, because she has made great friends among its members, with whom she can chat and leave behind her dailiy routine. The money from her loan is to increase her stock for the Christmas season. Her goal is to expand her business much more.

loans.use:
Comprar aretes, vinchas, lazos, diademas, etc.
To buy earrings, bows, hairclips, hairbands, etc.

loans.name: Channtho

texts.en:
Mrs. Channtho S. (pictured above), 40, is a widow with three sons. Two of them are in school and another one assists his mother in the business. The family lives along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Channtho has been selling vegetables for ten years. She buys them from the fellow villagers under contract before harvest season and transports them to sell in Phnom Penh market. She is requesting her first loan of $600 to purchase additional vegetables for resale.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables under contract for resale.

loans.name: Komsot

texts.en:
Mr. Komsot S., 36, and his wife, Mrs. Kakada Chea, 33, have been married since 1992 and have two daughters. One of them attends school and another one is assisting her parents in the business. The family lives along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Komsot and his wife have been farming for five years. They grow cauliflower on their farmland in the village where they live. Komsot is requesting his first loan of $1,200 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his cauliflower farm and pay for plowing fees.
 
Photo: Mr. Komsot and his wife were at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: Va

texts.en: Va A. is 42 years old and married.  She now lives in the province of Kompong Cham, which is the best territory for farming. Va A.’s husband also assists her with the farming business. This couple has one child who is still studying in school. Va A. owns a big farm thA. she inherited from her grandmother. She grows a various crops on it. She currently grows pepper and she estimates thA. she will harvest it within the next month when the plants mature. Unfortunately, her plants are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizer to help her crops grow.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizer for her plant growing well.

loans.name: María Vicenta

texts.es:
La Señora María P. es socia del banco comunal El Ahorro, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica de su centro histórico, su cultura y tradiciones, siendo su gente calida y amable.
 
Doña María tiene 38 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 4 hijos de 16, 11, 8 y 4 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, sus dos siguientes hijas  estudian en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como comerciante ambulante, vende varios artículos como ollas, cucharas, etc., no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora María es oriunda de la provincia de Portoviejo, hace un tiempo atrás ha vivido en esta ciudad y hace un año ha regresado a nuestra ciudad motivada por el trabajo ya que es comerciante al igual que su esposo, vende su mercadería recorriendo la ciudad  y trabaja de domingo a domingo, esta actividad la realiza desde muy pequeña ya que laboraba con su padre desde niña.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito y fue invitada por un sobrino a formar parte del banco comunal. Su nuevo crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de ollas, pastas dentales, etc., para la venta. Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora María P. is a member of the El Ahorro ("The Savings") communal bank. She lives in greater Cuenca, a city which is reknowned for the architectural beauty of its historic centre, its culture and traditions, and for the warmth of its people.
 
Señora María is 38 years old, and lives with her partner and their 4 children, aged 16, 11, 8 and 4. Her eldest daughter is married and living independently, while her next two daughters are attending a secondary school in the city. Her husband works as a travelling salesman, selling various goods such as cooking pots, spoons, etc. They do not have their own house, but live in rented accommodation.

Señora María is originally from the province of Portoviejo. A while ago she used to live in this city, and returned to our city a year ago for work. She is a salesperson like her husband, and sells her goods walking around the city. She works 7 days a week. She has been doing this type of work since she was very small, when, as a little girl, she used to work alongside her father.

This is her second loan since she was invited by her cousin to be part of the communal bank. She is going to invest this new loan in the purchase of cooking pots, toothpaste, etc., to sell. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy cooking pots, spoons, frying pans, toothpaste etc.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo R. is from the village of Olango. He is 40 years old. Rodolfo is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rodolfo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rodolfo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2008, Rodolfo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodolfo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Rodolfo is requesting a new loan of 31,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Rodolfo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand this business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es: María Santos L. D. C. D. 43 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento oriental D. San Miguel, junto a cuatro hijos. Ella es una madre D. familia muy responsable y trabajadora, quien se gana la vida comercializando ropa para hombres y mujeres, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa D. habitación, así mismo hace algunas visitas a las casas D. sus clientes para poder mostrarles su productos. María es madre soltera, y su mayor deseo es el D. poder darle una vida mejor a sus hijos, brindándoles estudios, alimento, ropa y demás. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su inventario y comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, sobretodo para este fin D. año en que sus ventas se aumentan en gran manera.
texts.en: María Santos L. D. C. is 43 years old and lives in the Eastern department of San Miguel with her four children.  She is a very responsible and hardworking mother who earns a living selling men’s and women’s clothing.  She runs her business from her house and also makes some visits to her customers’ houses to show them her products.  María is a single mother and her biggest wish is to be able to give her children a better life, providing them with education, food, clothing, etc.  She is requesting a loan with which she can stock her inventory and buy more clothing, especially for the end of the year when her sales increase significantly.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en:
Macrina Z. is 63 years old, married, and supports her family by operating a buying and selling of vegetables business. She lives in Prk. Tabon, Brgy. Mantalongon, Dalaguete, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,600.

Macrina is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can fund operations. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Macrina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. Her photo was taken in the market where she does her business.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Funds for business operations.

loans.name: Josefa Ernestina

texts.es: Josefa Ernestina R. M. de 26 años de edad, es una madre y esposa muy responsable, la cual trabaja muy duro para salir adelante. Ella reside en Santiago de María en el departamento de Usulután, en donde vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como joyero, así mismo vive junto a su pequeño hijo de 2 meses de edad y junto a su madre. Josefa posee una venta de ropa para niñas y niños, así mismo comercializa accesorios como ganchos, diademas, esmaltes y otros más. El negocio se encuentra en el mercado regional y Santiago de María. Josefa solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir el negocio comprando ropa de moda para niños, con dibujos alusivos a caricaturas, así mismo para comprar más cosméticos, ganchos y colas para el cabello. Josefa desea en gran manera mejorar su negocio ya que sus ganancias son fundamentales para el sostenimiento del hogar.
texts.en: Josefa Ernestina R. M. is a very responsible mother and wife, who works very hard to improve her family's circumstances. She lives in Santiago de María in the Usulután department, where she lives with her husband who works as a jeweller, their small son, 2 months old, and her mother. Josefa possesses a children's clothing business, and also sells accessories such as hair ties, tiaras, nail polish and other things. Her business is found in the regional market and Santiago de María. Josefa is seeking a loan so that she can stock her business, purchasing more quantities of fashionable boys clothes, with drawings and cartoons on them, and also purchase more cosmetics, hair ties and headbands. Josefa has a great desire to improve her business as her earnings are fundamental to sustaining her home.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and hair accessories

location.town: Santiago de María, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma C. is a married woman who lives in Purok 5, Brgy. Bal-os, Basay, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures:  hog raising, selling of palm toddy (wine), and livestock businesses. Her husband Beato, who is 54 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have eight children who are between 14 and 34 years old.

Thelma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Thelma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,900, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to buy feed, medicines, and vaccines for her livestock so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of business and home repairs. Thelma C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). loans.use: Fund the operations of raising hogs, and making palm wine.

Her husband Ramil, who is 40 years old, works as a Boat Captain to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are between 8 and 15 years old.

This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for the food stall and gasoline sales, so that she can continue to save up for future improvement of business and for the education of her children. Rose B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.
