He is one of Al Majmoua’s special clients, and this is his ninth cycle requesting a loan. All his previous loans had a great impact on his business and family’s financial and social position. This time Ommar is requesting a loan in order to buy the holly season's new collections, and he wishes every one of you God’s blessings. Ommar’s clients include all kinds of people, in addition to relatives, friends, and neighbors. He hopes to improve his income by opening more branches.

loans.use: To buy the season's new collections

loans.name: Moses Tenik

texts.en:
Moses Tenik is 30 years old and sells quarry stones in Ngurunga, a very busy but remote area in Kitengela. He is a single man. Moses was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office.

Moses has been selling quarry stones for a period of three years and his monthly profit is KES 15,000. This loan of KES 20,000 is his second loan with KADET, his previous loan having been repaid with no problems. He plans to use the loan to buy quarry stones for sale. If the loan boosts his business, he will purchase livestock for trade. Moses describes himself as hardworking. He dreams that he will become a prominent businessman in the future.

loans.use: to buy quarry stones

loans.name: George

texts.en: Georges is a 25 years old single man working as a barber since 2008. Georges is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua in order to improve his shop, buy necessary materials, and prepare himself for the Holy season. Most of his clients turn into best friends, and that’s what special in his personality.  All of his clients speak about his honesty and friendliness. Georges hopes to expand his business through adding  a beauty institute to his business.

loans.use: To improve barber shop

loans.name: Sam's Group

texts.en:
Eight people are forming this village loan. They are located in Anlong Slat village in Kandal province. This village loan group selected Mrs. Sam S., 50 years old, as the leader for this loan. Each member of this village will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Sam S., is a farming laborer and she is a single woman. With her work, she earns too little income to improve her living. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding. She hopes this business will improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding

loans.name: Keen Kipiko

texts.en:
Keen Kipiko, aged 23, runs a motorcycle transport business popularly known as “Bodaboda” at Bissil in Kajiado. He is married to Faith Nashulae and together they have one child, Keen. He was introduced to KADET by other KADET clients.

Keen has been running this business for a period of two years and his monthly profit is Kshs 30,000. This loan of Kshs 30,000 is his first loan with KADET. With the loan, he plans to purchase another motorbike and employ one person to operate it as he supervises. If this loan improves the business, he plans to buy more motor bikes.

Keen is hardworking and ambitious, and dreams of having many motorbikes in the future.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike

loans.name: Chiv

texts.en:
Chiv P. is a 31-year-old married mother who currently lives in the province of Kompong Tom. She is a tailor who sews the villagers' clothes when they need to order new clothing for ceremonies such as weddings and parties. She has a life partner in her husband who is a carbon seller in and around her community. The family includes two devoted children, two of whom are single, and still under their roof. 

Because the family's main income comes from her husband's business, he now wishes to expand his business. Chiv P. wants to help her husband but her income is too small and is not sufficient to support her husband's business. To solve this problem, Chiv P. will use her loan for her husband to purchase a large amount of carbon for selling.

loans.use: To purchase carbon for resale

loans.name: Elie

texts.en: Elie is a 43-year-old married man and the owner of a car accessories shop for 15 years. Elie is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua in order to buy more products for his business that will lead to extra income. His experience in this business gave him the clients’ trust. He hopes to expand his business through opening extra branches in the region.

loans.use: To buy car accessory products for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
M. Peace is an individual client from Rukungiri. She is a business lady involved in agriculture, where she has been dealing in the sale of matooke at Nyabikuku centre for 10 years. 

She is 43 years old and married with 5 children.  She works with family members to ensure that their plantations give high quality yield for sale.  She also has another business selling used clothing.  

At the moment, she needs a loan to be able to improve her banana plantation by buying fertilizers and mulch. Her previous business was selling second-hand shoes until she moved.  She is a trustworthy person. She works hard to ensure the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and mulch

loans.name: Ketura

texts.en:
Ketura N., aged 27, runs a retail shop at Enkaroni in Bissil market, a very busy market in Kajiado. He sells his goods to Bissil residents and livestock traders who come to Bissil every day to sell their livestock. He is single. He was introduced to KADET by the credit officer.

Ketura has been running this business for a period of one and half years and his monthly income is Kshs 20,000. He is applying for his  first loan of Kshs 20,000 from KADET.  He plans to use Kshs 7,000 to increase his stocks of sugar, Kshs 10,000 to increase his stocks of flour, and Kshs 3,000 to increase his stocks of milk and sweets. If the loan boosts the business, he will expand his business to wholesale.

Ketura dreams of having a big wholesale business in the future. He describes himself as focused and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, milk, and sweets for sale

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Four people are sharing this group loan.  They are living in Chong Preaek village in Kandal province. Mrs. Heang S., a 29-year-old married woman, was selected as the group leader for this loan by its members.  With the loans, they hope to increase their income to improve their family. 

Mrs. Heang S. is a farmer who owns a plot of peanut field to cultivate peanut. She doesn’t have enough money to cultivate it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy peanut seeds and to hire farming laborers to cultivate peanut. Her husband, Mr. Srou Rem, 30 years old, works as a farming laborer and also helps his wife with her farm.

This couple has two children -- one is attending the local school while the other is 5 years old and is not in school yet.

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds and hire farming laborers to cultivate peanut

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Amadou D.  est âgé de 26 ans et sans enfant. Il vit dans une famille traditionnelle  avec ses parents au  quartier Darsalam  de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Titulaire de deux  diplômes, enseignant de profession parallèlement à cette activité, il vend des habits pour hommes. Il appris ce commerce lorsqu’il était au lycée par souci d’aider ses parents qui avaient des difficultés pour prendre en charge les dépenses familiales. Il mène cette activité depuis 7 et jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété. Sa force de vente est due à son dynamisme mais également à la qualité de ses habits qui sont de bonnes qualités.
Dans  le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices, il fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso.  Il est à son 1er  prêt individuel qu’il  compte utiliser pour acheter, 20 pièces de bazins riches. Il  s’approvisionne sur place auprès des grossistes. Monsieur Amadou D. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée  majoritairement d’hommes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA, qui lui servira à rembourser son prêt et à aider ses parents dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Mr. Amadou D. is 26 years old. He has no children. He lives in a traditional family with his parents in the neighborhood of Darsalam, in  the town of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali).

He holds two degrees and is a teacher by profession. Along with this activity, he also sells men’s apparel. He learned this trade while in high school in order to help his parents who were struggling to cover the family expenses. He has been doing this for seven years, has a large customer base and enjoys great notoriety. His strength is his enthusiasm but also the high quality of his merchandise.

Wanting to bolster his working capital to boost his profits, he turned to the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution. This is his first individual loan, which he intends to use to buy 20 pieces of rich bazin (a type of damask). He gets his stocks from local wholesalers, and sells for cash and credit to a clientele composed mainly of men.

He expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan and help his parents with the family expenses.

loans.use: To purchase damask

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of food products for restaurant activity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Burombe Twimukye Group

texts.en:
A. Margaret is the leader of Burombe Twimukye group.  She is 38 years old and married with 3 children, all of them still in school.  She is a business lady with a retail shop and a bar business in Ruhinda Trading centre for 10 years.  She is able to make 200,000 UGX in monthly profits from the sale of household items, beers and soap.   Margaret is also involved in the buying and selling of produce from the same area.  

She needs a loan to be able to restock her shop with more goods.  She is grateful that she was inspired by her parents, who also have a retail shop. Her dream is to turn her retail shop into a wholesale shop, and to see all her children finish school with good certificates.

loans.use: To restock shop with goods for resale

loans.name: Prek

texts.en:
Prek V. is 25 years old, and her husband, Pout Kim Sour, is 26. They work from home making furniture to sell. Most of their output consists of beds and cupboards, which they accumulate and sell as sets. Their furniture is made mostly from wood and rattan. 

The couple has one child, still learning in school. This family can earn an average income of $8 per day from their selling.  Prek V. runs her business well from day to day because she has good communication skills with her clients, and she always gets good results in selling her items. 

In order to earn additional profit, she would like to request some capital to purchase wood to make beds to sell.

loans.use: To purchase wood to make beds for sale

loans.name: Peter Mugi

texts.en:
Peter Mugi, aged 21 years, is married to Lucy Wanjiru.  Together they have one child, Carol, aged two years. Peter operates a hotel business at Bissil Market. His clients are both Bissil residents and livestock traders who come to Bissil for business. He was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of Kitengela office.

Peter has been running this business for a period of two years, and his monthly profit is Kshs 17,000. He is applying for his  first loan of Kshs 20,000 from KADET, which he plans to use to buy hotel seats, utensils, and a food warmer. If the loan boosts the business, he intends to use the profit to buy a fridge.

Peter dreams of having a big cafe and eventually open a restaurant. He describes himself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To buy hotel seats, utensils, and a food warmer.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a food-selling business for the past three years, selling from her home to neighbors and passers-by. Price fluctuation is the major challenge Mwanasiti faces in her business. She hopes to open a big restaurant in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of rice, maize flour, and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase rice, maize flour, and potatoes

loans.name: Benta Atieno

texts.en:
Benta K. is a twenty-seven-year-old lady from the county of Migori, an upcoming town situated along the shores of Lake Victoria, Kenya. She is married to David, also a business man, and they have three children. 

Benta operates a vehicle spare parts shop in Migori town, and has been doing this for the last two years. She makes a monthly income of Kshs.  20,000.  Need for growth and expansion arose and she decided to join Kadet Limited to access micro credit.  She has now qualified for a first loan of Kshs 40,000. She intends to use this loan to buy more vehicle spare parts for sale.  Later on she will use her profits to add more stock of spare parts.

Her hope is to diversify into the hotel industry and has plans to open one soon in Migori town.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for resale

loans.name: Tann

texts.en:
Tann L. is a rattan cupboard seller who is 43 years old.  She is a married mother caring for five kids, four of whom are single, and one is married. One of her children is a groceries seller in Kompong Tom Province. 

Tann L. orders rattan items in bulk from braiders and then takes them to sell retail door-to-door across the province. She has no life partner because she is divorced from her husband a few years ago. Tann L.’s child runs her groceries business very well because she sells her items at a reasonable price.   In order to encourage her child’s business, Tann L. will use her loan to support her child by purchasing a bigger amount of grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Rwamunyari Kwetungura Group

texts.en:
A. Charles, with hand raised, is the leader of Rwamunyari Kwetungura group. He is 38 years old and married with 2 children, aged 2 and 6 years. He is an agriculturalist involved in the growing and sale of matooke from Rwamunyari for over 5 years now.  All along, he has been helped by his wife. 

Charles says that his customers are mostly restaurant owners and the general public, and he is able to make 20,000 UGX in weekly profits. Charles says that his business is seasonal and this is why sometimes he switches and includes other produce like the sale of Irish potatoes in his business. 

He needs a loan to be able to buy fertilizers for his plantation. As a result of taking loans, Charles has been able to save and as a result bought a big chunk of land for agriculture. Before this business, Charles was involved in the sale of maize. He is a determined man who goes by his decisions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for plantation

loans.name: Joohn

texts.en:
K. Joohn is an individual client from Ibanda. He is 32 years old and married with 3 children, with two attending school. He has a retail shop in Rushaka II that has been in existence for 7 years, selling general merchandise. He works closely with his wife, and together they also have a matooke selling business and rentals.  

Joohn’s biggest customers are the people in his locality, most of them being repeat customers. To start up his retail shop, Joohn first sold his cow to get capital and he does not regret this. He is a very hardworking man and hopes for his business to continue expanding.

loans.use: To restock his retail shop

loans.name: Nazrullo

texts.ru: Саидов Назрулло проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 33 года. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Образование высшее. Окончил педагогический университет. Преподает в средней школе. По профессии работает 8 лет. Кроме того он занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. В основном Назрулло разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. То есть он занимается купле - продажей крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Nazrullo S. lives in Kulob and is 33 years old, married with five children. He has a higher education degree. He graduated from the Pedagogical University and has taught at the high school for eight years. In addition, he is engaged in animal husbandry and breeds livestock for future resale. He has been buying and selling cattle for more than 10 years. He is asking for a loan to purchase additional cattle.

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine W. is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has operated a cosmetics shop for more than four years. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Catherine faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open another cosmetics shop in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to boost her business. With the KES 20000 loan, she wants to purchase body lotions, perfumes and baby powder for sale.

loans.use: To purchase body lotions, perfumes and baby powder for sale

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 45-year-old married man, the father of three children, who has been working for 30 years as a car mechanic. This business is his only source of living. 

What differentiates his business from others is that Mohamad doesn’t have a maintenance garage; he is a mobile mechanic. When others call him for help, he goes to fix their cars. He believes that for a person to succeed, he must provide good service for his clients, and that’s what he provides.

Mohamad's long experience makes him recommended by most of his clients all over the region. 

Mohamad is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua, in order to buy new tools for his business. Mohamad hopes to open his own mobile car mechanic services that can cover a wider area with a big number of employees.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his business

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg J. is 49 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in their own apartment. Her younger son attends high school and her husband operates a taxi service, using his own car, to supplement the family income. 

Altantsetseg operates a car-repair and service business with three other business partners. She began her business in 1998, repairing a variety of cars' bodies in the local market, and has since gained significant experience as a wheelwright. 

Today, she and her business partners work together in their shop to provide a car-repair service to their customers. Their daily business income has reached 100000 MNT. Altantsetseg is responsible for painting the cars' bodies. 

For the future, she hopes to continue operating her business with stable operation. She is a very friendly and hard-working woman and says, " I am planning to buy my own car." 

She is requesting a 1000000 MNT loan in order to purchase more materials and supplies for her car-repair business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials and supplies for her car-repair business

loans.name: Bukiro Women's Group

texts.en:
A. Annet is the leader of Bukiro Women’s group in Ntungamo. She is 32 years old and married with three children, aged 12 to 7 years.  Annet has a retail shop in Kakigani that sells sugar, flour, books, pens, as well as owns a hotel in the same area for 6 years. From her businesses, she is able to make 100,000 UGX in weekly profits. 

She needs a loan to be able to buy more stock to expand the shop. Annet says that to start her shop, she got capital from the sale of bananas and  says that her shop is easy to manage. Her dream is to buy her own plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: To stock retail shop

loans.name: Merida

texts.en:
Merida K. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is not currently in school.  

Merida has a business of selling shoes, which she has had for a year. To help expand her business, Merida has requested a loan of 200000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more shoes to sell. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Merida hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. 

In the future, Merida hopes to own a house.        

Merida is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale

loans.name: Divina Chelegat

texts.en:
Divina Chelagat K. is a 47-year-old lady.  She is a widow and has two children.  They live in Eldoret town in a place called Road block, where her business is situated. She has been in this business for three years now and she gets a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be Divina's first loan from KADET and she plans to buy timber for carpentry work.  With the income, she will buy more varnish (oil used to apply on the final finish of finished product to make the furniture shine), buy more timber, and also pay for labour for her workers. 

In the future she plans to continue educating her children to the highest level, and also open another shop for her business.

loans.use: To buy timber for capentry work

loans.name: Komlavi

texts.fr: Il a 27 ans. Il est électronicien et maintenancier de profession mais associe la vente de portables.  Il s’approvisionne  au port autonome  de Lomé  et revend dans son atelier à N’kafu à côté de la pharmacie de peuple. Il exerce cette activité il y a de cela 3 ans. IL sollicite un nouveau crédit pour répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: This young man is 27 years old. He works in electronics and maintenance, but also sells mobile phones. He buys his stocks at the autonomous port of Lomé and sells the merchandise in his shop, in N'kafu, next to the people's pharmacy. He has been engaged in this activity for three years. He is seeking a new loan to meet a steadily growing demand.

loans.use: Purchase of mobile phones

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 55-year-old man working in the medicA. sector since 2007 with a big experience in this field. 

Adnan is married and the father of four children. His family is his first priority, and that’s why he’s requesting a loan from A. Majmoua, in order to pay for his children's school fees. His aim is to teach his children in the best way and in the best schools ever. 

Adnan is well known in his area, in business and among neighbors. He hopes to make a business which will be a good investment for his children in the future.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is not currently in school. Sarah has a business of a hotel, which she has had for eight years. She also sells charcoal.   

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 200000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a charcoal stove for the hotel and also to buy clothes. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. 

In the future, Sarah hopes to own a retail shop. Sarah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which is helping her prospects for the future.

loans.use: To buy a charcoal stove for the hotel and also clothes

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia N. is a single woman with four children. Two of them attend school and two have graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For more than 15 years, she has operated a retail shop, selling wheat flour, maize flour and biscuits. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Anastasia hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business. With the KES 20000 loan, she wants to purchase two bundles of wheat flour, one sack of sugar, rice and one box of biscuits and sweets for sale.

loans.use: To purchase two bundles of wheat flour, one sack of sugar, rice and one box of biscuits and sweets for sale

loans.name: Savzali

texts.ru: Амонов Савзали проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 68 лет. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Более 12 лет занимается торговлей. Арендует торговую точку на рынке "Саховат". Он в основном продает овощи. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Savzali A. lives in Kulob and is 68 years old, married with five children. He has a secondary education and more than 12 years in sales. He rents a stall in the market "Sahovat" where he sells mostly vegetables. He is asking for a loan to increase his sales.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Erdenebayar

texts.en:
Erdenebayar C. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. His daughter, age 4, is in kindergarten. 

Erdenebayar and his wife operate a book-trading business. They sell a variety of books, both retail and wholeale,  in the book-trade center. They started this business in 2005 and today, their working capital has reached 5000000 MNT. 

For the future, they hope to continue operating their business with stable operation and open their own book shop. Erdenebayar is a modest man. He is requesting a 2000000 MNT loan to use, together with his savings, in order to purchase a car for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a car for his business

loans.name: Lazia

texts.en:
Lazia K. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Lazia has a business of selling drinks, which she has had for two years. She also does tailoring.  

To help expand her business, Lazia has requested a loan of 200000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more drinks. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Lazia hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  

In the future, Lazia hopes to become a teacher. Lazia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her to overcome some of her challenges.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel Okoko

texts.en:
Emmanuel Okoko K. is 31 years old, married and a father of one child. He runs a computer training college in Mombasa's Mikindani town, a business that has been in operation for six years.

Emmanuel is borrowing his first loan from KADET to finance his business.  He plans to buy more computers for his college, and hopes to expand his business to other towns in Mombasa with his profits and subsequent KADET loans. 

He hopes to be very successful in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more computers

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao K. is a 51-year-old man who lives in the province of Kompong Tom. He drives a car taxi between his village and Phnom Penh City every day, and can make a profit of approximately $6.5 per day.  Sao K. has four children, two are single, and the other two are married. 

To generate extra income, Sao K.’s wife has built a pigpen behind their house where she raises many pigs. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Sao K. and his family, Sao K. has requested a loan for his wife to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale during the period when pork is commanding the highest prices. 

Sao K. was not available while taking photo so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Rutwe Kwetungura Group

texts.en:
A. Runyansi is the leader of Rutwe Kwetungura group in Kihihi. He is 34 years old and married with 6 children, with 5 of them in school. 

A. is involved in the sale of produce from Kihihi town council.  He also owns a motorcycle that he hires out, and is able to earn income every day. In total, he is able to make 50,000 UGX in weekly net profits.   As another side business, A. is also involved in brick laying, from which he got money to start up his current businesses. 

He needs a loan to be able to buy more matooke for reselling. He is a cooperative man who works hard to ensure that his business expands, and to have a stable family. A. is a new client of Pearl and he hopes for the best.

loans.use: To buy matooke for resale

loans.name: Ochirsuren

texts.en:
Ochirsuren L. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest son attends a local primary school. 

Ochirsuren owns and operates his own wooden product business, specializing in ger parts, ger furniture, and other larger furniture pieces. He started his business in 2007, making a variety of wooden items in his home, after working and living in the countryside as a herder till 2006. 

All of his products are made with great care and attention to detail, which has earned him a reputation among his customers as a quality furniture provider. He usually produces a variety of wooden items according to his customers' orders. 

For the future, he hopes to continue to operate his business with stable operation so that he can afford to buy a car for his business. His only wish is to provide a good education for his children. 

He is requesting a 1200000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of wood and timber for his furniture-making business.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of wood and timber

loans.name: Oscar Kithenge

texts.en: Oscar Kithenge M. is 32 years old, married, and has two children. Oscar has been a retail shop owner and a mobile hawker for the last three years.  With his second loan from KADET, Oscar plans to purchase a mobile kiosk.  He will use his profits for his children's education.  Oscar's dream for the future is to own a big wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase a movable kiosk

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en: Altantuya L. is a 45-year-old single parent. She lives with her two adult children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent with fence, in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her youngest daughter attends university while her oldest son helps with her business. Her husband passed away two years ago. Since 2000, Altantuya has been operating a public-transport service with help of her husband, using their own minibus within the city, but in 2008 her husband passed away and her son started to help her by working as a driver of their micro-bus. After many years of owning this business, she has gained much experience and has built a stable operation. For the future, Altantuya hopes to continue to grow her business and plans to build a house in her yard after her daughter's health gets better. She is a modest and honest woman. Her daughter is under very bad health conditions and therefore, Altantuya is requesting a 2,000,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to pay her daughter's medical treatment cost.

loans.use: To pay her daughter's medical treatment cost

loans.name: Kitinda Traders Group

texts.en: Kandi N. is a member of the Kitinda Traders group. He is 40 years old, married, and has 14 children.  Kandi has a retail shop business where he sells posho, sugar, soap, and more for a profit. He has been in the business for 20 years and he acquired his start-up capital from agriculture after advice from a friend. He is a social and hard-working man who wants his children to have the best in life. Kandi also has a boda boda business; he is a farmer and he sells produce to earn additional income. He is requesting a loan to be able to expand his business by restocking his retail shop with general merchandise.

loans.use: To restock his shop with general merchandise

loans.name: Zahara

texts.en:
Zahara M. is the mother of two children aged seven and four and is married to Nicholas Mulunga who is a businessman. Zahara is trained to do salon-related services and has been in the business for three years.

This is the first time Zahara is borrowing from KADET LTD. She wants to expand her salon to serve her clients better, so she is intending to buy a hairdryer worth 15,000 KES. She will also use 15,000 KES to buy other salon-related beauty products such as shampoo, conditioners and chemicals for perming ladies’ hair. Zarah plans to plow her anticipated profits back into the business.

loans.use: To buy a hairdryer and beauty products

loans.name: Horolsuren

texts.en: Horolsuren A. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and adult son in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia. She and her family live together in their own ger, which has a fence. Her husband operates a transportation business, in which he using his own truck to supplement the family income. Horolsuren operates a meat trading business out of a stall at the Harhorin market, one of the big markets in the city. She purchases a large amount of meat during the summer and fall and preserves it for sale in the winter when it is in high demand. She started her business in 1994, and has since become very experienced in her trade. Today, her business is a very stable operation, and her working capital exceeds 4,000,000 MNT, while her daily average sales income has reached 220,000 MNT. In the future, she hopes to continue managing her business and keep it sustainable so that she can afford to one day buy her own apartment for her family. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve a large amount of meat.

loans.use: To purchase and preserve a large amount of meat

loans.name: Dilmurod

texts.ru: Бердиев Дилмурод проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 32 года. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Жена работает в колхозе. Сам Дилмурод имеет среднее образование. Уже год как занимается торговлей. Он продает в оптом рис. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Dilmurod B. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  He is 32 years old, married, and has three children. His wife works on a collective farm.  Dilmurod has a high school.  He has been working in sales for a year.  He sells rice wholesale.  He is taking out a loan to increase sales.

loans.use: Increasing sales

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima A. is 43 years old, married and has three children. Her husband works as a cattle keeper. In 1993, in order to find a means of subsistence, Salima began breeding cattle and farming. Salima and her family worked hard and managed to develop their farm. With their profits they were able to buy a used car.

Now Salima is applying for a loan of 60,000 KGS because she would like to buy cattle for fattening and resale. With the expected revenues generated as a result of the loan, Salima plans to expand her business.

About Bai-Tushum and Partners:

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable segment of Kyrgyzstan’s population. It is one of the leading microfinance institutions in the country. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services to rural and urban areas that leads to increased employment and meets the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. For over ten years, she has operated a beauty salon business; her customers include her neighbours and town dwellers. Elizabeth faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her beauty salon in the future. With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase hair oils for her beauty salon. She decided to join Yehu to get educated on the various products available and to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase hair oils for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy M. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Mercy has a tailoring business, which she has had for 5 years. To help expand her business, Mercy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mercy hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Mercy hopes to become an international designer. Mercy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects by teaching her job skills.

loans.use: To purchase materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She has operated a beauty salon for the past seven years, and her customers are mainly women. In addition, she sells clothes, which also contributes to her income. Eunice faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open a wholesale shop to sell beauty products in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of hair weaves for her beauty salon. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of hair weaves for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Rwashamaire Twetungye Group

texts.en:
Mary N. belongs to the Rwashamaire Twetungye group. She is 35 years old and married with four children aged between 12 and 19 years. 

Mary is involved in the sale of clothes and she also has a tailoring school with sewing machines for learners. She hires trainers in her school and as the students pay the fees, she makes about 250,000 shillings as profits including clothing sales. Mary has been in this kind of business for four years, having raised capital from agriculture. 

She is flexible, committed and a performer in life. Her dream is to purchase a plot of land and build a house while the children are in school. As a result of taking loans to reinvest in business, Mary’s income has increased.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for the business

loans.name: Odil

texts.ru: Яхёев Одил житель города Турсунзаде. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот для продажи. В этой области уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Y. Odil lives in Tursun-zoda City. He's fifty years old, married and has four children. He has a high school level of education and raises livestock for a living. For five years he has bred and then sold the cattle. He's asking for a loan to buy some more livestock.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
M. Joseph is a client of Pearl Microfinance from Kyenjojo. He is 42 years old and married with 4 children. He is a businessman involved in tea growing. He grows the tea from his shamba (fields) and sells to Mabale Tea factory in Kisangi. He is helped by shamba boys whom he temporarily employs. He is able to make 300,000 UGX as weekly profits and he also sells produce and timber from the same area.

Joseph was born in a tea growing home and is very hardworking, which helps him be successful in this business. At the moment, Joseph has a new livestock farm and he needs a loan to be able to put structures on this farm and to buy fertilizers for it.

loans.use: to put structures on the farm and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret B. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children. None of her children are currently in school. Margret has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for 2 years. To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Margret hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, Margret hopes to own a house. Margret is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid S. is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

Mesaid has been selling ground nuts, baobab super fruits, and wheat flour for the past four years. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of raw materials. She hopes to establish a cereals shop in the future.

With a loan of 20,000 KES, Mesaid wants to purchase sacks of ground nuts, baobab super fruit, and wheat flour. She joined Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of  ground nuts, baobab super fruit, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mirembe Katenga Group

texts.en: K. Herbert is the leader of the Mirembe Katenga group in Kyenjojo. He is 30 years old and married with 3 children. He has a retail shop in Kasasa, selling household items to residents in and around Kasasa. He is able to make 200,000 UGX as weekly profits. He has had the shop for 10 years and he needs a loan to be able to restock his shop with more merchandise. He says that he got his capital from his teaching salary and agriculture. Herbert is a hardworking and trustworthy man. As a result of taking loans, he has been able to buy a piece of land for continued agriculture.

loans.use: to restock his shop with more merchandise.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Christine has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Christine hopes to study tailoring.   Christine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her computer skills.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina K. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children who attend school.  Amina has a business of selling food, which she has had for 10 years.  

To help expand her business, Amina has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food, oil, and flour.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Amina hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Amina hopes to own a house.   Amina is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning new skills.

loans.use: To purchase food, oil, and flour

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter K. M. is 54 years old and has been in the grocery business for 32 years. He is married and a father of six children. Peter is borrowing his second loan from KADET to finance his business after successfully repaying his previous loan well and on time. With this loan, he plans to purchase more stock of bananas and to start a boutique business in Mombasa. With the profits from this investment, he hopes to expand his business and meet his family's needs. Peter's dream is to own a big boutique and beauty shop in Mombasa.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of bananas and to start a boutique business

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Scovia has a  retail shop, which she has had for one year.  She sells clothes.  

To help expand her business, Scovia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase  clothes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Scovia hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Scovia hopes to become a teacher.   Scovia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to sing and dance.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Morris Kioko

texts.en:
Morris Kioko is a single businessman aged 25 years. He runs a retail shop in the very busy Bissil market. His customers are mostly livestock traders. He was introduced to KADET by the credit officer.

Morris has been running his business for four years and his monthly profit is KES 16,000. This is his second loan from KADET, having repaid the first loan well and on time. He plans to use the loan as follows: KES 20,000 to buy sugar, KES 20,000 to buy rice, and KES 32,000 to purchase flour and snacks for sale. If this loan boosts the business, Morris plans to expand it to a wholesale store. Morris describes himself as hardworking and ambitious; he dreams of becoming a big wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To increase stocks of rice, sugar, flour and snacks

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara R. es  de la ciudad de Concepción, tiene 26 años y  está cursando el 3° año de la carrera de Administración de Empresas en la Universidad UNI NORTE de Concepción.

Su madre falleció hace dos años, y su padre trabaja en un aserradero del señor Ramirez Eusebio.

Clara actualmente trabaja con la empresa: Transportadora Concepción, desempeñándose como encargada Auxiliar Aministrativa hace mas de 3 años percibiendo un salario mensual de Gs 1.507.484, gracias a su esfuerzo ayuda a su padre y hermanos, y esta pudiendo cubrir sus gastos de estudio.

Clara tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera y ser un buen profesional para así poder algún día montar su propia empresa y ser exitoso en la vida, comenta Juan.

El solicita el préstamo para el pago de la mensualidad de su facultad y también para la compra de libros que está necesitando para estudiar.

Clara agradece este préstamo ya que le ayudará en su estudio y al mismo tiempo podrá contar con referencias crediticias que en el futuro será  de mucha importancia para concretar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Clara R. is from the city of Concepción.  She is 26 years old and in the third year of her Business Management degree from UNI NORTE de Concepción University.

Clara's mother died two years ago and her father works in a sawmill belonging to Mr Ramirez Eusebio.

Clara currently works for the company 'Transportadora Concepción' as an administrative assistant.  She has been working there for more than 3 years, making a monthly salary of 1,507,484 Paraguayan guaranis.  Thanks to her hard work she is helping her father and siblings and covering the cost of her studies.

Clara has a great desire to finish her course and become a good professional so that she can one day set up her own business and be successful in life.

Clara is requesting this loan to pay her monthly fee to her faculty and also to buy some books that she needs for her studies.

She is grateful for this loan since it will help her in her studies and at the same time she will have a credit record which will be very useful for her in the future when she wants to carry out some projects.

loans.use: To pay her monthly faculty fee and buy books

loans.name: Jenniffer Nduku

texts.en:
Jeniffer Nduku, 23 years old, operates a green grocery shop at the very busy Bissil market. She sells fruits and vegetables to Bissil residents. She is a single mother of one child, Kelvin Kioko, aged two and half years. She was introduced to KADET by other KADET clients.

Jeniffer has been running this business for a period of two years and her monthly profit is KES 7,900. This is her second loan from KADET, having repaid the previous loan successfully. She will use part of the loan to increase her stocks of fruits and vegetables and part of it to buy timber for expanding her stall. If the loan boosts the business, Jeniffer will buy a pickup and start buying cereals from upcountry (which is cheaper) and sell them to her customers. Jeniffer is hardworking and dreams of having a big grocery shop in the future.

loans.use: to increase her stocks of fruits and vegetables and to buy timber

loans.name: Fatumah

texts.en:
Fatumah N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Fatumah has a business of a restaurant, which she has had for five years.  She also sells clothes.         

To help expand her business, Fatumah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase cups and food.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Fatumah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Fatumah hopes to own a  house.  Fatumah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by reading books.

loans.use: To purchase cups and food

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic N. is 32 years old and married to Ngina, who is 28 years old and a farmer. They have been blessed with three children aged ten, nine and eight years old. Dominic has been in the shoemaking business for seven years, from which he earns a profit of 8,000 KES monthly. The fact that his wife contributes to meeting their daily expenses through her farming makes him succeed.

This is Dominic’s first loan from KADET LTD, to which he was introduced by a friend. He plans to use his expected profits to educate his children to the highest level possible. He hopes and dreams of owning a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase shoes, leather and other accessories

loans.name: Stela

texts.en:
Stela M. is 35 years old, married to Festus and is blessed with two children ages five and ten years old. Stela has run a retail shop for eight years and earns 30,000 KES a month. Her husband, a farmer, manages to meet most of their daily expenses, which gives her room for her business to grow.

A loan will boost Stela's income in the sense that she will have more stock in her retail shop to sell to her customers during this festive season. She plans to use the expected profits to educate her children to the highest level possible. Her dream is to grow her business into a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her shop

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Florence has a business of selling shoes, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more shoes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Florence hopes to own a salon.        Florence is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loans.use: To purchase shoes

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius O. is a twenty-nine-year-old hardworking man in Kisumu City located in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Nereah, and they have two children, Triza, aged six years and Jacktone, aged two years.

Julius operates a secondhand clothing business at Kondele, a major shopping center that is two kilometers from the heart of Kisumu. He has been in business for the last eight years, and his monthly income is 10,000 KES.

Julius is taking out his first loan from Kadet Ltd, which he will use to buy new clothing to stock for sale to meet the demands of his customers during the Christmas season. He hopes to generate more income, expand his business and improve living standards for his family.

loans.use: To buy new clothing to sell

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Sophie has a business of selling vegetables, which she has had for four years.         

To help expand her business, Sophie has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase vegetables.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sophie hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Sophie hopes to own another business.   Sophie is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Daniel  Tariton

texts.en:
Daniel Tariton, aged 29, sells quarry stones at Ngurunga, a very busy but remote area. He is a single man. He was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office.

Daniel has been selling quarry stones for a period of 10 years and his monthly profit is Kshs 15,000. This loan of Kshs 50,000 is his third loan with KADET. The previous loans were paid with no problem. With this loan, he plans to buy quarry stones for sale.  If the loan boosts the business, he will purchase livestock to trade in the near future.

Daniel describes himself as hardworking. He dreams that he will become a prominent business man in future.

loans.use: To buy quarry stones for sale

loans.name: Gabriel Setek

texts.en:
Gabriel Setek is 35 years old.  He runs a motorcycle transport business popularly known as “Bodaboda” at Bissil in Kajiado. He is married to Silvia,  who is a farmer and together they have five children:  Olelekuto (aged 12 years in class six), Sopiato (aged 10 years in class four), Ketura (aged nine years in class three), Sangana (aged seven year in class one), and Naisuli (aged two years in baby care). He was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office.

Gabriel has been running this business for a period of two years and his monthly profit is Kshs 9,000. This loan of Kshs 30,000 is his first loan from KADET LTD, and with it he plans to purchase another motorbike and employ one person to operate it as he supervises. If this loan improves the business, he plans to  buy still more motorbikes.

Gabriel, who describes himself as hardworking and focused, dreams of having many motorbikes in the future.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Victo

texts.en:
Victo N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.    Victo has a business of selling fish, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Victo has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase fish.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Victo hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Victo hopes to go back to school.  Victo is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Alaisa

texts.en:
Alaisa N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.    Alaisa has a business of selling charcoal, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Alaisa has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase charcoal.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Alaisa hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Alaisa hopes to own another business.  Alaisa is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by showing her how to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.   Hellen has a business of selling fish, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase fish.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Hellen hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Hellen hopes to become a teacher.    Hellen is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her positive behaviors.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es de la ciudad de San Ignacio Misiones, tiene 25 años, actualmente se encuentra trabajando como vendedora en la Empresa Tigo, con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue luchando por salir adelante y está estudiando informática, ya que en la actualidad es casi una obligación tener un conocimiento en esta área.
Ella solicita el préstamo para el pago de las cuotas.
María agradece este préstamo ya que le ayudará para continuar con sus estudios y así ampliar sus conocimientos.
texts.en:
María is from the town of San Ignacio Misiones.  She is 25 years old and is currently working as a saleswoman for the company Tigo.  Through hard work and determination, she is working to get ahead.  She is studying IT since it is currently almost obligatory to have knowledge of this field.  She is requesting a loan so that she can pay her course fees.

María is grateful for this loan which will help her to continue with her studies and thereby enable her to increase her knowledge.

loans.use: To pay her monthly fees

loans.name: Nancy  Wanjiku

texts.en:
Nancy Wanjiru, aged 34, runs a school in Githurai 44 Estate. The school classes are from classes 1 to 4.  She is married to Joseph Mburu and together they have two children, Annie aged 12 years and M. aged nine months. Nancy’s husband Joseph is currently not employed or in business, so Nancy is the sole bread winner in their home. She was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Thika Road office.

She has been running this business for a period of three years and her monthly profit is Kshs 17,000. This is her first loan with KADET,  She plans to use the Kshs 20,000 to buy more chairs and tables for the students, since the numbers will increase after the January intake. If this loan boosts the business, Nancy plans to save and buy a piece of land and build a school, since where she has set up the school now is rented and hence costly.

Nancy dreams that she will be able to educate her children to high levels, and empower them to be self-reliant and sustain themselves in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs and tables.

loans.name: Daphine

texts.en:
Daphine N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Daphine has a business of selling fish, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Daphine has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase fish.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Daphine hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Daphine hopes to go back to school.  Daphine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work hard.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Zuiaika

texts.en:
K. ZuIaika lives in the Masanafu neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.   She also takes care of additional family members (her relatives).    

ZuIaika has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. ZuIaika sells her products from home by means of retail.   ZuIaika has requested for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.    

The main business challenges for ZuIaika include transportation and thieves.  Her goal for her business is to own  a delivery van.   ZuIaika lives in a home that she owns.  She doesn't have access to electricity but has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mbwana

texts.en:
Mbwana J. is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Mbwana has operated his tailoring business for over five years. He faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in his business. He hopes to expand and operate as wholesaler in the future. 

With a loan of 20,000 KES, Mbwana wants to purchase cloth materials and garments for his tailoring shop. He joined Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials and garments

loans.name: Awoa

texts.fr: Awoa est mariée et  a en charge 2 enfants. Elle a 45 ans et exerce comme activité la vente de bijoux. Elle est née à Tchamba mais habite à Hédzranawoe. Elle cumule dans cette activité près de 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et expose son commerce à la devanture de sa maison. Elle sollicite un prêt  pour satisfaire plus de clients surtout en cette période de fin d'année où la demande est élevée.
texts.en:
Awoa is married with two children in her care. She is 45 years old, and makes a living selling jewelry. She was born in Tchamba but lives in Hédzranawoé. 

She has been in this business for almost ten years. She buys her stocks at the big market of Lomé and displays the merchandise at the front of her house. 

She is requesting a loan to satisfy more customers, especially in this year-end period where demand is higher.

loans.use: Buying jewelry

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 3 children, two of whom are in school.  Joyce has a business selling bananas.  She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Joyce sells her products at the market by means of retail.  

Joyce has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.  She also generates additional income through renting rooms and selling piped water.  

The main business challenges for Joyce include the rainy season and thieves.  Her goal for her business is to start going to the villages of Masaka and Mbarara for bananas.  Joyce lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bananas for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has been running a successful internet café business since 2006. This talented woman decided to open her business after seeing the need for such a business in her region. She was lucky when she opened her shop to be able to buy computers from a wholesaler at a good price. Since starting her own business, her family situation is getting better. Today, she is requesting a loan of $500 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to add new décor to her shop in order to attract more clients. In the future, she is hoping to open a computer accessories shop. She is pleased with her decision to obtain a loan from Ameen and satisfied with the loan amount.

loans.use: To add new décor to her shop

loans.name: Yaba

texts.fr: Yaba est mariée et a 27 ans. Elle est née à Bassar et réside à N’kafui.  Elle gère comme activité génératrice de revenus, la vente de produits congelés et compte dans cette activité 2 ans. Ensuite, elle revend à côté de la clinique  de l’Aéroport à Hédzranawoe. Elle compte dans cette activité 2 ans. Elle demande un nouveau crédit  pour augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en: Yaba is married and 27 years old.  She was born in Bassar and resides in N’kafui.  She manages an income-generating business selling frozen products and has two years of experience with this.  Yaba sells her goods next to the clinic at the Hédzranawoe Airport.  She is requesting a new loan to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: Buying frozen products

loans.name: Sharuwa

texts.en:
Sharuwa N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child.  Sharuwa has a business of stone quarrying, which she has had for one year. She also sells vegetables.  

To help expand her business, Sharuwa has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase both stone quarrying materials and vegetables.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sharuwa hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Sharuwa hopes to own a plot of land.    Sharuwa is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by reading story books.

loans.use: To purchase stone quarrying materials and vegetables

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child.  Jenifer has a poultry business, which she has had for seven years.         

To help expand her business, Jenifer has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase chicken feed.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jenifer hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Jenifer hopes to own a salon.        Jenifer is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia B. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children, one of whom attends school.  Asia has a business of selling timber, which she has had for seven years.  She is also a teacher.

To help expand her business, Asia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase timber materials.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Asia hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Asia hopes to own a hardware shop. Asia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loans.use: To purchase timber materials

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki A. is married and has one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Riziki has operated her coconut selling business for the past six years. She sells from home to villagers and a coast coconut farm company. In addition, she operates a boutique which contributes to her income.  Riziki faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the hot summer season, fewer coconuts are available for sale while during the rainy winter season, many coconuts are available for sale. She hopes to supply 5,000 coconuts in the future.

With a loan of 40,000 KES, Riziki wants to purchase 2,000 coconuts for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase 2,000 coconuts for resale

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline M. is a 35-year-old married lady who has five children. She operates a retail shop in the Marereni area in Malindi town.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the company’s existing clients. She is now taking her second loan which amounts to Kshs 75,000.  She plans to expand her business with it by buying more stock of goods to sell during the festive season and to repair the business premise. 

Jackline hopes that by doing this, her business will grow and she will be able to use the anticipated profit to help support her family, as well as be able to own a flourishing business premise.

loans.use: To buy more stock, and repair business premise

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Elle a 37 ans et est mariée. Elle a un enfant.  Pour contribuer au foyer, elle fait la vente de produits d’alimentation générale.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend au marché local d’agoe.  Avec ce nouveau crédit, elle espère augmenter son commerce. elle contribue aux charges de sa famille avec son revenu
texts.en: She is 37 years old and married. She has one child. To contribute to the household budget, she sells general food products. She toscks up at the big market in Lomé and resells at the local market in Agoe. With this new loan, she hopes to expand her business. She contributes to the family expenses thanks to her revenues.

loans.use: Purchasing groceries

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate M. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Immaculate has a food retail shop, which she has had for two years. 

To help expand her business, Immaculate has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sugar and food.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Immaculate hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Immaculate hopes to own a wholesale shop.  Immaculate is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to sing and dance.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and food

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.fr: Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle fait le commerce des œufs pour participer au foyer.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend au marché local de Kegue.  Elle cumule dans cette activité près de 4 ans. Elle espère accroitre son commerce grâce à ce nouveau crédit.
texts.en: She is married and the mother of two. She sells eggs in order to contribute to the household budget. She stocks up at the big market in Lomé and resells at the local market of Kegue. She has almost four years of experience in this business. She hopes to expand her business thanks to this new loan.

loans.use: Purchasing eggs

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children, one of whom attends school. Teddy has a business of selling shoes, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase shoes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Teddy hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Teddy hopes to own another business.   Teddy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work hard.

loans.use: To purchase shoes

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moreen N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has 1 child. None of her children is currently in school. Moreen has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for 2 years. She sells shoes as well.

To help expand her business, Moreen has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes and shoes. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Moreen hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, Moreen hopes to own a house. Moreen is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by knowing how to work hard.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica N. lives in the Nabulagala  neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, 2 of whom are in school.  Jessica has a business selling second-hand clothes.  She changed her business enterprise from charcoal selling to clothing.  She has been in this business for 1 year, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Jessica sells her products at the market by means of retail.   

Jessica has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.  The main business challenges for Jessica include the rainy season and defaulters.  Her goal for her business is to start going to the village of Luwero for charcoal.  

Jessica lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing pearls and jewelry

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema Z. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has 1 child, who is currently in school. Rehema has a business of a retail shop, which she has had for 2 years, where she sells food.  

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase a fridge. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rehema hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food. In the future, Rehema hopes to own a motor cycle. Rehema is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by knowing how to work hard.

loans.use: To buy a fridge.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace K. lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, 3 of whom are in school.  Harriet has a business selling bananas in Owino market.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.   Grace sells her products at the market by means of retail.  

Grace  has requested for a loan of 1000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.  The main business challenges for Grace include the rainy season and defaulters.  Her goal for her business is to start going to farmers for bananas.     Grace lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, paying utility bills, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bananas for resale

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (young sister).   Harriet has a business selling soft drinks.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Harriet sells her products at the market by means of retail. 

Harriet has requested a loan of 1000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy  more bags of passion fruits, sugar, and oranges.  She also generates additional income through a video library. The main business challenges for Harriet include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goal for her business is to start distributing her juice to different places within Kawempe. 

Harriet lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy passion fruits, sugar, and oranges

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has been working as a car and truck electrician for almost 15 years. He also sells electric equipment. In 2007, he opened his own shop. During this time, he has been able to build a good business reputation. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase additional tools. In the future, he hopes to continue the expansion of his business. He expects the coming year to be successful and to further increase his business productivity. His business income is important for supporting his wife and providing better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional tools

loans.name: Fadi

texts.ar:
فادي في عمر 35 سنة يعمل في نقل البضائع متزوج  وله 3 اولاد له في عمله حوالي 14 سنة له تاريخ جيد في المجموعة
طموح يحب عائلته ويريد ان يؤمن لهم معيشة سليمة وتقديم ما يستطيع لهم من مساعدة يواجه صعوبة في التطور العملي لأنه بحاجة الى الدعم المادي
انه يريد قرض من المجموعة بهدف شراء رافعة لنقل السيارات لحسابه لكي يعتمد على نفسه ويزيد من مدخوله له زبائن منوعة في جيران واقارب 
وتجار من محيطه
texts.en: Fadi is a 35-year-old husband and father of three who loves his family very much and wants to ensure a secure life for them. He has fourteen years experience trucking merchandise, with a varied customer base coming from his relatives, neighbors, and local merchants. He has a good credit history with Al Majmoua, but needs more financial assistance to further develop his business. Therefore, he is currently seeking a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase a lift so that he can tow cars. This would allow him to boost revenues and subsequently become more self-reliant.

loans.use: To purchase a tow lift

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar:
علي طموح يعمل في اكسسوار الدراجات النارية علي يحب عائلته فهو متزوج وينتظر مولود جديد لكنه يحلم بأن يؤمن له
معيشة كريمة علي عمره 34 سنة له في عمله 8 سنوات له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه محبوب يحب عمله ويطمح دائما الى تطوير نفسه وعمله
يريد من خلال طلب قرض له المجموعة شراء دراجات نارية قديمة وبيعها بالمفرق وشراء قطع غيار دراجات نارية له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه
يلقى دعم من عائلته بشكل مميز حيث
texts.en: Ali is a 34-year-old husband and soon-to-be-father who wants to secure a dignified living standard for his growing family. Ali has eight years experience dealing in motorcycle accessories, and he is very popular with his customers who come from the neighborhood and other local communities. Ali loves his work and is always striving to further develop it. In that vein, he is interested in asking for a loan from Al Majmoua to buy motorcycle parts and old motorcycles which he could retail.

loans.use: To purchase used motorcycles for repair and resale

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
