Mwanamisi is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school while two graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a cafe business for the past year which she operates from home. Her potential customers are school children, neighbours and passersby. Mwanamisi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to establish a hotel in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a sack of rice and a bundle of maize flour.

loans.use: To purchase one sack of rice and one bundle of maize flour.

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a food selling business from home for over eight years, and her potential customers are neighbours, college students and passersby. Mesaid faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season it becomes difficult to operate from home. She hopes to establish a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil and green vegetables for her food stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil and green vegetables for her food stall.

loans.name: Joseph Nandokha

texts.en:
Joseph Nandokha M. is 64 years old and married to Mary Nanjala. Together they have four children, ages 25, 20, 18 and 10 years old respectively. He is a businessman who operates posho (corn) mill in Kitale-Kenya. He has been running this business for the last two years, where he has been making a profit of Kshs.30,000 per month.

He learned about KADET from a friend who is already registered as a client. This will be his third loan of Kshs.60,000. He is increasing the loan to buy a new posho mill machine. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to build a permanent house to use for maize storage. 

In his future, Joseph hopes to grow his busines, build a rental house, and to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: To buy a new posho (corn) mill machine.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old engaged woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents and four siblings. She works for a construction company and, at the same time, she pursues a home business. She is working as a private teacher receiving students. She works at two jobs to be able to make a good profit to help her fiancée with all the marriage and life preparations such as home expenses, marriage expenses, etc. She also helps with her family's expenses. 

Today, she is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to prepare a special teaching room and start taking more students. In the future, she hopes to continue expanding this business. She expects the coming year to be successful and to further increase her business productivity.

loans.use: To prepare a special teaching room and start receiving more students

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Sarr

texts.fr: MONSIEUR A. SARR EST COMMERÇANT SPÉCIALISE DANS L'ÉLEVAGE ET LA VENTE DE MOUTON.IL A EU A FAIRE CETTE ACTIVITÉ DES LE BAS AGE.FACE A UNE FORTE DEMANDE DE SES CLIENTS IL SOLLICITE CE MONTANT POUR POUVOIR LES SATISFAIRE.
texts.en: Mr. A. Sarr is an entrepreneur who raises sheep for sale. He has been doing this  line of work since an early age. Facing an increased customer demand, he is seeking this loan so as to satisfy his customers’ needs.

loans.use: Bolstering business capital

loans.name: Tabitha Achieng

texts.en:
Tabitha Achieng O. is 26 years old, married to David Wanyonyi, and she is blessed with two beautiful children. She sells secondhand clothes in Mitume in Kitale Town. She has been in this business for two years and gets a monthly income of Kshs.20,000

This will be Tabitha's second loan from KADET, and she plans to use the loan to buy two bales of ladies dresses worth twenty thousand shillings and two bales of T-Shirts worth twenty thousand shillings. With the income she is going to get, she plans to educate her children, buy a plot of land in the future, diversify her business, and open another business.

Tabitha also wants to educate her children to the highest level, buy a lorry, and start transport business in Kitale.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes for resale

loans.name: Eunice Wanjiru

texts.en:
Eunice has been making dresses to sell in Naivasha town for the last four years. She is 26 years old, married to Joseph Maina, and they have one child.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend, and this will be her second loan. She paid off her first loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time. She wants to use the loan amount to buy more fabric so that she can make more dresses for selling during festival and holiday season.

In the future, Eunice hopes to start selling fabric in bulk in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy more fabric so that she can make more dresses for selling.

loans.name: Batuli

texts.en:
Batuli is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school while one is too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a boutique for the past three years, selling by retail lesos and kikois (cloth wraps) to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she does farming which contributes to her other source of income. Batuli faces a major challenge of the high cost of paying for rental business houses. She hopes to expand and open a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase kitchen utensils and cloth materials for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen utensils and cloth materials for resale.

loans.name: Uamsho Group

texts.fr: Kavugho Immaculée est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Uamsho,  âgée de 44 ans, mère de 8 enfants, tous étudient confortablement. Son mari est chômeur. Elle fait le petit commerce de vente des patates douces, légumes, manioc, fruits, etc.  Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari, d’environ 100$. Il ya 2 ans, qu’elle est en activité. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$. Elle installe ses produits  au long de la rue ambiante dans le quartier majengo. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  3 paniers de manioc, bananes, avocats, aubergines, légumes, etc. En plus, elle ambitionne acheter un vehicule transporteur de ses marchandises. La cliente Kavugho I. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe Uamsho est composé de 18 membres.
texts.en: Kavugho Immaculée  is an entrepreneur and the leader of the Uamsho group. She is 44 years old and has eight children, all of whom are doing good progress in their studies. Her husband is unemployed. Her business is selling yams, vegetables, manioc, fruit etc. She had launched her business  with her own starting capital of about 100 dollars received from her husband.  Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari, d’environ 100$. She has two years of experience. At a later point, she obtained a loan of 50 dollars from IMF. .She displays her goods at a major stree in the Majengo district. This new loan will allow her to buy three baskets of manoc, bananas, avocados, aubergines, vegetables etc. In addition, her goal is to purchase a vehicle to transport her goods. As a client, Kavugho I. appreciates Hekima's work in providing assistance to the poor who don't have access to the traditional banking system. It should be noted that the Uamsho group is composed of 18 members.

loans.use: 3  baskets of manioc, bananas, avocados, aubergines, vegetables, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George Ondingo is 44 years old, from Kibuye in Kisumu city, married to Mary, and they have five children: Lucy, Eunice, Kevin, Vivian, and Linet.

George is a carpenter and has been in this business for the past 10 years. He is applying for his second loan from Kadet Ltd after successfully completing the first one. George intends to use the money to buy timber, velvet-type material and sheets of foam for making sofa sets (couches). He intends to use the profits to boost his wife’s business too.

His dream is to open up other workshops in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: Buy more timber, velvet upholstery farbic, and foam sheets so that he can construct sofas.

loans.name: Siham

texts.ar:
: سهام عمرها 53 سنة سهام تعمل في مطعم لبيع الدجاج والسمك متزوجة ولها ولدان سهام طموحة تحب عائلتها وتعيلها
تساعد في تعليم اولادها لها في العمل منذ 6 سنوات  تريد توسيع مصلحتها حتى تزيد من مدخولها انها من النساء القلائل التي تعمل بهذا المجال
تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى زيادة البضائع للمحل وتحسين المحل تلقى دعم كبير من العائلة وتريد ان تحسن من مستوى عائلتها
المعيشي
texts.en: Siham is a 53-year-old wife and mother of two who loves her family and has been providing for them for the past six years by working at a chicken and fish restaurant. As one of a few women occupied in this field, she wants to further grow her business by seeking a loan from Al Majmoua to procure more stock for her establishment.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies for restaurant

loans.name: Digan Isidra

texts.es:
Digan de 46 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín esta zona es caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y lomas.  

Empezó hace 1 años atrás con unos pequeños ahorros que tenia ya que se canso de recorrer las calles ya que ella era vendedora de ropa. Poco a poco modifico su la parte delantera de su casa y coloco la tienda con algunas vitrinas y víveres de primera necesidad. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Uno de los productos que más se vende en la tienda es el arroz,, azúcar, aceite.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, enlatados para surtir más su tienda. En el futuro quiere agrandar el local ya que ahora es muy estrecho.
texts.en:
Digan, 46 years of age, has a grocery shop in the front part of her house. She lives in an outlying urban area called Fortín characterized by its dirt roads and hills. 

One year ago she began her business with a small amount of savings since she had tired of plying her clothing wares in the streets. Little by little she modified the front area of her house and set up the shop there with some display cases and basic commodities. Currently she works from 6 am to 9 pm every day of the week. Some of her shop's best-selling products are rice, sugar and oil. 

With the loan she wants to buy rice, sugar and canned goods to better stock her store. In the future she would like to expand the premises since at this time they are quite narrow.

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Burume

texts.fr: Burume B. est entrepreneur, directeur d’une école primaire Shaba, conventionnée catholique,  âgée de 47  ans, père d’une famille de 6 enfants, tous étudient confortablement. Il est éducateur, il ya 15 ans qu’il exerce cette profession d’enseignement. Son épouse fait  le petit commerce de vente des produits vivriers pour suppléer aux charges de leur ménage.  Monsieur Burume B. bénéficie de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima pour ses différents projets familiaux (construction de la maison et business). Le  client Burume B. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique, particulièrement les enseignants de la RDCongo. Cette photo est prise a l’intérieur du bureau de l’école. Les écritons entre coupe en arrière plan fait référence au « microbe »
texts.en: The entrepreneur Burume B. is the principal of Shaba Primary Catholic School. He is 47 years old, married and the father of six children, all of whom are doing good progress in their studies. He is an educator. He has been teaching for 15 years. His wife sells groceries in order to provide supplementary income for their household. Mr. Burume B. has received a loan from IMF Hekima for various family projects (housing construction and the retail business). As a client of Hekima, Burume Bismimwa appreciates its assistance to the poor who are excluded from the traditional banking system, such as teachers in Congo. This photo is taken inside the school office. The sign in the background makes a reference to a “microbe.”

loans.use: Family projects (housing construction and business)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with two children - one attends school while the other one is still young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a dress making business for the past six years, and her potential customers are neighbours and school children. Mwanakombo faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During wedding ceremonies and festive seasons she gets a lot of customers, while when there are no weddings or ceremonies the business is very low. She hopes to expand in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 loan she wants to purchase one roll of cotton material, a dozen zippers, buttons, needles and an iron box. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and run her business smoothly.

loans.use: To purchase one roll of cotton material, a dozen zippers, buttons, needles and iron box.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred W. is a man of twenty-seven years, married to Carolyne, and is blessed with two beautiful children. They live in Kapomboi in Kitale Town. Fred has a transpotation business as his primary business but also does dairy business. He has been in this businesses for one year now and gets a monthly income of nine thousand shillings. 

This will be Fred's second loan from KADET, and he paid his previous loans well. He plans to repair his motorcycle so that he can serve his customers better. He wants to buy new tires for the motorcycle, plus buy dairy feed worth ten thousand shillings.

In future, Fred wants to buy another motorcycle so that he can expand his transport business. He also wants to start a taxi business and educate his children so that they can have a better life.

loans.use: To service the motorcycle and buy animal feeds

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence G. W. is thirty years old. She is married and her husband is a businessman. She is a mother of one child whom she hopes to give a good education to the university level. Her business is located at a busy commercial area in Kajiado town, but she is served by the Kitengela branch.

She owns a general store in which she sells such items as sugar, cooking flour, detergents and other items. She has been in this business for the last nine months and employed three people. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are very many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers, hence customers are spoilt for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 80,000 to buy more general items to expand her business which will earn her income during the Christmas festivities. She hopes to grow her business and build a residential house for her family. She describes herself as honest and focussed.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil, flour etc.

loans.name: Zoulfikar

texts.ar:
ذو الفقار له من العمر 24 سنة يعمل في تصليح الدرجات النارية له في العمل حوالي 8 سنوات يحب عمله
ويجيده يطمح الى تحسين وضعه المادي والاجتماعي وتطوير نفسه وعمله يلقى دعم كبير من العائلة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة
شراء قطع اكسسوار للدرجات النارية وزيادة المدخول يسعى الى الاعتماد على نفسه وتحويل المصلحة الى صالحه
texts.en: Zoulfikar is a 24-year-old young man who wants to develop himself and improve his financial situation. With eight years experience in motorcycle maintenance, Zoulfikar is now asking for a loan from Al Majmoua to obtain new bike accessories. His ultimate goal is to become self-reliant by taking over ownership of his shop.

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle accessories

loans.name: Yaser

texts.ar:
ياسر في عمر 28 سنة يعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية اعزب له في عمله 5 سنوات ياسر طموح يحب عمله
يرغب في تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي له ولعائلته يلقى دائما الدعم من العائلة والمحيط الاجتماعي يريد من خلال طلب قرض من
المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة للمحل مواد غذائية وحبوب وسكاكر انه يعاني من منافسة شديدة في محيطه العملي
texts.en: Yaser is a 28-year-old single man who is very impassioned about his work and who wants to improve his financial situation and that of his loving family. Yaser has been working at a market for the past five years and is now seeking a loan from Al Majmoua to buy food items to sell such as candy and grain products for his store in order to be able to stay afloat against tough competition.

loans.use: Purchase foodwares for shop

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with one child who is still young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a paraffin selling business for the past six months, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she sells firewood to her neighbours which contributes to her other source of income. Mwanakombo faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, she experiences a low number of customers, while during the hot summer season the demand for firewood is high. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase 20 litres of paraffin for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 20 litres of paraffin for resale.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “NUEVA ESPERANZA” es uno grupo antiguo en el Centro focal de Villa Exaltación, cuenta con 14 ciclos, es decir siete años.  La mesa directiva para este ciclo Nº 15 tiene como presidenta a la señora Vicencia, como tesorera Carmen y como secretaria de actas a la señora Candelaria. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: venta de bolígrafos, venta de fruta, comercio de verdura, venta de vajilla, empresa de Eventos (preparación de comida, alquiler de vajilla y decoración de fiestas), venta en tienda, venta de comida, dulces, cerveza según la temporada, venta de bolígrafos, comercio de librería, venta de ropa.

La señora Vicencia, presidenta de la banca comunal “Nueva Esperanza” es una de las  socias más antiguas, cuenta con ocho ciclos en la banca comunal.  Con respecto a su negocio  ella  lleva 25 años en el negocio de la venta de libros, el crédito que ahora ha solicitado  Bs.4000.- que será utilizado para la compra de libros.
texts.en:
The communal bank "NUEVA ESPERANZA" is an old group at the community center of Villa Exaltación, and has completed 14 cycles, which is to say seven years. The board of directors for this 15th cycle has Mrs. Vicencia as president, Carmen as treasurer, and Mrs. Candelaria as recording secretary. The businesses of the women are different, amongst them we have: pen sales, fruit sales, vegetable shop, tableware sales, event planning (food preparation, tableware rental and party decoration), retail sales, food sales, sweets, beer according to the season, pen sales, bookshop, clothing sales. 

Mrs. Vicencia, president of the communal bank "Nueva Esperanza", is one of the oldest members, and has completed eight cycles in the communal bank. With respect to her business, she has been in the book selling business for 25 years. The loan which she is asking for, BOB 4000, will be used to buy books.

loans.use: Purchase of books

loans.name: Lorena Jesenia

texts.es:
Lorena de 32 años, vende formulario del SRI (servicios de rentas internas del Ecuador). Vive en una casa de caña con sus dos hijos en una zona periurbana caracterizada por caminos de tierra y lomas llamada Fortín.   

Por la falta de empleo y la desesperante idea de mantener a sus dos hijos ella comenzó a recorrer las calles de Guayaquil buscando trabajo. Un día paso por el SRI y vio que muchas personas no sabían llenar formularios de impuesto, ella tuvo la idea de aprender todos los detalles de los formularios y comenzar a enseñarle a las personas llenándolos y vendiendo los formularios que compraba a un barato costo. Poco a poco fue conocida por las personas. En la actualidad ella vende y llena los formularios desde las 09h00am. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar formularios de declaración de impuestos. En el futuro quiere tener un local establecido ya que ahora solo lo hace ambulantemente.
texts.en:
Lorena, 32, sells SRI (Ecuadorean Internal Revenue Service) forms.  She lives in a house made from sugar cane stalks with her two children in a hilly periurban area known for its unpaved streets called Fortín.   

Due to lack of employment and the desperate need to support her children she started to traverse Guayaquil’s streets looking for work.  One day she passed in front of the SRI office and saw that many people did not know how to fill out their tax forms.  She got the idea to learn all the details about the forms and to start teaching people how to fill them out and selling the forms that she bought at low cost.  Gradually she became known by the people.  She currently sells and fills out the forms starting at 9am.

She will use the loan to buy tax declaration forms.  In the future she’d like to have an established locale because she currently has no fixed place to work.

loans.use: For forms.

loans.name: Tuamke Group

texts.fr: Hodari P. est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Tuamke,  âgée de 34 ans, mère de 4 enfants, tous étudient confortablement. Son mari est plombier. Elle fait le petit commerce de vivres (haricots et maïs). Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari, d’environ 50$. Il ya 4 ans, qu’elle est en activité. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima. Elle installe ses produits  au marché sectoriel de Majengo. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  2 sacs de haricots vers Rutshuru, zone agro rurale du Nord Kivu. En plus, elle ambitionne construire dans ses 2 parcelles acquises déjà. La cliente Hodari P. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe Tuamke est majoritairement fiminins.
texts.en: Hodari P. est an entrepreneur and the leader of the Tuamke group. présidente du groupe Tuamke. She is 34 years old and has 4 children, all of whom are doing good progress in their studies. Her husband is a plumber.   Her business is selling staple foods (beans and corn). She had launched this business with her own starting capital of aorund 50 dollars, received from her husband. She has been in business for 4 years. Later on, she obtained a loan from IMF Hekima. She displays her wares at the local market of the Majengo sector.  This new loan will allow her to buy two bags of beans from Rutshuru, a rural agricultural area in Nord Kivu.  In addition, her goal is to start construction works on her two plots of land already purchased. As a Hekima client, Hodari Pascalina appreciates its work in providing support to the poor who don't have access to the traditional banking system. It should be noted that the Tuamke group is composed mainly of women.

loans.use: two bags of beans

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: El señor José Antonio A. C. tiene un restaurante ubicado en el norte de la ciudad de Barranquilla. El es oriundo del norteño departamento de la Guajira y hasta el año 2006 se dedicaba al comercio de ropa y calzado entre las ciudades de Bogotá en Colombia y Caracas en Venezuela. Esta actividad dejó de ser rentable y el microempresario decidió estudiar culinaria en Barranquilla, el oficio que desde joven le apasionó. Para ejercer su nueva profesión, el señor José elaboraba comidas por encargo de sus amigos para fiestas y eventos sociales. Posteriormente abrió al público su propio restaurante y la aceptación ha sido grande, porque el lugar es acogedor, la comida es exquisita y los precios son económicos. La especialidad de la casa son los platos típicos de su natal Guajira como: arroz de camarón, productos del mar en salsa de coco y pernil de carnero asado. Este es el primer crédito que tramita el  empresario con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y lo invertirá en comprar víveres al por mayor y un enfriador nuevo que remplace la pequeña nevera que tiene en la actualidad. Mensualmente en el restaurante se venden aproximadamente 1500 comidas a un precio promedio de $4.500 COP, lo cual arroja unas ventas mensuales de $6.840.000 COP. El margen promedio de utilidad en las ventas es del 46.7%, ésta cifra demuestra la buena rentabilidad del negocio. El señor José planea ampliar las ventas ofreciendo sus comidas a domicilio en  medianas empresas y ya está haciendo los contactos necesarios. Por la cercanía de la temporada de fin de año, los pedidos de comidas especiales se han incrementado considerablemente. El microempresario se define como un hombre feliz que se dedica a deleitar el paladar de sus clientes con las mejores recetas de la gastronomía Colombiana.
texts.en:
Jose has a restaurant located in the north of the city of Barranquilla.  He is from northern Guajira Department, and until the year 2006, he sold clothes and shoes between the cities of Bogota in Colombia and Caracas in Venezuela.  The activity ceased to be profitable and this micro-empresario decided to study culinary arts in Barranquilla, a skill that had been his passion since his youth.

To exercise his new profession, Jose elaborated meals for his friends' fiestas and social events.  Subsequently, he opened his own restaurant and the public acceptance has been great, because his location is attractive, the food exquisite, and the prices affordable.  The specialties of the house are the typical dishes of his native Guajira, such as shrimp and rice, seafood in coconut sauce, and leg of pork.

This is his 1st loan with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, and he will invest it in provisions at wholesale, and a new refrigerator to replace the small icebox he has at present.  Monthly, the restaurant sells approximately 1,500 meals at an average price of 4,500 COP, which results in monthly sales of 6,480,000 COP.  The average profit margin is 46.7%, demonstrating the good profitability of the business.

Jose plans to expand his sales, delivering his meals to homes and medium enterprises, and he is currently making the necessary contacts.  In the short term, during this end-of-the-year season, orders for special meals have increased considerably.  This micro-entrepreneur can be defined as a happy man dedicated to satisfying the tastes of his customers with the best recipes of Colombian gastronomy.

loans.use: TO BUY PROVISIONS AT WHOLESALE AND A NEW REFRIGERATOR, TO REPLACE THE SMALL ICEBOX HE CURRENTLY USES

loans.name: Baloon Group

texts.en:
Telesia D. is in her mid-thirties and is married with four children. She has been selling  doughnuts, fabrics, sarongs, and drinking water for one year. She sells her products door to door and works from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm daily. She is able to make good monthly profits.

This will be Teresia's first motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She hopes to get a loan to pay her children's tuition fees, buy food for her family, make more doughnuts, and pack and sell 50-shilling bottles of drinking water to people who pass by near her house.

In the picture, Telesia is the lady standing first on the left.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees, to buy food, to make more doughnuts to sell, and to sell more water.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca de 46 años, vende cilindros de gas y bebidas. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor ubicada en una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas.  
 
Comenzó hace varios años atrás vendiendo bebidas para poder mantener a sus hijos ya que su esposo la abandono poco a poco surtió sus bebidas e implemento la venta de cilindros de gas por $ 2.50. En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano en un local que ubico en la parte delantera de su casa. No tiene horario fijo porque lo realiza en su casa. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cilindros de gas y bebidas a sus proveedores para tener más para vender. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio con otras ventas y readecuar su casa.
texts.en:
Francisca, 46 years of age, sells tanks of natural gas and drinks. She lives in an outlying urban area called Paraíso de la Flor located in an area characterized by its dirt roads and mountains.

She began her business some years ago selling drinks in order to be able to support her children since her husband left her. Little by little she stocked up on drinks and began selling cylinders of natural gas for $2.50. Currently she starts work very early in the morning in a shop she located in the front part of her house. She doesn't have a fixed schedule because she carries out her business activities at home. 

With the loan she wants to buy cylinders of natural gas and drinks from her suppliers in order to have more to sell. In the future she wants to expand her business to sell other products and remodel her house.

loans.use: To purchase tanks of natural gas and drinks

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two brothers. Eight years ago, he quit school and started working as a janitor with his father‘s friends. After getting the experience that he wanted, he began working independently on a freelance basis. He needs to develop his business, so he is asking for a loan of $1200 from Ameen s.a.l., a Kiva field partner, to improve his business and purchase more of the tools and supplies he needs. In the future, he plans to continue expanding his business and start taking home projects.

loans.use: To improve his janitorial business and purchase more tools and supplies

loans.name: Mana Ida

texts.fr: Ida est mariée et a 37 ans. Elle a en charge 2 enfants.  Elle est née à Lomé et habite Kégué. Pour contribuer au ménage, elle fait la vente d’huile de palme et compte dans cette activité  21 ans d’expérience.   A travers cette activité beaucoup de crédits  ont été remboursés.  Elle achète au grand marché  de Lomé et revend à la devanture de  sa maison. Elle sollicite un nouveau prêt pour augmenter  son commerce.
texts.en: Ida is married and 37 years old. She takes care of 2 children. She was born in Lomé and lives in Kégué. To contribute to the household budget, she sells palm oil, which she has 21 years of experience doing. Through this business, she has repaid several loans. She buys at the big market in Lomé and resells at the store in her home. She seeks a new loan to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas, de 47 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus seis hijos, de los cuales solo uno es menor y juntos trabajan cada día para salir adelante. Hace más de 4 años, esta empeñosa mujer se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles y de primera necesidad en la tienda instalada en una pieza de su casa. Le gusta mucho su negocio pues es tranquilo, y el horario de atención, es de 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, le permite realizar sus labores domésticas sin problemas. Cuando debe salir,  su menor hijo le ayuda en la atención o se turnan, o cuando el resto de sus hijos se encuentran disponibles. Además esta muy satisfecha pues obtiene regulares ganancias, ya que su negocio no tiene competencia cercana. Esta muy contenta pues con el tiempo ha logrado surtir muy bien su negocio y ahora puede ofrecer diversidad de productos a sus compradores. Tanbien alquila cuartos en su vivienda lo que le genera ganancias extras. Como es una dama muy empeñosa para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda e implementarla con mayor cantidad de mercadería. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Felicitas tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en productos comestibles, así como gaseosas y cervezas pues por temporada de verano necesita surtir bien su tienda.
texts.en:
Felicitas, 47 years of age, lives in her own home alongside her six children of whom only one is a minor. Together they work every day to get ahead. 

More than four years ago this enterprising woman began selling consumer staples in a store set up in one room of her house. She really enjoys her business because it is peaceful and the store's hours, from 8 in the morning until 9 at night, allow her to complete her household tasks without any problem. Whenever she has to go out her youngest child helps her by waiting on customers, or they take turns, or, when the rest of her children are available. In addition she is very satisfied because she receives regular earnings since the shop has no nearby competition. She is very happy since over time she has been able to stock her business very well and now is able to offer a wide range of products to her buyers. She also rents rooms in her home which generates additional earnings. 

Since she is a very hard-working lady in the future she plans to expand the facilities and stock it with a larger quantity of merchandise. This is her third loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually, as she does not wish to be in any trouble with the people who made this loan possible, a loan that will allow her to keep working in search of progress. Felicitas plans to invest the loan in the purchase of consumable products such as soft drinks and beer since in the summer season she must stock her store well.

loans.use: To purchase beer, soft drinks and other products to stock her store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 35 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Jesús de 37 años y de sus 2 hijos menores de edad; y juntos luchan por salir adelante en busca del progreso. Desde hace 2 años, esta empeñosa mujer se dedica a la venta de pescados frescos, de forma ambulatoria, en un mercado de su zona. Realiza su labor todos los días de la semana, incluso los feriados, desde las 6 de la mañana y se prolonga hasta las 3 de la tarde, además esta muy satisfecha pues obtiene generosas ganancias ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la frescura de sus pescados y los buenos precios que ofrece. También manifiesta que su labor la entretiene bastante porque mientras comercializa, conversa con sus compañeras; y esta actividad le permite estar pendiente de la educación de sus hijos. Lo que no le gusta de su labor es que muchas veces la mercadería no tiene salida rápida y eso afecta la permanencia del producto en buen estado, echándose a perder. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado comprar un puesto en el mercado y vender con mayor estabilidad. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en su negocio. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito en la compra de algunos implementos que le hacen falta como una nueva balanza para continuar vendiendo este producto no perecible.
texts.en:
María, 35, lives in her own house with her husband, Jesús, 37, and their two minor children.  Together they struggle to get ahead in search of progress.

For the last two years this enterprising woman has been selling fresh fish in an ambulatory fashion in one of her neighborhood’s markets.  She works every day of the week, including feast days, from 6am until 3pm.  She is very satisfied because she earns generous profits because her customers prefer the freshness of her fish and the good prices she offers.

She also states that her work distracts her a lot because while she sells she chats with her fellow workers.  This activity allows her to be watchful of her children’s education.

What she dislikes about her work is that sometimes the product does not sell quickly and this affects it’s staying in good condition, it spoils.

Because she’s an enterprising woman she plans to buy a stand in the market in the future to be able to sell with more stability.

This is her third loan with MFP and she promises to repay punctually in order not to disappoint the people who made this contribution that allows her to stay in business.

María plans to use the funds to buy some tools she needs like a new balance to continue selling this perishable product.

loans.use: To buy a scale.

loans.name: Yanice Lorena

texts.en:
Yanice is a 37 year old mother of four who lives with her family in Sarapiqui, located near the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. Yanice works from Monday to Friday in a local highschool. She usually wakes up early to prepare food for her family, then leaves for work.

Yanice also has a business making sales to clients she meets at the high school (parents, teachers, colleagues). She sells various types of catalogue items to friends, acquaintances and neighbors. Yanice plans to use this loan to invest in items such as clothing and home appliances. Her goal is to use this loan in order to generate revenues and make punctual repayments.

loans.use: For the purchase of catalogue items such as clothing and household items.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS MARGARITAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yovana; ella tiene 38 años D. edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la venta D. ropa, ella venD. ropa como pantalones, chompas, blusas y polos, la socia venD. en forma independiente llevando a diferentes tiendas que venden ropa y por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor. 

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta D. ropa, docencia, locutorio, restaurant y transporte.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Las Margaritas" [The Daisies] located in the district of Urubamba, provice of Urubamba and department of Cusco. 

The member is Yovana, 38 years of age, single and with two children. She sells clothing such as pants, sweaters, blouses and polo shirts. She sells independently, carrying her wares to various clothing stores, and by means of this business makes do for her children. The member is seeking a loan to purchase clothing wholesale. 

The other members work in clothing sales, teaching, a call center, restaurant and transportation. The member thanks those who form part of this dream by these means and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To purchase clothes wholesale

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es: Mirtha, D. 33 años, vive en casa D. sus suegros al lado D. ellos, D. su esposo José D. 33 años y sus 2 menores hijos; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Cada día esta emprendedora mujer empieza su labor desD. muy temprano, pues luego D. mandar a sus hijos al colegio se dirige a ofrecer los productos D. belleza, D. una reconocida marca, que comercializa a sus conocidos y clientes a través D. catálogo. Esta muy satisfecha porque es una labor tranquiL. ya que le permite dedicarse a sus hijos sin problemas; además le entretiene interactuar con sus clientes, y su capacidad D. persuasión  le permite convencer a sus compradoras para que adquieran cierto tipo D. productos que mejor le queden. Lo que no le gusta del negocio es que como ofrece los productos a crédito muchos clientes se demoran en el pago D. sus deudas; pero al final le pagan, pero le atrasa el movimiento D. su capital. Además tiene planeado instalar un pequeño bazar, donD. no solamente ofrezca sus productos, si no también adornos e implementos para el hogar. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete que cumplirá con el pago puntual D. sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Mirtha tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en L. compra D. cantidad D. mercadería en productos D. belleza, pues quiere tenerlos en stock para ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes, y D. esta manera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Mirtha, 33, lives in her in-laws’ house with them, her husband, José, 33, and their two minor children.  Together they struggle daily to get ahead.  

This enterprising woman starts her work day very early.  After sending the children off to school she heads out to offer beauty products of a well known catalogue brand to her acquaintances and customers.  She is very satisfied because the work is calm and she can dedicate herself to her children with no problem.  Besides, she enjoys interacting with her customers and her power of persuasion enables her to convince her buyers to get the product that best meets their need.  What she does not like about the business is that since she offers products on credit many customers lag behind with their payments although in the end they do pay; but this delays the circulation of her capital.

She plans to set up a small store where she won’t just offer these products but also decorations and items for the home.

This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she promises to repay on time because she does not want to disappoint the people who maD. this contribution that will allow her to stay in business seeking progress.

Mirtha plans to use the funds to buy a large amount of beauty products because she wants to have them in stock to offer the best to her customers thereby improving her profits.

loans.use: To stock up on beauty products.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Rosario; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de juguetes y también se dedica a la enseñanza D. nivel primario, la socia trae juguetes y los vende en forma independiente, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender los juguetes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar juguetes como muñecas, carros y juguetes en general.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Ricchary Cusco" located in the district of Cusco belonging to the province and department of Cusco. 

The member is Maria Rosario, 46 years of age, who is single and has two children. The member alternates her daily activities with a toy sales business and also works teaching elementary school. She transports toys and sells them independently. The member would like to have a shop from which to sell the toys. The member is seeking the loan to purchase toys such as dolls, cars and others. 

The member thanks those who make up part of this dream by these means and commits to making her payments with the established time period.

loans.use: To purchase toys such as dolls, cars and toys in general

loans.name: Zoraya

texts.es: La señora Zoraya C. Rodríguez tiene un restaurante en el norte de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Ella fue empleada durante varios años y al quedar sin empleo decidió crear su propio negocio. Aunque la señora Zoraya no tenía experiencia  en temas de culinaria, logró contratar a una experta cocinera que le enseñó todos los secretos del oficio. La mayoría de las ventas son de comidas corrientes a precios económicos por lo cual ha logrado conquistar una gran clientela formada principalmente por estudiantes universitarios y empleados de oficinas cercanas. La microempresaria considera que el éxito de su negocio se debe a la exquisitez de sus comidas, precios económicos y sobre todo al trato amable que le dispensa a todo el que la visita. Este es el sexto crédito que la señora Zoraya tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y el primer credikiva. Planea invertirlo en la compra de víveres y varias mesas y sillas plásticas. Siempre se ha destacado por su puntualidad en los pagos y mucho entusiasmo para participar en todas las actividades que organiza la Fundación. El restaurante vende en promedio 60 almuerzos diarios a $ 4.000 COP cada uno. El margen promedio de ganancia es del 41%. La señora Zoraya planea ampliar las ventas de platos especiales a empleados de oficinas cercanas con altos ingresos. Además de la usuaria, el negocio genera otros tres empleos directos a mujeres cabeza de hogar. La microempresaria se define como una mujer alegre que disfruta mucho su trabajo por el contacto diario con el público.
texts.en:
Zoraya C. Rodríguez has a restaurant in the north of the city of Barranquilla.  She worked for a company for several years but when she lost her job she decided to set up her own business.  Although she didn't have any experience in culinary matters, she managed to hire an expert cook who taught her all the secrets of the trade.  Most of her sales are of reasonably-priced fast food.  She has managed to attract a large customer base which is primarily made up of university students and people who work in nearby offices.  This small businesswoman considers that the success of her business is down to the excellence of her meals, her reasonable prices and above all the kind service which she gives everybody who visits her establishment.

This is Zoraya's sixth loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and her first Kiva loan.  She plans to invest it in buying supplies and a number of plastic tables and chairs.  She has always stood out because of the punctuality of her loan repayments and the enthusiasm which she has for taking part in all the activities which Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organizes.

Zoraya's restaurant sells on average 60 lunches a day at 4,000 Colombian pesos each.  Her average profit margin is 41%.  Zoraya plans to expand her sales of special dishes to nearby office workers with high incomes.  As well as employing its owner, her business has also created jobs for three women who are heads of their families.  Zoraya describes herself as a happy woman who really enjoys her work because she has daily contact with the public.

loans.use: To buy food supplies and several plastic tables and chairs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more phone cards and add more cash to his business

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es: Néstor, de 66 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposa María de 60 años y sus 4 hijos que son mayores de edad; juntos se esfuerzan por salir adelante. Cada día este empeñoso hombre se despierta muy temprano para empezar con la atención en su tienda que esta ubicada al lado de su casa. Con el transcurrir del tiempo ha logrado surtir mejor su negocio con variados productos comestibles y de primera necesidad, y tiene muy buenas ganancias con las ventas diarias, pues por la zona donde vive no tiene competencia cerca. Además su tienda esta abierta desde las 7 de la mañana hasta altas horas de la noche, en ocasiones sus hijos la apoyan en la atención hacía los clientes. Lo que no le gusta del negocio es que para surtirlo de mercadería debe ir a comprar los productos hasta la ciudad, lo que le quita tiempo y es una labor bastante  esforzada. Como es un hombre muy trabajador para el futuro tiene planeado mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio y construirlo de material noble, pues en la actualidad es de madera. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Néstor tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería para surtir mejor su tienda de comestibles y ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Néstor, 66 years of age, lives in his own home along with his wife María, 60, and their four children who are adults. Together they work to get ahead. 

Every day this enterprising man wakes up very early to begin attending customers in his shop which is located beside his house. With the passage of time he has been able to better stock his business with a variety of grocery products and other staples. He makes very good earnings because in the area where he lives he has no nearby competition. Furthermore his store is open from 7 in the morning until very late at night. Sometimes his children help him with customer service. One thing he doesn't like about his business is that in order to buy and stock his store with merchandise he must travel to the city which takes time and is quite an effort. 

As he is quite a hardworking man, in the future he plans to improve his facilities and build them out of more solid materials such as concrete blocks, since currently the store's building is made of wood. This is his third loan with MFP and he promises to repay promptly, since he doesn't want to get in trouble with the people who made this support possible and which will allow him to keep working in search of progress. 

Néstor plans to invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise to better stock his store with groceries and to offer his customers the best. In this way he hopes to keep on moving ahead.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products to better set up his shop

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr: Dopé a 35 ans et est  mariée . Elle a en charge un enfant. Elle améliore les conditions de vie de son enfant en faisant la vente de bijoux et couche pour bébé. Elle a remboursé déjà un crédit et compte dans cette activité 6 ans d’expérience. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend au marché de Hédzranawoe. Avec ce nouveau crédit,  elle espère acheter  un lot de bijoux et couche pour bébé.
texts.en: Dopé is 35 and married. She takes care of one child. She improves the living conditions of her child by selling jewelry and diapers. She has already repaid one loan and has 6 years of experience in this business. She stocks up at the big market in Lomé and resells at the market in Hédzranawoe. With this new loan, she hopes to buy more jewelry and diapers.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and diapers

loans.name: Giovanna Jazelli

texts.es:
Giovanna Planeó todo muy bien, pagó rápido su credikiva inicial para renovarlo en este momento y lograr invertir nuevamente en una época en que se proyecta la gran movilizacion comercial, el cierre del año y  especialmente en el principio de cada año por el regreso de la jornada escolar y sus  rentables clientes, son los estudiantes jóvenes y padres de familia. Con la renovación de su crediKiva surtirá su negocio con papelería cuadernos, bloques de hojas, cartulinas y accesorios escolares para responde a la gran demanda que se avecina, igualmente comprará tintes, esmaltes, manillas, aretes y anillos para que sus potenciales clientes fijen la mirada en sus vitrinas decoradas elegantemente de acuerdo a la época navideña. Giovanna es una mujer muy agradecida y envia un mensaje a todos los de Kiva:"Gracias por confiar en los jóvenes empresarios, que buscan obtener un ingreso mediante su negocio para ayudar a nuestras familias " Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Giovanna ingrese al siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/203610
texts.en:
Giovanna planned everything very well.  She repaid her Kiva loan quickly in order to renew it now and reinvest again during this season that promises much commercial movement.  The end of the year and especially the beginning of the year when the school year starts is when her most profitable customers, students and parents, return.

By renewing her Kiva loan she will stock her business with stationery items: notebooks, writing tablets, construction paper and school supplies to respond to the approaching demand.  She will also buy dyes, nail polish, bracelets, earrings and rings so that her potential customers will fix their attention on her display cases elegantly decorated with Christmas themes.

Giovanna is a very grateful woman and sends a message to everyone at Kiva:  “Thank you for trusting in young businesspeople who seek to earn income through their businesses in order to help our families.”

If you’d like to know Giovanna’s story, please follow this link:

http://kiva.org/lend/203610

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Amira Florinda

texts.es:
Amira de 42 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Guasmo. Hace 1 años atrás ella comenzó con su tienda ya que necesitaba un ingreso para ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios ya que no está casada. 

Trabaja en la tienda vendiendo arroz, azúcar, bebidas, enlatados desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. La libra de arroz la vende a $ 0.30, bebidas de $ 1.25, confites a $ 0.05. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, enlatados para mejorar las ventas en su tienda. En el futuro quiere que su tienda sea agrande y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Amira, 42, has a grocery store in the front part of her house.  She lives in a periurban zone called Guasmo.  A year ago she opened the store because she needed a source of income to help her children with their education since she’s unmarried.

She works in the store selling rice, sugar, beverages and canned goods from 8am until 9pm every day.  She sells a pound of rice for $0.30, beverages are $1.25 each and candy is $0.05.  She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar and canned goods to improve her store’s sales.  In the future she hopes the store will be larger and she wants to improve her dwelling.

loans.use: For sugar and rice.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Née en 1975 à Adjohoun  dans l’ouémé au Bénin, G. Antoinette est mariée à YETONGNON Mahougnon. Antoinette est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis huit ans dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin.  Le couple supporte ensemble les charges familiales. Antoinette exerce comme activité la vente de sac de maïs, de pain sucré à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est également à Cotonou que Antoinette achète ses produits. Antoinette a été à l’école jusqu’au cours primaire et cela fait déjà cinq ans qu’elle mène cette activité. Antoinette a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé qui ont tous été bien remboursés.  Antoinette désire renouveler sa marchandise et diversifier ses produits, c’est la raison pour laquelle elle souhaite obtenir un quatrième prêt à ALIDé. Antoinette voudrait plus tard augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Born in 1975 in Adjohoun in l’Ouémé in Bénin, Antoinette G. is married to Mahougnon Yetongnon. Antoinette is the mother of 3 children, all of whom attend school. The family has been living in the village of Sèmè-Podji in Bénin for eight years. The couple share household expenses. Antoinette sells bags of corn and sweet bread in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Antoinette also stocks up in Cotonou. Antoinette attended school through elementary school and she has been selling her products for five years. Antoinette has already benefitted from three loans with ALIDé which were all repaid. Antoinette would like to replenish her stock and diversify her product offerings, which is why she seeks this fourth loan from ALIDé. Later, Antoinette would like to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy a bag of corn, a box of fish, and some sweet bread

loans.name: Francisca

texts.fr: A. M. Francisca est née le 17 février 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Francisca est mariée à GANHOUNEDO Eugène, un plombier, avec qui elle a trois enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble depuis sept ans à Kpakpakanmè, un quartier de de la ville de Cotonou. Le couple partage ensemble les charges familiales. Pour seconder son mari, Francisca  exerce comme activité la vente de friperies (habits pour hommes, femmes et enfants) à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Francisca s'approvisionne à Missèbo, le grand marché de friperie de la sous région se trouvant au Bénin. Francisca n’a jamais fréquenté l’école et exerce son activité depuis sept ans. Francisca a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé qui a été bien remboursé. C’est pour renouveler son stock que Francisca souhaiterait bénéficier d’un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé. Francisca a le souci de renforcer son activité plus tard.
texts.en:
Francisca A. was born on February 17, 1976 in Cotonou, Benin’s economic capital. She is married to Eugene Ganhounedo, a plumber. Together they have three children, who all go to school. The family has been living in Kpakpakanmè, a district of Cotonou, for seven years. They both share the financial responsibilities of their family. 

To assist her husband, Francisca sells second-hand clothes (for men, women and children) in Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. Francisca gets her merchandise from Missèbo, a large second-hand clothes market of this sub-region of Benin. Francisca never attended school and has been working for seven years. She already got a first loan from Alidé, which was paid back in full. Francisca would like to get this loan from Alidé in order to renew her stock. She wishes to strengthen her activity in the future.

loans.use: Buying second-hand clothes in bulk

loans.name: Safina Group

texts.fr: M. J. est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Safina,  âgée de 38 ans, mariee, mère de 11 enfants. Son mari est ferrailleur. Elle fait le petit commerce de vente de jus traditionnel Musururu. Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Il ya 2 ans, qu’elle est en activité. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima en 2008. Elle installe ses produits  son domicile. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 3 sacs de sorghos. En plus, elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle et y construire.  La cliente M. J. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe safina est majoritairement fiminins.
texts.en:
J. M., 38-years-old, is a married mother of eleven. She is an entrepreneur and the president of Safina microloan group. Her husband is a scrap metal dealer. She has a small business of selling traditional Musururu juice. She started it two years ago with the capital she received from her husband. Later, in 2008, she received a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She set up her products at home. This new loan will be used to purchase three bags of sorgohos, a plant. Moreover, she aspires to buy a plot of land and to use it to build.
J. M. thanks Hekima for taking actions to help the poor people who cannot access to the traditional banking system. The majority of Safinia group’s members are women.

loans.use: To buy 3 bags of sorghos

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ararati Group

texts.fr: Kabala M. est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Ararati,  âgée de 38 ans, veuve, mère de 3 enfants, tous étudient confortablement. Son mari est décédé depuis longtemps suite à une courte maladie. Elle fait le petit commerce de vente souliers. Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Il ya 10 ans, qu’elle est en activité. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima en 2008. Elle installe ses produits  au long de la rue ambiante. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir dans la nouvelle activité de vente poissons qu’elle veut initier d’ici là. En plus, elle ambitionne construire une maison. La cliente Kabala M. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe Ararati est majoritairement feminins.
texts.en: Kabala M. is an entrepreneur and President of the Ararati group.  She is 38 years old, a widow and a mother of three children.  All her children are studying comfortably.  Her husband died a long time ago after a short illness.  She has a small business of selling shoes.  She started the business with her own money, which she received from her husband.  She has been in business for 10 years.  Later in 2008, she benefited from a loan from the MFI Hekima.  She set up her products for sale along the road.  This new loan will go towards her new business of selling fish, which she wants to start now.  Moreover, it is her ambition to build a house. The clients of Kabala M. thank Hekima for their work helping the poor who are excluded from the traditional banking sector.  It is important to note that the Ararati group is mostly women.

loans.use: 3 baskets of fish and 20 pairs of shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Agbagansi

texts.fr: Elle a 42 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Elle contribue au foyer  en faisant la vente de céréales et de condiments. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et compte dans cette activité 22 ans d’expérience. Elle revend ensuite à Attiégou. Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 20 bols de maïs, 10 tas d’igname, 3 paniers de piments et tomates.
texts.en: She is 42 years old and mother of 2 children.  She contributes to the household by selling cereals and condiments. She stocks up in Lomé and has 22 years of experience in this activity.  She then resells in Attiégou.  She is requesting a loan to buy 20 bowls of corn, 10 piles of yams, 3 baskets of chili peppers and tomatoes.

loans.use: Purchase of cereals and condiments

loans.name: Atipiri Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “ATIPIRI” (que en lengua aymara quiere decir "Ganador") es un grupo que inicia su primer ciclo en el Centro focal de Cascada, cuenta con once integrantes, diez mujeres y un varón.  La mesa directiva para este ciclo tiene como presidenta a la señora María Elena,  como tesorera la señora Valeria y como secretaria de actas a la señora Verónica. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: artesanía en mantas, venta de aguayos y tienda, venta de hilado de lana de vicuña, criadero de chanchos y taller de cerrajería, venta de cosméticos, tienda de barrio.

La señora Maria Elena, presidenta de la banca comunal “ATIPIRI” recibe los mejores deseos de su grupo, para realizar un buen papel como presidenta durante este ciclo.  A los treinta y nueve años, ya tiene un hogar consolidado con su pareja y sus cuatro hijos. Con respecto a su negocio  ella  lleva 2 años en los negocios de artesanía en mantas.   Aprendió hace dos años de una amiga, actualmente solicita Bs.2000. para la compra de mercadería.
Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer ella dice “el crédito”.
texts.en:
The “ATIPIRI” (which in Aymara means “Winner”) communal bank is a group that is starting its first cycle in the Cascada Focal Center.  It has 11 members, 10 women and one man.

The governing board for this cycle has María Elena as President, Valeria as Treasurer and Verónica as Recording Secretary.  The women have different businesses.  Among them are: blanket weaving, aguayo (multicolored woolen cloth) sales, store, vicuña woolens weaving, pig raising, metal shop, cosmetics sales and neighborhood grocery store.

María Elena, President of the “ATIPIRI” communal bank receives her group’s best wishes to carry out the role of President during this cycle.  At the age of 39 she already has a well established home with her partner and four children.  With respect to her business, she has been weaving blankets for two years.  A girl friend trained her two years ago.  She is asking for Bs.2000 to buy merchandise.

When we asked her what she likes best about Pro Mujer she answered “the credit.”

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy two PCs and parts to fix computers

loans.name: Italo Gabriel

texts.es:
Italo de 42 años, tiene una pequeña papelería en su casa y vende morocho (postre). Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Guasmo caracterizada porque la mayoria de las personas son comerciantes informales. 

Con unos ahorros él comenzó a comprar papelería para tener su propio negocio. Readecuo su casa en la parte delantera y ubico su papelería. Poco a poco durante estos años la ha surtido. También vende morochos ya que su papa vendía y le enseño para que no se pierda esta actividad en la familia. Con el préstamo quiere comprar juguetes, cuadernos, plumas para su papelería. 

En el futuro quiere que su papelería se a una de las más grandes y continuar con las ventas de morocho.
texts.en:
Italo is 42 years old and has a small school/office supplies store based from his home and sells morocho dessert.  He lives in an urban area called Guasmo characterized by the fact that most people are traders.

With some savings he started to buy office supplies for his business.  He adjusted his house at the front and set up his product.  Slowly through the years he has stocked it.  He sells morochos dessert because his dad used to sell them and showed him how to make them so that this activity stays alive in the family.  With the loan he wants to buy toys, notebooks, pens for his supplies store.

In the future he wants his store to be one of the biggest ones and to continue with the morocho dessert sales.

loans.use: Toys, notebooks and pens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy clothing merchandise to meet the demand of her clients

loans.name: Omega Group

texts.fr: Ntabalikirwa A. est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Omega,  âgée de 45 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants, tous étudient confortablement. Son mari est vendeur  des sacs et sachets emballages. Elle fait le petit commerce de vente habits usagés. Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Il ya 4 ans, qu’elle est en activité. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima. Elle installe ses produits  au marché central. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir renforcer son chiffre d’affaire. En plus, elle ambitionne devenir grossiste des habits usagés.  La cliente Ntabalikirwa A. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe Omega est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: Ntabalikirwa A. is a businesswoman and president of the Omega group. She is 45 years old, married, and mother of 8 children who are all studying. Her husband sells bags and packaging. She operates a small business of selling used clothing. She started her business thanks to funds given to her by her husband, and she has now been in business for 4 years. Later on, she received a loan from the Microfinance Insitution Hekima. She sets her products up at the central market. This new loan should help her increase her turnover. Moreover, her ambition is to become a wholesaler of used clothing. The client Ntabalikirwa A. would like to thank Hekima for its support to poor people excluded from conventional banking system. It should be noted that the Omega group members are mainly women.

loans.use: 1 Bundle of Used Clothing

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 77 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposa Yolanda de 64 años; y juntos buscan para salir adelante. Desde hace 15 años, este emprendedor hombre se dedica a la atención en su puesto  de comestibles, que tiene en el  mercado de su zona. Esta muy satisfecho pues el negocio es tranquilo y lo desempeña con la ayuda de su esposa; quien atiende cuando él debe salir; además las ganancias son regulares. Manifiesta que esta labor le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos; y ahora que ellos tienen sus propias familias; su esposa y él pasan sus días trabajando y entreteniéndose en el negocio de venta de comestibles. Esta muy contento pues el tiempo que tiene en el mercado le ha permitido ganar buenos clientes que lo prefieren por la frescura y buenos precios de sus productos. Como es muy trabajador para el futuro tiene planeado aumentar la cantidad de mercadería que ofrece y de esta manera continuar adelante. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. José tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de mercadería que necesita para surtir mejor su negocio y de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en: Jose, 77, lives in a home he owns with his wife Yolanda who is 64, together they hope to get ahead. 15 years ago this entrepreneur started working in his grocery store, located in the market of the area.  He is happy because it's a steady business and his wife helps him with it when he has to be out, the income is steady.  This business has allowed him to get his children ahead, and now they have their own families, he and his wife spend the day working at the business of grocery sales.  He is very happy because the time he has been at the market has allowed him to make good clients that prefer his products for their freshness and good prices.  He is very hardworking and plans to increase the amount of merchandise offered to continue ahead.  This is the third loan with MFP and he promises to make his payments punctually because he doesn't want to disappoint the people that made possible this loan that will allow him to continue working in search of progress.  Jose plans to invest the loan in buying M. merchandise to stock the business.

loans.use: Buy several products to stock his store.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr: H. Charlotte est née en 1974 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à HODEOU Dénis, un transitaire, Charlotte est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Charlotte se joint à son mari pour supporter les charges familiales. Pour venir en aide à son mari, Charlotte exerce comme activité la vente de divers condiments (oignons, piments rouge, conserves de tomates, épices etc .) et des légumes à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Charlotte se réapprovisionne. Charlotte n’a jamais fréquenté l’école et mène cette activité depuis douze ans. Charlotte est une cliente fidèle de ALIDé ayant déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits tous bien remboursés. C’est dans le souci de diversifier son activité et de renouveler son stock que Charlotte sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Charlotte ambitionne renforcer son activité.
texts.en: Charlotte H. was born in 1974 in Cotonou, the business capital of Benin. Married to Dénis Hodeou, a forwarder, Charlotte is the mother of three schooled children. The couple lives in the commune of Sèmè-Podji in Benin. Charlotte works with her husband to support the family. To help her husband, Charlotte sells certain condiment (onions, red peppers, tomato preserves, spices, etc.) and vegetables from her home. She buys her merchandise in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Charlotte has never been to school; she has been in business for twelve years. Charlotte is a loyal client of ALIDé and has already paid back in full four loans. Charlotte is asking for this fifth loan from ALIDé to diversify her business and renew her stock. Charlotte intends to strengthen her business.

loans.use: Buy condiment, fruit and tubers

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Anastasia; ella tiene 47 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. fabrica D. tejas y ladrillos y también se dedica a la crianza D. pollos, la socia se dedica a la venta D. menestras que venD. en el mercado D. Ttio,ella venD. desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m,ella es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a diferentes negocios y trabaja mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar los negocios. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer las tejas y ladrillos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank " Ricchary Cusco", the bank is located in the district, province and area of Cusco.

Anastasia is 47 years old, married and has five children, she alternates her daily activities with the business of making and selling bricks and tiles, she also raises chickens and sells dry seeds and beans at the market of Ttio, she sells from 8am to 1 pm, she is an entrepreneurial woman that works on different businesses and she works a lot to get her children ahead and wants to improve her businesses. She requests a loan to buy materials to make bricks and tiles.

The member is thankful to who is part of her dream through this website and she commits to make her payments according to schedule.

loans.use: Buy materials to make brick and tile

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Desarrollo”  ubicado en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años, está casada y tiene 04 hijos (2 independientes), realizó estudios de educación superior (Instituto Sencico y Cetpro).

Hace 08 años que trabaja  con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su   primer préstamo  fue de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio , ella se dedica a la confección y venta de estuches.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  invertirá para comprar estuches de lentes y bayetas para sus bordados.

Su visión en el negocio es tener el taller bien equipado.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres al Desarrollo," located in the province and department of Puno.  She is 38 years old, married, and has 4 children, 2 of whom are independent.  She has a degree from the Instituto Sencico y Cetpro.

She started working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization 8 years ago; her first loan was for 200 Peruvian soles, which she used for working capital in her business.  She has a business making and selling embroidered cases.  

She requests a new loan in the amount of 1,000 Peruvian soles that she will use to purchase cases for glasses and cloth for her embroidery.

Her vision for her business is to have a well-equipped workshop.

What she likes about her communal bank is that she can access loans with reasonable payment terms.

loans.use: to buy cases for glasses and fabric to embroider

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 44 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Hugo de 42 años, que es chofer, y de sus cuatro  hijos, que estudian  y trabajan ; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 4  años, esta dedicada mujer se dedica a la venta de materiales necesarios para elaborar cuadros. Se despierta muy temprano para atender el  negocio que tiene en su casa, en sociedad con  su hermano, y esta muy satisfecha pues las ganancias son regulares. Dice que su familia se dedicaba a la fabricación de cuadros, entonces cuando tuvo sus hijos vio una buena oportunidad de  continuar con el negocio que tantos logros le habían dado a los suyos. En la actualidad le va bien, pues además recibe rentas del alquiler de un motocarro que tiene. Tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de ampliar el negocio e instalar otro en la ciudad, pues sabe que la fabricación de cuadros es un negocio bastante rentable. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Victoria tiene planeado invertir el crédito en la compra de mayor cantidad de materiales al por mayor pues no logra abastecer a sus clientes que le piden mayor variedad.
texts.en: Victoria is 44, lives in a house she owns with her husband Hugo who is a 42 year old driver and her four children that study and work; together they make efforts each day to get ahead. Four years ago, this persevering woman started selling materials needed to make frames.  She wakes up early to start working at her home-based business, in partnership with her brother, she is content because the income is steady.  She says that her family used to make frames, then when she had children she saw a good opportunity to continue with the business that with so many efforts her family had passed on to her.  Currently she is doing well because she is also receiving rental income from a motorized-cart that she owns.  She has many plans for the future such as expand the business and open a new one in the city, because she knows that making frames is a very profitable business.  This is the first loan she gets with MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually, because she doesn't want to disappoint the people that made this possible for her to continue working in search of progress.  Victoria has plans to invest the loan in the purchase of a large amount of materials in a wholesale approach because she can't fulfill the needs of her clients who request more variety.

loans.use: Buy materials to make frames

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jose Antonio; el tiene 75 años de edad y es casado y tiene 5 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesanías, el vende tejidos y también es cesante D. poder judicial, el tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende la artesanía como mantas, chompas y chalinas, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía como tejidos.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Ricchary Cusco"; the bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and area of Cusco.
