Angela is a member of the communal bank "Las Almendras" in the Ucayali department.  She is 65 years old, married and has 5 grown children.

She has been taking loans from the Manuela Ramos organization for 9 years.  She has a business selling food (breakfasts and lunches) from her house.

With this loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles, she will buy 4 tables and 16 chairs, 4 tablecloths and some other items, because the furniture she has is worn out and needs to be replaced.

Angela thanks God for her health and Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to continue working.  She is happy, because she does not depend on anyone, and because she earns enough so that she can live in peace with her husband and their children.

loans.use: she will buy 4 tables and 16 chairs, 4 tablecloths and some other equipment for her business

loans.name: Mayra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mayra de 29 años, tiene un taller de cerrajería. Vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra.  

Empezó hace 2 años cuando se separo de su esposo y él le dejo el taller en su casa. Por la falta de oportunidades ella comenzó a trabajar en el taller de cerrajería para poder mantener a sus tres hijos haciendo lo que aprendió de su ex esposo. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 17h00pm haciendo reparaciones de puertas, chapas, etc.      

Con el préstamo quiere comprar maquinas para su taller de cerrajería. En el futuro quiere tener un minimarket y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Mayra, 29, has a metal shop.  She lives in a periurban area in El Fortín de Guayaquil which is notable for its unpaved streets.

She started two years ago when she separated from her husband and he left the shop in their house.  Because of the lack of employment opportunities she started to work in the shop in order to support her three children doing what she had learned from her ex-husband.  She currently works from 7am until 5pm repairing doors, latches, etc.

She wants to use the loan to buy machinery for her shop.  In the future she’d like to have a minimarket and that her children successfully finish their schooling.

loans.use: For machinery.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Mountaka Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SERIGNE MOUNTAKA est crée le 12 mai 2010. Il est composé de 10 femmes habitant la même concession. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame FATOU L. à droite de la photo, de blanc vêtue, est la présidente du groupe SOP SERIGNE MOUNTAKA. Elle est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants.  

Elle vend des tissus dans son quartier et au marché central. Elle est expérimentée dans ce domaine. 

Elle a comme objectif d'augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises. Elle aide son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOP SERIGNE MOUNTAKA was created on May 12, 2010. It is composed of ten women living in the same concession.  Their main work is in small-scale commerce.

Ms. FATOU L. is the president of the SOP SERIGNE MOUNTAKA group.  (She appears at the right in the photo and is dressed in white).  She is 37 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She sells cloth in her district and at the central market.  She is experience in this domain.  Her goal is to increase her supply of merchandise.  She helps her husband to cover family expenses.

loans.use: acheter des tissus à revendre

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 19-year-old single and ambitious man, having specialized in Arabic desserts and sweets for 5 years. He started his own business 3 years ago and is very thankful with the level he’s achieved untill now. Hussein is requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary machines, such as an oven, a blender and a pastry mixer, to improve his business. Hussein’s clients are from all over and they are assured of his best tasting items. Hussein insists on expanding his business by opening other branches soon.

loans.use: to buy necessary machines to improve his business

loans.name: Milena Johana

texts.es: Hace ya un año Milena de 27 años, buscando alternativas de ingresos adicionales cré su negocio de comecializar artesanias provenientes de San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolivar donde hacen manualidades como hamacas, bolsos y tejidos con tecnicas especiales de pintura que solo en este municipio hacen con tanta dedicación y buen gusto. Ella inició con poco capital y unas cantidades muy pequeñas de artesanias pero encontró un gran mercado de consumo en Soledad, lugar donde vive con sus dos hijos en las edades de 7 y 4 años,  y donde su negocio  creció en número de clientes y en infraestructura porque ahora exhibe las artesanias en sus vitrinas en la sala de sus casa. Su principal meta es tener un local independiente a su vivienda donde exhibir y vender sus productos como punto de venta especializado en arte de los Montes de Maria. Milena está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y es justamente un credikiva con el cual comprará hermosos colgantes de sonidos adornados con flores, hamacas, sandalias tipicas y mesas de centro. Sus ventas promedio son $ $2.742.857 COP su endeudamiento con el credito sería de 35,4% y mantiene una rentabilidad del 31%, mientras sus cuentas por cobrar rotan cada 18 dias y su inventario cada 23. Con su credito augura el aumento de sus capital de trabajo y por consiguiente de utilidades porque se acercan las temporadas de ventas de estos productos muy apetecidos por las familias soledeñas.
texts.en:
One year ago, 27 year-old Milena was looking for ways of making additional income. She established her business selling handicrafts from San Jacinto, in Bolivar department.  Here they make handicrafts such as hammocks, bags and knitted items with special painting techniques which are only made with such commitment and good taste in this particular town.

Milena started out with only a little bit of capital and a very small quantity of handicrafts but she found a big consumer market in Soledad which is where she lives with her two children aged 7 and 4 and where her business grew both in terms of number of customers and in infrastructure because she now displays the handicrafts in display cases in the living room of her home.  Her main goal is to have independent premises where she can display and sell her products.  She would like to have a specialized retail outlet for arts from Los Montes de Maria.

Milena is applying for her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and it is a Kiva loan which she will use to buy beautiful musical mobiles adorned with flowers, hammocks, traditional sandals and coffee tables.  Her average sales are 2,743,857 Colombian pesos.  Her debt (with the loan) would be 35.4% and she maintains a profitability of 31%.  Her accounts receivable turnover is every 18 days and her inventory turnover is every 23 days.  She will use her loan to increase her working capital and, consequently, her profits because the sales seasons for these products which are very much in demand with families in Soledad are approaching.

loans.use: To buy beautiful musical mobiles adorned with flowers, hammocks, traditional sandals and coffee tables

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es: Rosa Domínguez D. A. es una confeccionista conciente D. la oportunidad, que maneja todas las líneas, así como fabrica ropa para damas, así mismo lo hace para caballeros y para niños, igualmente formal o informal, deportiva , es decir ella los complace  a sus clientes con todo lo que a ellos le guste. Ahora mismo está dedicada a fabricar uniformes para oficinas porque empresas financieras, colegios y vendedoras,  la han contratado para que fabrique los uniformes, y vestidos elegantes para la época D. fin D. año y esto es muy bueno para ella, por eso se siente muy satisfecha porque sus clientes cada día se cualifican un poco más y ella logra mejorar sus técnicas D. calidad, en la medida en que confecciona. En la actualidad está solicitando su credikiva que es el décimo (10) financiamiento que hace a través D. la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y comprará materias primas e insumos  como telas, hilos pellones , para fabricar la ropa que le están solicitando y también para hacer una pequeña adecuación locativa a su negocio  para trabajar mejor y mas confortable.  Con los financiamientos con esta organización ha logrado mejorar sus condiciones D. vivienda, ampliar la base D. sus clientes y su capital D. trabajo se ha visto muy incrementado, lo cual le ha permitido responder cada día a más y mejores clientes como los ya mencionados. Su gran desafío y meta es lograr con su esposo apoyar el mejoramiento D. las condiciones D. sus tres hijos a nivel educativo, habitacional, para que ellos en el futuro  avancen y tenga una vida llena D. muchos éxitos .
texts.en:
Rosa Domínguez D. A. is a dressmaker who is aware of opportunity.  She makes all kinds of clothes, not only women's clothes but also men's and children's.  She makes formal and casual clothes and sports clothes.  That is to say, she provides her customers with everything they want.  Right now she is making office uniforms because financial companies, schools and stores have hired her to make their uniforms.  She is also making elegant dresses for the end-of-year season.  This is very good for her and she feels very satisfied because every day her customers rate her more highly and she manages to improve her dressmaking techniques.

Rosa is currently requesting this Kiva loan, which is the tenth loan she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will buy raw materials and supplies such as fabric, thread and fleece to make the clothes that her customers are requesting and also to adapt her business premises slightly so that she can work better and more comfortably.

Rosa has used her loans from our organization to improve her housing conditions, expand her customer base and increase her working capital which has allowed her to respond to more and better customers, such as those mentioned above, every day.  Her big challenge and goal is, together with her husband, to manage to improve the educational and living conditions of their three children so that, in the future, they are able to make progress and have a life full of success.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and supplies such as fabric, threads and fleece to make the clothes that her customers are requesting

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Angelica S. Q., con 3 hijos; es la presidenta del grupo: "Mujeres Emprendedoras" del distrito D. Chilca en Huancayo. (En la foto Angelica, es la persona que està sentada, viste D. jean azul y casaca color gris)
Angelica se separó D. su esposo cuando nació su última hija que ahora ya tiene 05 años, ella empezó a trabajar en tiendas como vendedora y su mamá la apoyaba cuidando a sus niñas, pero recientemente tuvo problemas familiares debido a que se ausentaba mucho tiempo D. casa; su niña mayor D. 13 años dejò influenciarse por las malas amistades y la niña se volvió rebelD. al extremo D. que ya no obedecìa a nadie, y empezó a saliir por las noches a discotecas y no llegaba a dormir a casa; la desesperaciòn D. esta pobre madre la llevo a dejar el trabajo y dedicarse D. lleno a sus hijas. Pero lamentablemente la realidad D. su situaciòn economica era complicada sin la ayuda del padre; Angelica tenìa que ver por sus 03 niñas, por sacar adelante su familia ella sola; asì optó por iniciarse en el negocio D. vender papas peladas y picadas para freir a las pollerias. Ahora Angelica està màs tiempo en casa,  dedicando y brindando calidad D. tiempo a sus hijas, como tambièn a su negocio, ademàs cuenta con el apoyo D. sus niñas en esta actividad. 
Uso del crédito:Incremento D. capital D. trabajo por fiestas naviD.ñas.
texts.en:
Angelica S. Q. has 3 children.  She is the president of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) group from Childa district in Huancayo (in the photo, Angelica is the person who is sitting down, wearing blue jeans and a gray jacket).

Angelica separated from her husband when her youngest daughter was born 5 years ago.  She started to work in stores as a saleswoman and her mother supported her by looking after her daughters.  However, recently she had family problems because she was away from her home for a lot of time

Angelica's eldest daughter, who is 13, was influenced by some bad friendships and became a real rebel who no longer obeyed anybody.  She began to go out to discos at night and didn't come home to sleep.  This poor mother's desperation led to her leave her job and devote herself full time to looking after her daughters.  However, unfortunately, the reality of her financial situation was complicated as she had no help from the girls' father.  Angelica had to get her family ahead in life on her own.  For this reason, she decided to set herself up in business selling peeled and chipped potatoes to fried chicken joints.  Now Angelica spends more time at home devoting herself to her daughters and spending quality time with them.  She also spends time in her business.  What is more, her daughters support her in her business activity.

Angelica will use her loan to increase her working capital for the Christmas period.

loans.use: To increase her working capital for the Christmas season

loans.name: Manzanitas Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “MANZANITAS” es uno grupo que inicia su primer ciclo en el Centro focal de Cascada, cuenta con ocho integrantes.  La mesa directiva para este ciclo tiene como presidenta a la señora Celsa,  como tesorera la señora Justina y como secretaria de actas a la señora Eustaquia. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: venta de focos (cinco socias), artesanía elaboración de mantas, venta de comida

La señora Celsa, presidenta de la banca comunal “Manzanitas” tiene un hogar conformado por su pareja y siete hijos.  Es parte de la banca comunal debido a que una amiga le invitó a participar de la misma. Con respecto a su negocio  ella  lleva  10 años en el negocio de venta de comida, inició este emprendimiento por motivación personal.   Actualmente solicita Bs.1500.- para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de la comida.
Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer ella dice “las reuniones”.
texts.en:
The “Manzanitas” community bank is a group which is beginning its first loan cycle with the Cascada regional office.  It has eight members.  The president of this cycle's executive committee is Celsa, the treasurer is Justina and the secretary is Eustaquia.  The ladies all have different businesses and these include: light bulb sales (five members), handicrafts, making blankets and food sales.

Celsa, the president of the “Manzanitas” community bank, lives with her partner and seven children.  She became a member of her community bank when her friend invited her to take part.  She has been selling food for 10 years.  She started in this business through her own initiative.  She is currently requesting 1,500 bolivianos to buy supplies for making food.

When we asked her what she most liked about Pro Mujer she said “the meetings”.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Nelsis Esther

texts.es: Nelsis R. V., es una mujer que vive en el municipio de Soledad donde vive con su esposos y sus dos hijos en las edades de 11 y 16 años, Ella tiene un negocio que diez años atrás comenzara su madre: alquiler de sillas playeras en el Rodadero, hermoso balneario en la ciudad de Santa Marta, a dos horas de Barranquilla.  Con el paso del tiempo su madre decidió   buscar el apoyo de sus hijos y asociarlos a él,  porque se amplió mucho. Ellos tienen 320 sillas y viajan a Santa Marta desde el viernes hasta el domingo y lunes si es festivo, de igual manera lo hacen todo el tiempo en temporada de mucho turismo como a finales y a mediados de año. Aprovechando la gran cantidad de turistas,  de toda Colombia y extranjeros, que disfrutan de sus descanso; ella también ofrece productos como refrescos pasteles, hayacas dulces y agua y con ello logra un ingreso adicional, especialmente  en la alta temporada  que se avecina en este sitio turístico.  Nelsis quiere comprar 40 sillas playeras y este es justamente el motivo por el cual está aplicando a su credikiva, su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  porque quiere aumentar sus ganancias con una oferta mayor de sillas de descanso en  playa y en buena época.  Su sueño es comprar un vehículo para su uso en el negocio pues le ayudaría  en su traslado y él mismo se pagaría, por eso trabaja persistentemente con mucha disciplina para a mediano plazo responder a este gran desafío.
texts.en:
Nelsis R. V. is a woman living in Soledad with her husband and two children who are 11 and 16 years of age.  She has a business that her mother started ten years ago:  she rents beach chairs at El Rodadero Beach, a beautiful sea resort in the city of Santa Marta, two hours from Barranquilla.

In time her mother sought help from her children to associate them with the business it because it grew much.  They have 320 chairs and they travel to Santa Marta every Friday through Sunday or Monday if it’s a holiday.  During high tourist seasons they go all the time as well as at the end of the year and at the middle of the year.

Taking advantage of the large number of tourists, both from all of Colombia and foreigners alike, that enjoy their rest, she also offers other products like delicious cakes, sweet hayacas (a type of tamale) and water thereby earning additional income, especially during the  high season that’s about to start in this tourist destination.

Nelsis wants to buy 40 beach chairs and this is precisely why she’s applying for a Kiva loan, her second loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, because she wants to increase profits with a larger number of beach chairs to relax in during this good season.

Her dream is to buy a vehicle to use in the business because that would help transport and would pay for itself.  This is why she works so hard so that in the not too distant future she will meet this great challenge.

loans.use: To buy 40 beach chairs.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María de 55 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra.  

Ella vivía en Manabí pero para tener mejores ingresos se mudo a Guayaquil ya que es una de las ciudades del ecuador más comerciales del Ecuador. Con esfuerzo se mudo y ubico la su tienda en la parte delantera de su actual casa. Trabaja desde las 07h00am vendiendo arroz, azúcar, aceites a un bajo costo ya que compra al por mayor los productos. 

Para seguir con la tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, azúcar, aceite para su préstamo. Una de sus metas para cumplir es construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
María, 55, has a grocery store in the front part of her house.  She lives in a periurban area in El Fortín de Guayaquil, notable because of its unpaved streets.

She used to live in Manabí but in order to have better income she moved to Guayaquil because it’s one of Ecuador’s most commercial cities.  With effort she moved and set up her store in the front part of her current house.  She works from 7am selling rice, sugar, oils at low cost because she buys the products at wholesale.

To continue in business she needs a loan to buy rice, sugar and oil.  One of her pending goals is to build her house better.

loans.use: For rice, sugar, oil.

loans.name: Liz Ivonne

texts.es:
La señora Liz es socia del banco comunal Las perlas de Manantay, del Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 33 años y su esposo se desempeña como chofer (transportista) y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad.
Tiene su negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas y cervezas,  esta actividad la realiza en su casa donde también puede estar pendiente de sus niños.  lleva trabajando con Manuela Ramos 2 años.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,300.00 soles comprará 20 cajas de gaseosas y 30 cajas de cerveza, porque ahora quiere empezar como una pequeña distribuidora.
La señora Liz se propuso una meta, tener con el tiempo una distribuidora de bebidas gaseosas y cervezas, porque ha visto que es un buen negocio.
Liz dice que gracias a Manuela Ramos está haciendo realidad su sueño, que hace un tiempo atrás lo veía muy lejano.
texts.en:
Liz is a member of the Las Perlas de Manantay communal bank in the Ucayali Department.  She is 33 years old and her husband works as a driver.  She has two children, both minors.

She has a business selling soft drinks and beer.  She operates this business in her home, where she can also watch her children.  She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years.

With this loan of 2,300 nuevos soles, she will buy 20 cases of soft drinks and 30 cases of beer, because now she wants to start a small distribution company.

Liz has set a goal for herself of eventually having a soft drink and beer distribution company because she has seen that this is a good business.  

Liz says that thanks to Manuela Ramos, she is making her dream a reality, when it used to seem so distant.

loans.use: To buy 20 cases of soft drinks and 30 cases of beer

loans.name: Isolina Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PROSPERIDAD”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Isolina; La socia tiene 33 años de edad, La socia es conviviente; la socia se dedica a administrar una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, la socia desea implementar su tienda de abarrotes para este mes de diciembre y poder así llenar con champan, vinos, panetones, chocolates y mucho más. La socia está muy emocionada de poder recibir apoyo y hacer de este un capital de trabajo en estas fiestas navideñas y de este modo tener su tienda llena. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio de abarrotes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Isolina, 33, is a member of “PROSPERIDAD” (Prosperity) communal bank located in Huanchac which is in Cusco province, Cusco department.

She lives with her life partner and runs a small grocery store.  She wants to stock the store with groceries for the month of December to be full of champagne, wines, panettones, chocolates and much more.  

She is excited about getting this support and to use the funds as working capital during the Christmas festivities so that she can have her store full. She is asking for the loan to invest in her grocery business.

She appreciates and values the loan granted and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Tres Esquinas - El Tambo Group

texts.es:
Luis Alberto M. C., tiene 33 años D. edad, conviviente, 2 hijosy miembro activo D. la Alcancia Comunal: " Las Tres Esquinas - El Tambo" D. la cuidad incontrastable D. Huancayo. 
(En la foto esta D. pie y viste un guardapolvo color gris y tiene puesto unas gafas).

Luis Alberto anteriormente trabajaba como maestro panadero en una empresa D. la ciudad D. Huancayo. 

Cuando empezò a convivir con su esposa no era muy aceptado por la familia D. ella, por que ellos vivian en un cuarto en la casa D. su suegra; al sentir que necesitaba sugir para poder darles una mejor calidad D. vida para sus hijos D. 06 y 02 años respectivamente. él decidió salir D. la casa D. su suegra e independizarse y tambièn iniciar el negocio D. la panaderìa; pero el dinero no alcanzaba. 

El inicio no fue fàcil, ya que con poco capital que tenìan, que era el ahorro D. sus sueldos no cubria los gastos iniciales D. este negocio. 

Posteriormente se decidieron empezar con la ayuda D. su esposa y salieron D. la casa D. su suegra y alquilaron una casa en la cual ahora funciona su propia panaderia y bodega. Luis Alberto siente el apoyo D. su esposa ya que èl prepara los panes, y ella sale a vender por las tardes; es así que actualmente cuenta con una pequeña bodeguita en su panaderia; por ello necesitan màs capital D. trabajo para poder abastecer su bodeguita.

Uso del crédito: Comprar mercaderìa para la bodega que funciona en la panaderia. 

** la foto pequeña corresponD. al Sr. Jose Antonio S. R., quien no esta en la foto principal **
texts.en:
Luis Alberto M. C., 33, has a life partner and two children.  (In the photo he is standing and is wearing a gray windbreaker and is wearing glasses).

He used to work as a master baker in a firm in the city of Huancayo.

When he started living with his wife he wasn’t very well accepted by her family because they lived in a room in his mother-in-law’s house.  As he felt the need to leap forward in order to proviD. a better quality of life for his two children, who are 6 and 2 years of age respectively, he decided to leave his mother-in-law’s house and start a bakery.  However, money was insufficient.

The start wasn’t easy because he had very little capital, which was savings from his salary.  It wasn’t enough to cover the start up costs of the business.

Later they decided to start with help from his wife.  They left his mother-in-law’s house and rented a house in which his bakery and a grocery store nor operate.  Luis Alberto is mindful of his wife’s support because he prepares the bread and she goes out in the afternoon to sell it.  He has a small grocery store in the bakery and they need more working capital to stock the little store.

Loan’s Purpose: To buy merchandise for the grocery store that operates in the bakery.

**The small photo is Mr. José Antonio S. R., who does not appear in the main group photo**

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the store that operates in the bakery.

loans.name: Alexanders Jose

texts.es: El Señor Alexander Jose H. L., es un joven de 22 años casado que habita en el barrio de San Caralampio, su esposa se dedica al comercio, y tienen 1 hijo menor de edad que aun no ingresa al preescolar, el señor H. es agricultor y desde muy niño su padre le enseño los trabajos de la siembra. Dentro de los principales problemas a los que se ha enfrentado a lo largo de los años ha sido el robo de las cosechas que afecta de sobremanera su economía, fue gracias al apoyo de sus papas y sus abuelos que lograron iniciar las actividades de la siembra hace años atrás, es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas que le permitan un mantenimiento fitosanitario optimo que favorezca a las siembras y las ventas de la producción, mejorando día a día su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Alexander José H. López, 22, is a married young man living in the San Caralampio neighborhood.  His wife is a merchant.  They have a one year old son who doesn’t go to preschool yet.

Mr. H. is a farmer that learned to farm with his father from a very young age.  One of the main problems he’s faced over the years is the theft of his crops which affects his economy greatly.  

It was thanks to support from his parents and grandparents that planting activities started years ago.

He is asking for funds for his business in order to buy farming supplies that will allow him to provide good health maintenance for his crops that will favor his plants and sale of the harvest thereby improving his quality of life daily.

loans.use: For farming supplies.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “PROSPERIDAD”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Hugo; El socio tiene 35 años de edad, El socio  es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, el socio es taxista y trabaja diario con su propia unidad vehicular, el socio nos indica que el está planeando comprar un nuevo carro más grande del que tiene y para lo cual el socio venderá su auto, para reunir el dinero él estuvo ahorrando los ingresos que le generaba su auto cuando estaba préstamo en servicio de taxi y aún así le falta un restante de dinero que pretende adquirir con el préstamo por este medio, el socio desea comprarse otro auto el cual le generará mayor rentabilidad. El socio solicita le préstamo para invertir en la compra de un nuevo auto y aumentará a un ahorro que ya tiene.  

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hugo, 35, is a member of the “PROSPERIDAD” (Prosperity) communal bank which is located in Huanchac district that’s part of Cusco province, Cusco department.

He has a life partner and two children.  He is a taxi driver and works with his own vehicle.  He tells us that he’s planning to buy a new, larger car than the one he has.  To do so he will sell the car he has currently.  He has been saving up from the income earned as a taxi driver but even so still falls short and he intends to get this remaining amount from the present loan.  He wants to buy another car that will generate higher profits.  He is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of a new car and to add to the savings he already has.

He values and is grateful for the loan granted and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy a new car and add to savings he already has.

loans.name: Minerva Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Minerva es socia del banco comunal Las Almendras, del Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo menor, su  esposo se desempeña como comerciante, lleva como socia de Manuela Ramos solo 1 año.
Minerva ayuda a su esposo con la bodega que tiene instalada en su casa, gracias a ello no descuida a su niño que todavía necesita de sus cuidados.
Con el poco tiempo que tiene en Manuela Ramos ha podido invetir todo su dinero en su bodega.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200.00 soles comprará 2 sacos de azúcar, una bolsa de harina, una caja de leche, 1 caja de aceite, una bolsa de caramelos, 2 paquetes de papel higiénico, 15 kilos de frejol, 10 kilos de fariña, 5 kilos de pescado seco, verduras y condimentos.
La señora Minerva quiere tener un negocio más grande y espera seguir contando con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Minerva is a member of the communal bank "Las Almendras" in the Ucayali department.  She is 22 years old, married, and has a young child.  Her husband works as a merchant.  She has been a member of this group for only 1 year.

Minerva helps her husband with a store that is set up in their home.  Thanks to this business she is able to care for her child, who still needs close attention.  Over the short time she has been with the Manuela Ramos organization she has invested her loans in her store.

With this loan of 1,200 Peruvian soles she will buy: 2 sacks of sugar, a bag of flour, a crate of milk, a crate of cooking oil, a bag of caramels, 2 packages of toilet paper, 15 kilos of beans, 10 kilos of potato flour, 5 kilos of dried fish, vegetables and seasonings.  

Minerva wants to have a bigger business, and she hopes to continue to have the support of the Manuela Ramos organization.

loans.use: she will buy 2 sacks of sugar, a bag of flour, a crate of milk, a crate of cooking oil, a bag of caramels, 2 packages of toilet paper, 15 kilos of beans, 10 kilos of potato flour, 5 kilos of dried fish, vegetables and seasonings

loans.name: Isabel Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Isabel del Carmen P. R., tiene la edad de 42 años, habita en el Barrio Buenos Aires un  lugar donde sus habitantes son personas de limitados recursos que luchan por el sustento económico diario, ella es una madre soltera de 3 hijos mayores  de edad que trabajan y sobreviven de manera independiente, la señora es agricultora y desde hace mas de 18 años que se dedica a este rubro, uno de los problemas que más afectan su producción son los gases que emite el volcán, que intoxican las cosechas es por esta razón que más adelante deseara realizar un estudio de suelos ara contrarrestar el problema, fue gracias al apoyo de su ex suegro que le enseño las actividades de la siembra, ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, e insumos vegetativos que permitan un mantenimiento Fito Sanitario optimo que ayude a sus terrenos y producción y mejore la calidad de vida que actualmente tiene, sobretodo que es una mujer sola que no tiene apoyo económico de ningún familiar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isabel del Carmen P. R., 42, lives in the Buenos Aires neighborhood whose residents are people of limited resources who fight for daily sustenance.  She is a single mother of three adult children who work and survive independently.

She has been a farmer for over 18 years and one of the major problems she faces is gases emanating from the volcano that are toxic for the crops.  She wants to conduct a soil study in the future to counteract the problem.

It was thanks to her father-in-law’s support who taught her farming skills.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, fungicides and farming supplies to provide proper care for her fields thus improving her present quality of life. Above all she is a woman alone who receives no economic support from any family member.

loans.use: For farming supplies.

loans.name: Salvador Antonio

texts.es: El señor Salvador Antonio B. L., es un hombre de 45 años, casado habitante del Valle de la Laguna un lugar bastante rural, su esposa es comerciante, y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, de los cuales solo el mayor estudia la primaria, el señor Salvador labora como Conductor desde hace mas de 15 años, ganándose de esta manera el sustento económico diario, ellos habitan en una humilde casa la cual con el paso del invierno se deterioro mucho causándoles un sin número de  incomodidades y es la razón por la que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de matariles de construcción que le permitan llevar a cabo unas remodelaciones en el porche de su hogar, para el beneficio al esparcimiento de sus dos hijos pequeños y su mejor desarrollo social a sus vidas.
texts.en:
Mr. Salvador Antonio B. López, 45, is married and lives in Valle de la Laguna, quite a rural area.  His wife is a merchant and they have two small children of whom only the oldest goes to elementary school.

Salvador works has worked as a Driver for over 15 years earning his daily support this way.   They live in a humble abode which during the winter was much deteriorated causing countless inconveniences.  This is the reason behind the loan request: to buy building materials and supplies to carry out some improvements to the porch so that his two small children can have a better place to play and better social development in their lives.

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Santa Cruz - Concepcion Group

texts.es:
Elizabeth E. C., casada, 5 hijos (En la fotografìa, la Sra. Elizabeth viste chompa rosa y chaleco azul)
La Sra. Elizabeth actualmente vive con sus 05 hijos que se encuentran en diversos grados D. estudios, su esposo radica en el extranjero debido a que se le presentó la oportunidad D. trabajo como obrero y optó por esa opción para obtener mejores ingresos para su familia. Elizabeth mensualmente recibìa el sueldo D. su esposo y con ello inició la construcciòn D. su casa, pero al estar ella sola en Concecpiòn con sus hijos, sus cuñadas le solicitaron prestado dinero ya que ellas sabìan que ella contaba con los ahorros D. sus esposo y le indicaron que no se lo contara a su hermano. Pasaron dos años y las hermanas D. su esposo no le devolvieron el dinero; cuando el esposo D. Elizabeth regresò a perú le pidiò los ahorros y ella le contó que lo prestó y aùn no le habìan devuelto; su esposo se enojó mucho ya que habia actuado sin su consentimiento y el problema D. falta D. confianza fue tan granD. que su esposo le pidió a Elizabeth la separación. Elizabeth en su desesperacion por devolverle a su esposo sus ahorros solicitó prèstamos a entidades financieras para poder devolverle sus ahorros a su esposo, y para poder pagar estos prèstamos tuvo que iniciar el negocio D. cafetin en un colegio en el cual una amiga era la directora. Actualmente ella cuenta con el apoyo D. sus hijos en este negocio, y ademàs ya se encuentra cancelando sus prestamos y trabaja tranquilamente vendiendo comida en el cafetin ; así mismo se animò a alquilar habitaciones que tenia desocupados en su casa.
Este prèstamo lo usarà para comprar un carrito sanguchero para la venta D. salchipapas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth E. C., married with five children.  (In the photo, Elizabeth is wearing a pink sweater and blue vest)

Elizabeth lives with her five children who are in various stages grades in school.  Her husband lives abroad because he had the opportunity to work as a laborer and he took that option in order to earn better income for his family.

Elizabeth would get a monthly stipend from her husband’s salary and she used it to start building her house.  However, being that she was alone in Concepción with her children, her sisters-in-law borrowed money from her because they knew she got savings from her husband and they told her not to tell their brother.  Two years went by and her husband’s sisters did not repay the money.  When Elizabeth’s husband returned to Perú he asked her for his savings and she answered that she had lent it and still hadn’t been repaid.  Her husband became very angry because she had acted without his consent and the lack of trust was so enormous that Elizabeth’s husband asked her for a separation.

Elizabeth, in her despair to return her husband’s savings, took loans out from financial institutions in order to return his savings to her husband and to repay these loans she had to start a small snack bar in a local school where a friend of hers was the Principal.  Her children help her with the business and she works peacefully selling food in the snack bar.  She also ventured to lease out unoccupied rooms she had available in her house.

She will use this loan to buy a food cart to use to sell salchipapas (fried potatoes with fried sausage or chicken).

loans.use: To buy a cart to use for salchipapas (fried potatoes with fried sausage or chicken) sales.

loans.name: Santos Alberto

texts.es: El señor Santos Alberto O. B., tiene la edad de 36 años habita en el barrio de los Ríos una comunidad Rural, ellos son agricultores desde hace mas de 16 años, su esposa se dedica al comercio de las cosechas que producen, ellos tienen 3 hijos menores de edad de los cuales estudian la escuela primaria, uno de los principales problemas han tenido ha sido la falta de financiación de los banco que no apoyan esta actividad, y que no le ha permitido una inyección significativa a su negocio, fue gracias a la reforma agraria que logro iniciarse en esta actividad, a futuro espera poder ingresar nuevos cultivos a sus siembras por unos que se consuman en masa para la mejoría a su economía, es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo para la compra fungicidas y fertilizantes que favorezcan con un Mantenimiento Fito sanitario optimo que beneficie sus cosechas y las condiciones de vida de sus hijos. Este no es el primer prestamo del Señor, nuestro equipo ha notado los cambios positivos que ha mostrado la familia, por esta razon siempre buscamos la manera de continuar apoyandoles.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Alberto O. B., 36, lives in the Los Ríos neighborhood, a rural community.  They have been farmers for over 16 years.  His wife sells the crops they produce.  They have three minor children who are in elementary school.

One of the main problems they have faced is the lack of financing from the banks that do not support this type of activity.  This has prevented them from being able to inject funds into the business.  They were able to get into this business thanks to the Agrarian Reform.  In the future he’d like to start planting new crops, especially those that are widely consumed, to improve his economy.

It is for his business that he’s requesting the loan; to buy fungicides and fertilizers that will favor optimum maintenance of his crops which will lead to good harvests thus improving his children’s quality of life.

This is not his first loan.  Our team has noted positive changed in the family so we are always looking for ways to continue supporting them.

loans.use: For crop maintenance.

loans.name: Karla  Patricia

texts.es: La señora Karla  Patricia S. L., es una joven casada de 30 años de edad que tiene 3 hijos son una familia muy humilde, su esposo es albañil, y ella labora como agricultora contando con una experiencia de más de 7 años, tiempo en que se enfrentado a problemas de plagas y enfermedades de los terrenos, fue gracias al apoyo de su padre que logro iniciarse en las actividades de la siembra, es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas e insumos vegetativos que permitan un mantenimiento fito sanitario a sus cultivos, esta inversión le permitirá a su familia mejores condiciones socio-económicas, sobretodo porque desean contar con los recursos monetarios para solventar el gasto de la universidad de su hijo mayor, razón suficiente para ellos para esforzarse por su primogenito.
texts.en: Karla Patricia S. L. is a young married woman.  She is 30 years old and has 3 children.  Theirs is a very humble family; her husband is a construction worker and she works as a farmer with more than 7 years' experience.  She has faced a number of problems over the years such as insect infestations and diseases on her land.  She managed to set herself up growing crops thanks to the support of her father.  She is requesting a loan for her business so that she can buy fertilizers, fungicides and farming supplies that will allow her to maintain the health of her crops.  This investment will allow her family to benefit from better socio-economic conditions.  Above all, they would like to have the economic means to pay for their eldest child's university expenses.  They will work hard to provide for their first born.

loans.use: To maintain the health of her crops

loans.name: Kantutas Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “KANTUTAS” es uno grupo que inicia su cuarto ciclo en el Centro focal de Panamericana, cuenta con diez integrantes.  La mesa directiva para este ciclo tiene como presidenta a la señora Adela,  como tesorera  a la señora Felisa y como secretaria de actas a la señora Virginia. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: comerciante, venta de tucumanas, venta de plásticos y ropa de bebé, tienda de consumo, sastrería,  venta de comida,  artesanía, venta de carteras.

La señora Adela, presidenta de la banca comunal “KANTUTAS” tiene un hogar conformado por su pareja y sus tres hijos.  Con respecto a su negocio  ella  lleva  4 años en el negocio de la venta de plásticos (colgadores, recogedores de basura), inició este emprendimiento siguiendo el ejemplo de su madre quién viaja a la ciudad de Sucre con mercadería, desde hace varios años.  Las compras son realizadas en La Paz y las ventas se realizan en el interior en las ciudades de Sucre y Potosí.   Actualmente solicitó Bs.3000.- para la compra de más mercadería.
Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer ella dice “las reuniones” pues despeja la mente.
texts.en:
The “KANTUTAS” (the national flower of Perú and one of two national flowers of Bolivia) communal bank is a group starting its fourth cycle in Panamericana Focal Center.  It has 10 members.  The governing board this cycle has Adela as President, Felisa as Treasurer and Virginia as Recording Secretary.  The women all have different businesses.  Among them are: merchant, tucumanas (fried cheese turnover) sales, plastics sales, sale of infant wear, grocery store, tailor shop, food sales, crafts, purse sales.

Adela, “KANTUTAS” communal bank President, has a home consisting of her partner and three children.  She has been in the business of selling plastics (hangers, dust bins) for four years.  She started this enterprise following her mother’s example who traversed the city of Sucre with merchandise many years ago.  She makes her purchases in La Paz and her sales are in the interior in the cities of Sucre and Potosí.  She asked for a Bs.3000 loan to buy more merchandise.

When we asked her what she liked best about Pro Mujer she answered: “the meetings” because they clear the mind.

loans.use: To buy hangers, dust pans, hygienics.

loans.name: Marlene De La Cruz

texts.es: La señora Marlene de la Cruz E., tiene la edad de 42 años, habita en la comunidad Rural de la Enramada, es casada, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad, ella y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura contando con una experiencia de más de 13 años, fue con el apoyo de su esposo que se inicio en estas actividades de la siembra, es para sus terrenos que solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos vegetativos, fertilizantes y fungicidas que le brinden un mantenimiento Fito Sanitario y mejoren día a día la producción y así mismo incrementen el nivel de ventas, para un mejor desarrollo socio económico en beneficio de toda su familia, y a futuro sin problema alguno puedan diversificar las siembras y remodelar su humilde vivienda con vision a su retiro en un lugar digno donde morar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marlene de la Cruz E., 42, lives in the rural community of Enramada.  She’s married and has three adult children.  She and her husband are farmers.  They have over 13 years experience.  She started out in farming with her husband’s support. 

She is asking for a loan for her fields.  She wants to buy farming supplies: fertilizers and fungicides that will provide good maintenance for her crops so that production will improve daily thus increasing sales so that she will have better economic development for the benefit of her entire family.  She hopes in the future to be able to diversify her crops problem free and to remodel their humble abode with the goal in mind to have a dignified place to retire to.

loans.use: For crop maintenance.

loans.name: Luz De Luna Group

texts.es: En esta foto mostR. al grupo llamado Luz de Luna, el cual está ubicado en el estado de Puebla, México. El grupo se conformó con 10 integrantes.En la fotografía se muestra la actividad comercial a la que se dedica la Sra. Juliana M. N. Quien cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes, también vende pan y repostería de la panaderia de un familiar, nuestra cliente tiene 4 años con ella pero con 8 años de experiencia, por lo que ya tiene bastante clientela y para  atraer a más, sus precios son bajos, eso opina la gente que va a comprar, dicen que da más barato y que siempre está bien surtida pues encuentran lo que desean y que las recibe siempre con un trato amable.  Este credito lo destinará a la compra de más mercancia y con las ganancias de un mes comprará un estante para ampliar su negocio. Ella tiene 27 años y estudio hasta concluir la secundaria, su esposo es panadero tiene 3 hijos: 1 hombre y 2 mujeres.
texts.en:
In this photo we show the group called Luz de Luna (Moonlight) which is in the state of Puebla, México.  The group has 10 members.  In the photo Mrs. Juliana M.N’s business is shown.

She has a grocery store and also sells bread and pastries from a relative’s bakery.  She has had the store for four years but she has 8 years experience.  She has quite a few customers and to attract still more her prices are low.  That’s the opinion of the people who buy from her.  They say that she sells more inexpensively and that she is always well stocked so they find everything they need and plus she receives them kindly.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise and with the profits from a month buy shelving to expand the store.

She is 27 years old, finished secondary school.  Her husband is a baker.  She has three children, one boy and two girls

loans.use: To buy more merchandise and with the profits buy shelving.

loans.name: Las Abejitas - Chupaca Group

texts.es:
Rosario Estela S. N., integrante del grupo: " Las Abejitas - Chupaca".
Rosario es conviviente, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 09 y 03 años de edad, ella quedó huerfana de padres a los 15 años, teniendo a cargo sus dos hermanos menores de 10 y 08 que actualmente ya son mayores de edad, para poder mantener a sus hermanos empezó a trabajar como cobradora de transporte pùblico; asì empezó a ahorrar y conoció a su esposo quièn también la apoyó ya que èl trabajaba como chofer de combi, los dos trabajaron hasta lograr comprar su propio carro, el cual ahora es su fuente principal de ingresos. 
Pero el apoyo que ella brindò a sus hermanos nunca quedó olvidado por ello también adicionalmente ayuda a sus hermanos en sus trabajos, y ahora sus dos hermanos menores tambièn cuentan con sus propios autos que los han puesto ha trabajar como taxis.
El sueño de Rosario es poder lograr comprarse una combi para obtener mayores ingresos y con ello poder seguir construyendo su casa.
El uso del crédito serà para el mantenimiento de su automovil, y la compra de llantas.
(en la foto Rosario es la primera de la derecha, viste jeans azul y chompa color beige)
texts.en:
Rosario Estela S. N., member of the “Las Abejitas-Chupaca” (The Little Bees-Chupaca) group.

Rosario lives with her husband (unmarried) and their two children who are 9 and 3 years of age.  She was orphaned at the age of 15 and had two younger brothers, 10 and 8, in her care.  They are now adults.  To support them she started working as a fare taker on public transportation.  She started to save up and also met her husband who also helped her since he worked as a minivan driver.  Both of them worked until they were able to buy their own car which is now their main source of income.

The help she gave her brothers was never forgotten, however, and she still helps them with their work.  Her two younger brothers also have their own cars that they have put into taxi service.

Rosario’s dream is to be able to buy herself a minivan to have more income and continue building her house.

She will use the loan to service her car and buy tires.

(In the photo Rosario is the first one on the right, wearing blue jeans and a beige sweater)

loans.use: To buy tires.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: El señor Oscar Antonio vive en el Barrio de Managua de San Caralampio, con su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos adolecentes que actualmente estudian, la escuela secundaria, ellos son agricultores desde hace mas de 20 años y fue con el apoyo de la Reforma Agraria de los 90s que lograron adquirir su terreno, y desde ese momento se a convertido en el sustento económico de la familia, es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos vegetativos, fertilizantes y fungicidas que realicen un mantenimiento fito Sanitario optimo para la mejora continua de su producción, el aumento en las ventas de las cosechas y por ende una mejor calidad de vida para todos los miembro de su familia, especialmente por su hijo mayor que pronto ingresara a la universidad y esperan contar con los recursos económicos para solventar su carrera profesional y ofrecerle un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar Antonio lives in Managua’s San Caralampio neighborhood with his life partner and three adolescent children who are in secondary school.  

They have been farmers for over 20 years thanks to help from the Agrarian Reform in the90s that made it possible for them to acquire land.  Since then it’s been the family’s main source of support.

He needs the loan for his business.  To buy farming supplies, fertilizers and fungicides to provide proper maintenance to his crops so that production will be optimized and sales will increase thus improving his family’s quality of life, especially is oldest son’s who is about to enroll in the university and he hopes to have economic resources sufficient to pay for his professional training offering him a better future.

loans.use: For crop maintenance.

loans.name: Nuevas Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “NUEVAS HORMIGUITAS” es uno grupo que inicia su tercer ciclo en el Centro focal de Panamericana, cuenta con ocho integrantes.  La mesa directiva para este ciclo tiene como presidenta a la señora Maria Isabel,  como tesorera  a la señora Fabiola y como secretaria de actas a la señora Virginia.  Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: costura de chamarras, venta de alfombras, costura de chamarras, artesanía en plumas para bordador ( complemento de trajes para bailar), venta de ropa, chiflería (venta de copal, sullus, incienso, Koa, medicina natural),  venta de leche, artesanía en yeso.

La señora Maria Isabel, presidenta de la banca comunal “Nuevas Hormiguitas” tiene un hogar conformado por su pareja y sus seis hijos.  Con respecto a su negocio  ella  lleva  17 años como chiflera, en el negocio de la venta de medicina natural y productos (incienso, copal, sullus, Koa, dulces, etc.)para ofrendar a la pachamama  (madre tierra).  Ella indica que durante años ha tenido diversos negocios, hasta que decidió quedarse con el negocio de elaboración de mantas y chifleria.  Las compras son realizadas en La Paz y las ventas se realizan en las Ferias de la ciudad de El Alto.   Actualmente solicita Bs.2000.- para la compra de más mercadería.
Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer ella respondió que le gusta que la institución le dé oportunidad a todas las personas que quieren mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The “NUEVAS HORMIGUITAS” (New Little Ants) is a group starting its third cycle in the Panamericana Focal Center.  It has 8 members.  The governing board for this cycle has María Isabel as President, Fabiola as Treasurer and Virginia as Recording Secretary.  The women have a variety of businesses.  Among them are: jacket making, rug sales, feather “bordador” making (accessories for dance costumes), clothing sales, chiflería (sale of various natural curative substances), milk sales, plaster crafts.

María Isabel, President of the “Nuevas Hormiguitas” communal bank, has a home comprised of her partner and six children.  She has been a “chiflera” (natural healer) for 17 years.  She sells natural curative substances and medicinal products to offer to Pachamama (Mother Earth).  

She indicated that over the years she has had a variety of businesses until she decided to stick with sash making and chiflería.  She makes her purchases in La Paz and her sales occur in the city of El Alto’s markets.  She is asking for Bs.2000 to buy more merchandise.

When asked what she liked best about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes that the institution gives opportunities to all the people who want to improve their income.

loans.use: To buy incense and various natural curative substances.

loans.name: Jose Félix

texts.es: El señor  Jose Félix F. A., es un hombre adulto de 55 años que vive en el Barrio San Ignacio, el es un hombre casado que tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad que sobreviven bajo sus propios ingresos y habitan en sus propias casas él es agricultor desde hace mas de 30 años, tiempo en el cual se ha enfrentado a problemas de infecciones de plagas, fue gracias al apoyo de la reforma agraria que lograron iniciarse en esta actividad, y hoy en día solicita una préstamo para la compra de insumos vegetativos,  fertilizantes y fungicidas que permitan un mantenimiento Fito Sanitario Optimo que ayude a la producción y al mejoramiento continuo de sus vidas para un mejor retiro de sus vidas.
texts.en:
Mr. José Félix F. A. is a 55 year old adult man who lives in San Ignacio neighborhood.  He’s married and has six adult children who survive thanks to their own income and live in their own houses.

He has been a farmer for over 30 years.  He has faces insect infestations and it was thanks to the Agrarian Reform that he was able to go into this business.

He is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies, fertilizers and fungicides to provide proper crop maintenance that will help production leading to continuous improvement of their lives to have a better retirement.

loans.use: For crop maintenance.

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
Bienvinida V. is 64 years old, married and supports her family by operating 2 businesses: a variety store and a rice trading business. She lives in Brgy. Binalbagan, Canlaon City, Negros Oriental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 16,000. 

Bienvinida is now borrowing PHP 13,000 to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Bienvinida aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Mary Del Carmen

texts.es: Mary P. Ballesteros es una mujer trabajadora que  vive en la ciudad de Cartagena donde tiene el negocio de comercializar artesanías entre las que se destacan sandalias, mochilas souvenires, aprovechando que su mercado es el de turistas que llegan a la ciudad de Cartagena  desde toda Colombia y el extranjero. Su negocio    está ubicado en el centro histórico  de esta ciudad desde hace aproximadamente 3 años; Mary inició como vendedora de un local especializado en artesanías y hoy ella vende estos productos pero le adicionó calzado tal como lo muestra en la fotografia, en la que no aparece su imagen, porque tiene unas convivicciones no muy comunes que se lo impiden;  ella tambien vende ropa con motivos artesanales  agregados con mucha delicadeza y distinción. Este es su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con su credikiva surtirá su negocio con  souvenires, calzado artesanal y ropa Caribe, la cual  encanta a los turistas que por estas épocas pasean  en  la hermosa Cartagena por ser una de las ciudades turísticas visitada por extranjeros y colombianos de todas las regiones del país. Con sus créditos anteriores ha introducido nuevas mercancías con la cual ha diversificado su oferta; sus ingresos desde entonces han mejorado porque siempre tiene un capital de trabajo para comprar de contado y ganar más a su venta. Su sueño y gran desafio es tener otro punto comercial ubicado en lugares que impacten el turismo y que le proporcionen una ganancia importante.
texts.en:
Mary P. Ballesteros is a hard working woman living in the city of Cartagena where she has a business selling crafts among which sandals, backpacks and souvenirs stand out.  She takes advantage of the fact that the city of Cartagena receives tourists from all of Colombia and from abroad. Her business is located in the historic city center of this city.  She’s had it for about 3 years.

Mary started out as a salesperson in a store specializing in crafts.  Today she sells these products but added footwear like those shown in the photo. Her image does not appear because she has some not too common beliefs that prohibit this.  She also sells clothes with elegantly and distinctively added artisanal touches.

This is her second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use her Kiva loan to stock her business with souvenirs, artisanal footwear and Caribbean clothing which tourists that travel through beautiful Cartagena during this season, love.  Cartagena is one of the most visited tourist destinations by both Colombians from all parts of the country as well as by foreigners.

Her previous loans were used to introduce new merchandise that diversified her stock.  Income since then has improved because she always has working capital available to buy paying cash and earn more from her sales.  Her dream and great challenge is to have an additional sales point at a site heavily impacted by tourists in order to have important profits.

loans.use: To stock her business with souvenirs, artisanal footwear and Caribbean clothing which tourists love.

loans.name: Sum's Group

texts.en:
Twenty members form this village loan. They are located in Akreiy Ksatr village in Kandal province. This loan group selected 66-year-old Mr. Sum M. as the village bank president. The members of this village will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mr. Sum M. and his wife, Mrs. Sokhon, are farmers who own a piece of land that they use to cultivate citronella grass. They do not have enough money to cultivate it. So, Mr. Sum M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. Besides farming, Mr. Sum M. is also a horse cart driver. 
This couple has two children who are the farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides to grow citronella grass.

loans.name: Kang's Group

texts.en:
Eighteen members form this village loan; they live in Akreiy Ksatr village in Kandal province. Mrs. Kang S., who is 56 years old, was selected as the village bank president by the loan group members. Each member of this village will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Kang S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate citronella grass. She lacks enough money to cultivate it. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy citronella seeds. The rest of the loan will be used to cultivate eggplant. Her husband, Mr. Chhay Leang, works as a construction worker and earns a small salary with which to support his family.

This couple has four children: two are employed in a casino club and the others are farmers.

loans.use: To buy citronella seeds for cultivating.

loans.name: Hernaldo

texts.es:
El Sr. S. de 42 años de edad vive con su esposa que es ama de casa y sus dos hijos que estudian y tambien le ayudan en las actividades de la finca.

El Sr. S. se dedica a los quehaceres de su finca y a la produccion y comercializacion de Ganado, siendo esto lo que le genera sus ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia, solicita su 2do. crèdito para compra de ternero de desarrollo.  

su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia permanezca bien unida y que sus hijos estudien para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Mr. S., 42, lives with his wife who is a housewife and their two children who are in school but also help with the farming chores.

He is a cattleman.  This is how he earns income to support his family.  He is asking for his second loan to buy a calf to raise.

His greatest wish is that his family stays together and that his children finish their schooling so that they will be upstanding citizens.

loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Mrs. Sor S., 63, is a widowed mother who currently lives in the province of Kompong Tom. She sells Khmer cakes and a few products such as fast food and soft drinks. Mrs. Sor S. generates an income of approximately $2.50 per day by selling Khmer cakes. She has no life partner because her husband died of senility four years ago. She is blessed with nine children; one is single and the other eight are married. One of her children assists her in the business.

Mrs. Sor S. wishes to invest in her business by picking up items around her community, in order to sell for the other villagers and make additional profit. However, she doesn’t have a vehicle because she lacks the funds to buy one. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase a used motor-trailer to transport her items.

loans.use: to purchase a used motor-trailer to transport her items.

loans.name: Tumbayar

texts.en: Tumbayar S. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Hovd province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest two daughters are unemployed and her youngest three children attend the local school. Tumbayar and her husband operate a cafe in a rented space at the local market in their town. Their cafe specializes in making a variety of traditional Mongolian meals using livestock intestines and is a popular dining establishment in their community. She started her cafe in 2005 and has gained significant experience over the years. Tumbayar is a modest and kind-hearted woman. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to increase her working capital for the cafe.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Lesther Antonio

texts.es:
O., vive en Juigalpa con su esposa Mirna G. Centeno quien le ayuda en los gastos familiares, tienen tres hijos de 2, 4 y ocho añitos; Lesther es Conductor, de donde obtiene sus ingresos mensuales para los gastos familiares y sus obligaciones de pago. 

Solicita un credito para mejorar su Vivienda que poco a poco ha venido Construyendo  y se siente muy agradecido con la atencion brindada por nuestra parte.  

Su mayor Sueño es llegar a construir toda su vivienda con mejores comodidades para que su Familia goce de una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Mr. O. lives in Juigalpa with his wife, Mirna González Centeno, who helps him with family expenses.  They have three children who are 2, 4 and 8 years of age.  Lesther is a driver and earns good monthly income for family expenses and to repay loans.

He is asking for a loan to make some home improvements to the house he’s been building little by little.  He feels very grateful for the attention we’ve given him.

His greatest dream is to complete his house with all the comforts so that his family will enjoy a dignified home.

loans.use: For home improvement.

loans.name: Nuon's Group

texts.en:
There are 21 participants in this group loan, all residents of Akreiy Ksatr village in Kandal province. This village loan selected Mr. Nuon S. as the village bank president. Each participant will use his or her portion of the loan to support their own specific purpose. 
 
Mr. Nuon S. is 42 years old and a farmer.  He cultivates citronella grass for a living, but he lacks the money to farm.  He is seeking a loan to buy citronella seeds and fertilizer to cultivate his crop. His wife, Mrs. Sun Huor, 43 years old, works as a cleaner for a company. 

This couple has three children who are the students in the local schoO. and also support their parents' farming.

loans.use: To buy citronella seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheeting to replace his kitchen's roof.

loans.name: Lhagvajav

texts.en: Lhagvajav D. is 42 years old and lives with husband in their apartment in Hovd province, Mongolia. Lhagvajav operates a business making clothes out of her home. She began her business in 1992 after graduating as a seamstress in Russia in 1987. She makes a variety of clothes according to her customers’ specifications. After many years of owning this business, she has gained much experience and designs high quality clothing items. Lhagvajav is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more fabrics and materials for her sewing business.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics and materials

loans.name: Roen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Roen M. is 38 years old, and she is the village bank president for this loan, selected by its twenty members. The loan participants live in Kouk Trab village in Kandal province. With this loan, they hope to increase their incomes and improve their families' standards of living. 
 
Mrs. Roen M. is a tailor.  She works at home, and she has been able to earn some profits to support her family. Her business is going well, and she would like to expand it.  She will use her portion of the loan to buy more fabrics to increase her current business.

Mrs. Roen M. is a widow.  She has an 8 year-old child who attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy more fabric

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben R. (right in photo) has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $2 per day.  Her husband is a fisherman. 

Ben is the mother of four children, who work at various occupations.  They contribute some of their incomes to help the family meet its daily expenses. One of her children sells salt and potatoes in his village.  He wants to sell to other villages to earn more income.  Unfortunately, he has no vehicle.

To solve this problem, Ben is applying for loan for her child to buy a horse and trailer in order to transport his products.

loans.use: To buy horse, and trailer in order to transport his product for selling.

loans.name: Suvd

texts.en:
Suvd R. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Kharhorin, ancient Mongolian empire's capital. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son attends a local secondary school. 

Suvd and her husband operate a tourist camp business in their town. Since 2001, Suvd and her husband have worked as translators and guides and have gained a great deal of experience. After years of hard work, they were able to open their own guest house, called Suvd, and provide small tours to show Mongolia's natural beauty to travelers.  The couple owns 6 gers in their tour camp where travelers stay and rest. They do not have their own car, so they rent cars to show tourists around. 

Suvd is a very hardworking and clever woman.  She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a car for their business, so that they can transport their customers through the beautiful landscape.

loans.use: To purchase a car

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of sixteen members, located in Kouk Trab village, in Kandal province.  Members selected Sok P., 37, as its president. Each members will use their portions of the loan to support different purposes. 

Sok and his wife, Him have one child who is a student in the local school.  They sell Chinese noodle soup.  They would like to increase their income to improve their living conditions.  Sok would like to ask for a loan to buy more Chinese noodles to enlarge his business.

loans.use: To buy more Chinese noodles to enlarge his business activities.

loans.name: Christian Daniel

texts.es: EL SEÑOR CHRISTIAN DANIEL R. P. TIENE ACTUALMENTE 22 AÑOS, ES SOLTERO Y TRABAJA COMO CHOFER DE UNA UNIDAD MENOR DE TRANSPORTE (MOTOTAXI) EN EL CUAL TRABAJA TODO EL DIA PARA AYUDAR CON LA ECONOMIA DE SU CASA EN DONDE VIVE CON SU MADRE Y SUS HERMANOS, NECESITA EL PRESTAMO PARA EL MANTENIENTO DE SU UNIDAD DE TRABAJO Y REGULARIZAR SU LICENCIA DE CONDUCIR.
texts.en:
Mr. Christian Daniel R. Peña is 22 years old.  He’s single and works as a driver of a minor transportation vehicle (Moto taxi).  He works all day to help his home’s economy where he lives with his mother and siblings.

He needs the loan for vehicle maintenance and to regularize his driver’s license.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair and to regularize his driver's license.

loans.name: Leng's Group

texts.en:
Five people form this group loan.  They all live in Preaek Samraong village, Kandal province.  The group selected Leng S., 58, as its president.  Members will use their portion of the loan to support different purposes. 

Leng earns her living by selling groceries and vegetables in the local village.  She decided to ask for a loan to buy a store and more vegetables to sell.  Her husband, Thun, stays at home and also helps his wife.  They have five children; one is employed in a casino club, another is a laborer and the others are students who also help their mother.

loans.use: To buy a store for selling grocery and vegetable.

loans.name: Fredy Miguel

texts.es: EL SEÑOR FREDY MIGUEL R. O. ES UN PADRE DE FAMILIA QUE TIENE EN LA ACTUALIDAD 52 AÑOS, SU ESPOSA LA SEÑORA JULIA BRAVO ES AMA DE CASA Y AYUDA A SU ESPOSO EN LA CRIANZA DE SUS HIJOS, YA QUE EL MENOR DE ELLOS ESTA AUN EN EL COLEGIO, EL SEÑOR FREDY CUENTA CON UNA BODEGA QUE SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO AL COSTADO DE UN COLEGIO, ES POR ELLO QUE SUS PRINCIPALES CLIENTES SON LOS ALUMNOS DEL COLEGIO, NECESITA EL PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA DE SU BODEGA.
texts.en: Fredy Miguel R. O. is 52 years old and is head of his household, his wife is Julia Bravo and she is a housewife who helps her husband raising their children since the youngest is still in school.  Fredy has a store which is located by a school, this is why his primary clients are students from the school.  He needs the loan to invest in merchandise for his store.

loans.use: Needs the loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Bayarsaikhan is 31, married, and has one daughter who is 7 years old. His wife works at a construction company as an assistant builder. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. 

Bayarsaikhan has been operating a taxi business since his plastic bag retail business failed in 2006. He has 3 times taken micro loans from us and had paid them back on time. He has gained much experience in last 4 years transporting people. Early in the morning his work day begins by taking his wife and daughter to their work and school. He is planning to finish building his uncompleted wooden house and increase his working capital. 

Bayrasaikhan is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a better car.

loans.use: To purchase a better car

loans.name: An's Group

texts.en:
Four members are forming this group loan.  They are living in Paraen Leu village, in Kandal province. Mrs. An H., a 55-year-old married woman, is the leader of this group, having been selected by its members.   With the loans, they hope that the income will increase to improve their family's living.  

Mrs. An H. and her husband, Mr. Try Nhorch, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate different vegetables for a living.  However, she doesn’t have enough money to grow this farm. Thus, Mrs. An H. would like to ask for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to cultivate different vegetables.

This couple has three children who all are farmers, and they also cultivate different vegetables.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for farm

loans.name: Phin's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five members. They are located in Peam Reang Kraom village in Kandal province. This group selected Mrs. Phin H., a 38-year-old married woman, as the group leader.  They will each use their portion of this loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Phin H. is a farmer who owns 1.50-hectare of rice field that she uses to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Reth Ren, 40 years old, works as a motorbike repairer who is able to earn some profit to support his family. Now the motorbike repair business doesn’t have enough spare parts to support it. So Mrs. Phin H. would like to ask for a loan to purchase spare parts to support her husband's motorcycle repair business. 

This couple has two children who are students in the local school and also help their mother in farming.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for motorcycle repair business

loans.name: Leak's Group

texts.en:
Seventeen members are forming this village loan.  They are living in Akreiy Ksatr village in Kandal province. The members selected Mrs. Leak S., 50 years old, as the group leader for this loan.  The members of this village loan will use their portion to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Leak S. and her husband, Mr. Me Vatha, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow citronella for a living.  However, they do not have enough money to support this farming. So Mrs. Leak S. would like to ask for a loan to buy citronella seeds and fertilizers to cultivate citronella. 

This couple has three children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory and the other is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy citronella seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nilda's Group

texts.en:
Nilda Y. is from the village of Magsaysay Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Nilda is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Millions.

Nilda is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nilda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general clothing services to local community members. Nilda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nilda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nilda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nilda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics & materials

loans.name: Shaadiinsa's Group

texts.en:
Shaadiinsa B. is the leader of this group. She is 45 years old and married.  Shaadiinsa is the resident of Kadamjai, a small town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Her husband works as a power engineer. Together they are raising two sons and three daughters. Their two older daughters work in Russia and the other children are students. Shadiinsa works as a school teacher. She also breeds, raises, and sells cattle, from which she earns 3000 soms per month. With money that she receives from this loan, she wants to purchase a calf to breed. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a calf
